clean_text: looking for someone who has been through something similar grief panic stress hi everyone i am hoping to hear some opinions on whether people think i had a panic attack or not i know that no one here is a doctor so i guess i just want to tell my story and see if this is has happened to anyone else i guess i should start with saying i have really good years versus really bad years so i have never been officially medicated for anxiety because i somehow always snap myself out of it i had a really bad bout with some panic back in 2018 because i had hashimoto s disease and did not know it once that got figured out things normalized though i carried some medical ptsd around from bad doctors and experiences just trying to get that diagnosed and medication dosage correct i have had a therapist since that time in september 2024 my mother died after a three year fight with a horrible cancer somehow i held it in the road because i m the only daughter and the show would not go on without me after making sure my family still acted as normal as possible i had a bad case of health anxiety in january 2025 i got everything looked at and was normal again by march in may my dad started calling me complaining of something growing on his face i m four hours from him i pushed him to doctors from afar and they all thought it was a tooth problem turns out it was also cancer he had a major removal surgery in july 2024 and then radiated his follow up scan is tomorrow the thought of this cancer not be gone and losing my remaining parent is killing me on top of that my husband started traveling for work much more leaving me alone a lot more this past year for some reason i am scared to be alone i ve expressed this to him and while he does the have the option of not traveling on every trip he does so anyway because i think the rest of his team are incapable of making presentations this is actually true because i ve heard the phone calls read his work emails and texts it s not a lie to get away from me lol in october my boss basically decided that he was going to beef with the longest tenured employee at our office over some mistakes she had made and something else really petty it was a long drawn out show that ended up with her being let go on the day she was let go it was my birthday and i was in florida it made me incredibly anxious because she and i were friends and confidants in the work place i worried she would retaliate and reveal some not so nice things i ve said about working there my boss also called me all day that day to rehash her conversation with her i m sort of like second or third in command there also i am in charge of celebrating everyone s birthday in the office and everyone forgot mine after florida i had a two week sinus infection all of this pretty much places us at thanksgiving where i cook for my whole family decorate my parents home i still call it that even though my mom is gone for christmas and place flowers on her grave it consumes the whole four days i have off and then my husband and i have to make the four hour drive back on the following day i return to work and admittedly i m a little tense because i worried the laid off coworker would show on her last day and my husband was leaving on the next day for a work trip after lunch out of nowhere i had some palpitations and got really scared i thought i was going to die in the office i called for 9 1 1 and an ambulance came and of course i was tachy with a high bp when they came we went to the er trop levels good ekg good ecgs good thyroid number was almost 12 they really didn t say much of anything to me and just told me to follow up with my endo and pcp since then i ve had more pvcs and such a hard time coping thinking i have a heart condition or something i wore a monitor last week and am waiting on the results if you ve made it this far thank you so much i just want to know if you think my life is overly stressful and could cause this hiccup or if you ve experienced something similar also i don t want to give away too many details on what i do for a living on here but just now that i had to get a professional degree for three years work in an office and i may have to wear a suit pretty frequently to argue about money

muscle fatigue and low energy somewhere around mid high school i started noticing that my arms and legs would get sore and tired very quickly this happened while biking and exercising and i was constantly exhausted often falling asleep during classes despite trying to stay awake nowadays it affects everyday life walking up stairs or working with my arms above shoulder height makes my muscles feel like they have no energy forcing me to rest even at work this physically holds me back after screwing above my head i often need to lower my arms for a few seconds before i can continue when i wake up my back and chest feel quickly fatigued and sore often with a mild feeling of breath hunger or oxygen shortage i also have frequent muscle twitches people notice that i sigh sometimes and think i m irritated but i feel like i m just trying to get enough air i struggle heavily with concentration at work to the point where colleagues notice it coffee helps somewhat i fall asleep suddenly during meetings lessons or while using public transport even in noisy environments it comes on abruptly i ve also had derealisation since primary school at some point i became afraid i had a muscle or neuromuscular disease after seeing many doctors i was referred to the hospital emgs of my limbs respiratory tests and extensive blood work all came back normal recently i was tested for chronic hyperventilation and scored 100 on all parts my carbon dioxide levels were clearly too low this surprised me as i never noticed myself hyperventilating i ve always known i have social anxiety sometimes severe but i never expected it to impact my physical health this much i m still unsure whether all of this can be explained by chronic hyperventilation at the same time i m at least somewhat relieved and even a bit glad that there is finally something that has been diagnosed hearing from others with similar experiences would really help

prozac to lexapro hi everyone so i ve been on prozac for most of my adult life about 25 years i m not depressed but i still have severe chronic anxiety i have xanax for flare ups but my psychiatrist suggested switching from prozac to lexapro she said lexapro targets the anxiety better so last week i began to decrease prozac and started lexapro anyone else switch meds

my anxiety is so bad pertaining to my health and i feel like i m going insane thinking about my mortality i am scared to death i have cervical cancer because i have hpv and had a surgery to remove precancerous cells but never went back after that because of my phobia and it s been 6yrs and i haven t even had health insurance anyway so i ve been doing at home tests and while they ve all been negative i still wonder what if and it s only bugging me because i have occasional ovary pain but thats it and i m super religious so i ve been praying and while i feel it s just my anxiety i still worry i m going to die in a year or two

stress and chronic tension 2 years now im so stiff and tight it makes it hard to breathe ive done research some saying if you try and workout your nervous system will try and stiffen even more others saying you have to live life like you nor ally would that for me means lifting heavy hiking playing hockey etc i need this tension gone

work christmas party work christmas party today there s a gift exchange thing where you bring a gift 25 limit and it s like a white elephant style exchange i bought a stupid little christmas mug with socks in it and put a little jar of homemade mixed spiced nuts in the bag as well i feel so anxious such a stupid gift i work in a finance office so people are probably going to be gifting good shit one of the partners i know is doing a bottle of wine i m so fuckin embarrassed man considering going home sick before the party starts god i hate work parties why not just give us the day off
women who ve taken zoloft what was your experience women who ve taken zoloft what was your experience any weight gain any changes in libido or sex life

work and self purpose anxiety hi this will be a longer as i need to write this out i m 33 and i haven t got any strong tendency to any career in my life i have never really examined what i like when i was younger as i was raised in small city in central europe where wasnt much to do so i chose college pragmatically i was good in math and logical thinking so i went to economics college there i found out i dont like finance accounting or anything similar i moved to city close to my family where it sector was booming so i started as application administrator i was quite good at it but it wasnt still my calling then i wanted to earn more so i changed teams and technology that wasnt good decision as team wasnt good and new technology too hard to learn i quit and tried to sell designs online i decided i wanted to learn graphic design as i was interested about etsy redbubble on youtube i found out it is not as easy to be successful as youtube videos trying to show you after half year i went back to it as i needed money again wrong team terrible application with lot of escalations i quit again and officialy my work anxiety began as i look retrospectively i tried to sell on etsy one more time putting all my energy into it and to learning graphic design for 4 months again not successful enough i tried to find job in graphic design or marketing as there were only few job opportunities for self taught graphic designer with little experience i found job in marketing where was stressful environment with worcoholic boss and toxic team my work anxiety fully developed as i was vomiting in the morning before work and went to psychiatrist now i am taking meds and tried to work in retail as shop assistant but i hated it so now i am jobless and i write a book fantasy scifi new adult genre which i like to do but still i dont earn money doing it no idea what to do next i am thinking about going to psychic lol have you ever felt lost in your life and how to overcome that
psychedellic does how many of you get treated with psychedellic name for different anxiety disorder were on antidepressants for long time before gets treated with it

does this happen to anyone else i have noticed that when i have days off i have a lot of anxiety during the first few days it s only the first few days and then i am back to normal i tried to pin point why i am sad and anxious and the only things i am able to think of is i miss some of my coworkers or maybe the change of routine i do have the same anxiety the first few days when back to work i have come to dread taking days off because i know i will have anxiety during and after the days off i feel like i am ungrateful because i don t enjoy my days off to the fullest and i start to feel guilty i want to know how to deal with it it is normal to feel this way

anxiety was the smoke not the fire i want to share my story as far as professionals are concerned i have a general anxiety disorder diagnosed at 33 nothing before that one period of stress when i was 18 but that s only because i wanted some time off work i could never put into words what i was feeling from that very first whoosh at 33 which then caused panic like someone took my breath away and tilted everything 90 degrees for a split second and i disassociated those first 3 days i was a mess crying on the phone to my doctor about what this was was i dying full impending doom then years of being told its anxiety i guess it was but the anxiety wasn t the start of the river the anxiety was further downstream something was causing this fluctuation causing me to be wired 24 7 and i tried everything i studied my degree in psychology i had to reaffirm my identity i wanted to understand myself so i delved into my past my traumas my mistakes if this was anxiety then there was a cause if i knew the cause then there was a solution i wrote and i wrote and i wrote i jumped feet first into key life changing moments in my life finding out i was a donor baby losing my mum my marriage breaking down some childhood trauma events i tried every herbal remedy going i read books on vitamin d being the cause calcium magnesium water intake needing to be more a whole book on bloody water electrolytes books on b12 b6 k2 potassium salt sunlight morning sun evening sun circadian rhythm sleep cycles lunar cycles i got into breathing exercises pranayama nadi shodhana self talking self soothing self parenting birdsong sounds of the forest the sound of my own voice reassuring me tre trauma releasing excercising patting prodding yoga high intense training mammalian dive reflex cold face packs breathing breathwork facial muscle changes in humans from processed soft foods cognitive behaviour therapy talking therapy touch therapy hypnosis it became a perpential cycle it became an obsession a health anxiety in its own right the search for the cause became the cause itself it was a minefield just when i thought i d mastered it 2 days later i was back on my ass all of these things worked a little but only if i balanced all these things absolutely perfectly i could have a good day but there was too many variables and i d never have two good days in a row maybe they worked because i wanted them to work maybe they were placebo i became an expert in talking about identity i was adamant it was linked to that with going through my own identity crisis a few years earlier i talked about identity like i had it all figured out i didn t and still don t diazepam was lovely but i ve seen what a benzo addiction looks like and i don t want that i was allowed 28 per year generally it was the only relief i got having to balance 28 blocks of 4 hour relief 112 hours per year of relief i had the stigma of having anxiety the looks you get the comments of being weak the huffs from people when you decline to do something the empathy sometimes but also the disappointment in their eyes all the time i was going through this i held down a job i climbed my career although i m known for being firey i m a good dad and believe in being a morally good person i started a successful relationships but no one every described me as patient it took everything i had to not sit in the corner and rock exhausting is an understatement the more i masked the more it took out of me the worse i was the next day it began to shape me i was no longer care free i was no longer the funny guy people knew me as i was becoming bitter and defensive the fear of it caused fear itself the anxiety became about the anxiety it was getting worse i had a full on panic attack trying to go into a theatre with my daughter the shame i felt as a grown man that i couldn t emotionally get through the door because i was crying and my 10 year old daughter saw that she didn t know that i d had whooshs all day and was already suffering even with diazepam i found myself not wanting to go anywhere where i was trapped either physically like a plane or socially at a theatre 7 years of being told i had anxiety you ve got anxiety some people just get it a few times i doubted myself there was a period where i just accepted that i did have it but it always sat at the back of my mind this is an imbalance of something you ve just got to find out what it is i started to rename it i didn t have anxiety i had an imbalance to my nervous system my nervous system was firing constantly when no danger was present it wasn t me that was broken it was my nervous system most of this was internal i struggled internally a lot and wouldn t tell anyone because to say it out loud would it give it a voice i felt like absolute shit and i didn t know why i would catatrophise on my own health i would seem really impatient from an outside point of view and i would overthink things they didn t know that by the time we started talking at 10am i d already done a whole day of fighting and flighting christmas was always a difficult time for me and when i consumed most of my diazepam the deadlines the gifts the parties the foods the alcohol the responsibilities of being a parent and is it enough alcohol was a gamble sometimes it provided relief sometimes it took a worst turn when i was already drunk the hangxiety was terrible i was due a minor operation and in my pre op i had my blood pressure taken but this time they took it seriously and kept me for an hour to see if it would go down it didn t my highest on that day was 190 125 i asked the consultant if this would explain anxiety and he answered in a way that made me feel like i m an idiot for never even considering it not once did i ever suspect high blood pressure was the cause i m a healthcare professional and its constantly documented that hypertension is a silent killer no symptoms no clues well it wasn t so silent with me every time i had my blood pressure taken they marked it as white coat hypertension they said things like oh that s high but you are nervous and you have just walked in here i never made the link because there is so little evidence out there that i ve seen i m 4 weeks into a new blood pressure tablet and i haven t felt like this in 7 years to the point where i ve even tried to internalise to see if the anxiety is in there and it isn t i ve gone out to dinner a party a work meeting with 40 people in one room with the exit on the other side an elevator and all at my worst time of the year nothing not a quiver is there no negative thoughts about being trapped no dizziness no surreal moments no dissociation i actually felt nerves the other day like real nerves butterflies in the stomach real nerves for a real situation i haven t felt that in years whenever i should have felt that my body just dumped a shit tonne of adrenaline into my blood stream and then i d crash a few hours after being an impatient dickhead i also felt thirst another thing i haven t felt in years unless it was extreme my body didn t have time for these little introspective clues it s been fighting since 2018 i feel like i have my life back and i m incredibly proud of myself for living those 7 years on full flight or fight and still managing to hold a life together although i am cold now 7 years of constantly being too hot and adrenalated and now i m out the other side it s bloody freezing and i don t have the wardrobe for it anymore in hindsight yes i do have anxiety but only when my blood pressure is reading an average of 180 120 on the bright side at least i know how i act under enormous pressure incoherant rushing everything at 90mph dizzy and detached with the occasional crying episode but i never ran or quit and i soooo wanted to i m sharing this because i know how important it is to read success stories and to feel seen to know there is a light at the end of the tunnel and for some maybe vit d is the reason maybe tre will be the key to your trauma healing if i hadn t had a proactive doctor then i would have been on this path for years without finding the answer i think our own anxiety is worth exploring some times it is a physical reason other times we are our own worst enemy and the cause is our own internal thought pattern and coping mechanisms its about balance trying something new but not obsessing over it this is not an argument against anxiety i lived it for 7 years and i felt it every god damn day constant impending doom and my soul is tired but hopefully that door has closed now and i can continue to be an advocate for understanding it this is an argument for curiosity when it starts late and feels physical this might not be the end of it i may be back in 3 months debating whether it s better to breath out for 4 seconds or 6 but it feels different this time and it s been miles longer than any previous attempt keep going there s always a light

my brief guide to temporary long term alleviation of physical symptoms i ve been dealing with anxiety for most of my conscious life and for a long time i didn t realise it was anxiety i m sure a lot of people can relate to that what has remained is my physical reaction following or preceding bouts of anxiety perhaps the most disconcerting aspect of anxiety for me at least as i ve built up techniques and such over the years i figured i d share them i really hope that this post can give at least one person some relief if not provide a post for people to discuss their own techniques : 1 vapour rub peppermint oil or peppermint smelling things like toothpaste lavender rubbing alcohol good for: stomach throat and chest symptoms what a life saver as someone who has a very intense sense of smell i find smells that are either positively nostalgic like vapour rub and the memories of taking a sick day off of school and watching youtube while it rains outside or just calming for my body like peppermint or lavender to be helpful in grounding intense smells such as the eucalyptus methanol of vapour rub or peppermint can actually help you feel the sensation of air hitting the back of your throat this can be very assuring if you suffer from throat tightness globes sensations or feelings of discomfort when breathing this for me at least can have a run off affect for my chest tightness and help alleviate that rubbing alcohol and peppermint have also helped with nausea this is very old knowledge that was used by many generations of people don t knock it till you try it 2 ginger tea lollies pickle raw good for: stomach symptoms classic any form of ginger has been known to calm the stomach especially as you feel an acidic bubbling typically relief is within 5 10 mins but this can vary my preferred forms are: ginger tea around 2x2inch piece of peeled ginger root with a squeeze of lime juice a piece of lime and honey as desired ginger lollies gin gins are amazing and come in many different strengths the extra strong is my fav pickled ginger yes the type you often get with sushi or even raw small small amounts to start this is a desperate measure 3 breathe in and then breathe some more good for: throat and chest symptoms massive credit to whoever posted this on reddit some years ago it s a technique i can t live without when my respiratory symptoms play up here s what you do: breathe in through the nose all the way until your chest feels like it s filled with air then take one more big sniff then breathe out through the mouth i often feel instant relief but rinse and repeat as needed 4 heat packs hot showers good for: stomach throat and chest symptoms heat on areas that feel tense or cramping can often provide near immediate relief this can also feel like a grounding sensation which is particularly good when paired with breathing techniques 5 legs up ladies good for: head symptoms so one night i went to a concert i decided that eating beforehand wasn t in my best interests and well i collapsed towards the end thankfully i fainted surrounded by a group of nurses if there s any chance you are seeing this i m still grateful and i really hope i don t ruin your night : so what did they do they placed my calves onto their legs and let the blood flow return and i awakened this is now a trick i do when i feel dizzy or uncomfortable in my head so all you do is: lay down flat next to an elevated surface couch is usually easiest if not a few stacked pillows and place your legs onto that surface making sure your hips are still on the ground imagine the letter z but if that middle line was straight stay there for a few minutes and let your body do its thing 6 got any games on your phone good for: general anxiety symptoms unfortunately i was lucky enough to be stuck in an elevator once what got me through candy crush sometimes the brain just needs an immediate distraction and it might not always work but it could also help big up the youtube playables they re quick simple fast and vary in demand for concentration thought this can often have a run off affect to your physical symptoms aiding as a distraction until the feeling has passed 7 the magic pack good for: all i really suggest that if you like these techniques or if you have some of your own always take an anxiety pack with you it s always a good feeling to have something you can rely on so even if it s just one item i really suggest having something with you to be your lifeline in the unlikely event of sudden anxiety i hope you found something interesting or even something genuinely helpful there are so many other techniques i really suggest commenting to help share the community spirit and bring hope anxiety can be debilitating but even if for a brief moment there could be a way for you to have some relief and i hope i ve helped in that journey 3

top right molar extraction tomorrow and i m going crazy tomorrow morning i ll be having my first tooth extraction and it s a top molar i haven t been to the dentist in a while and just found some cavities need 1 second molar top right extracted and some fillings 3 other teeth we ll just be using local anesthetic on it the fact that its such a huge tooth and in the top right of my mouth makes me insanely anxious and scared i m also scared of the long term effects on my face i m 21 if that matters

0 5mg lorazepam prescribed as od prn by my psychiatrist 5 weeks ago i know od prn means once daily as needed but if i feel it is needed every day due to acute anxiety misery on morning awakening can it be taken once every day answers coming up on goooogle an ai to this question are confusing me and are often contradictory and the emphasis placed on all the possible problems caused by taking it dose every day are terrifying me i know many people take much larger doses than 0 5mg and for months even years despite medical guidelines including uk nhs that lorazepam should only be taken for 2 4 weeks it s been prescribed to me while venlafaxine is taking its time kicking in hopefully to full efficacy for me but that can take a few weeks or more longer i ve taken it for 5 weeks now but at a low dose of 75mg per day along with 15mg mirtazapine i would appreciate replies from fellow group members about this thank you ps: i m age 66 female and healthy as far as i know in every way except depression anxiety which have been plaguing me for 15 months since my husband died :

i hit the back of my head and now anxiety is killing me around two hours ago i was in class sitting on my chair and balancing back and forth as i was chatting with my friends as the break comes and everyone starts to get up i lose balance and fall backwards and hit the back of my head against the table behind me it didnt hurt much or anything i just got up with a laugh and went on with the rest of the day but honestly anxiety is eating me alive that i might have a brain injury the pain was very mild and now it has went away and i showed no other symptoms but despite multiple people reassuring me that its all good i cant stop myself from stressing should i go to the er
anxiety and digestive issues does anybody else experience digestive issues and reflux when getting very anxious what do you do then

i had a realisation on monday i put tw as flair as i would prefer to be safe and not trigger someone s anxiety i was speaking with a friend i ve known for about 10 years now on monday while we were talking the realisation that this is the first face to face conversation that i ve had with someone in weeks he asked how long i ve been doing this and i realised after the covid lockdowns i never really left that isolation for context for the past five years i ve practically confined myself to one spot depending on where i am i barely leave the house even if work requires me to go to the office i have been to the office a collective five times this year out of a required two three times a week when i caught up with my friend i had my blinds and windows open to let light and fresh air in yet when i m alone i shut my entire house my only real light sources being my work laptop and personal computer now i know that s not a healthy lifestyle and i do not recommend it for context i m 27 and i ve dealt with anxiety and other things for close to 15 years at this point all that to say i went out on the request of my friend tonight to a party and i ve never felt so uncomfortable as i did at that christmas party i wasn t in my space i couldn t play the new game i bought coe33 and i was around people i know who care about me but i just couldn t stop myself from isolating in a corner away from everyone it s a first step and it was uncomfortable as fuck but while a part of me wishes i d stayed home another part of me is glad i could see everyone again sorry if this breaks any rules or anything wasn t my intention at all so if mods remove it that s fine have a good night day everyone

been at the er for 6 hours i was feeling like id rather die then stay how i felt before so i went to the er its been 6 hours and they haven t seen me i ve been in a hellish state due to taking sertraline on sunday idk what to do i cant live like this everything hurts and they still haven t seen me

does anyone else get crazy anxiety when anyone calls straight bs my phone rings and i m immediately preparing for bad news i get deep anxious and then it always turn out to be a call for absolutely nothing anyone else

living with undiagnosed chronic anxiety feels like a never ending panic tw: existential questions hi i won t disclose my name but im a 16 year old african girl who is dealing with undiagnosed chronic anxiety and frequent panic attacks the reason i mentioned that im african is cuz no one takes your anxiety seriously in here psychological care therapy is almost impossible to find that s why i say undiagnosed instead of diagnosed so that u understand my situation better i don t even know where to start every morning i wake up hoping i won t feel panicky like i m bracing myself for my own brain it s exhausting some days my thoughts spiral so fast that i feel like i m losing control and even small things can trigger a wave of panic i get these overwhelming what if loops about life and existence and sometimes i can t stop questioning everything like why i exist where do we come from or what s the point of it all it s not that i want to give up or anything it s just tiring i feel trapped inside my own head constantly fighting my body and brain just to feel normal for a few minutes even when i know it s anxiety and not reality it doesn t stop the fear or the racing thoughts i just wish my brain would let me rest and i want cry so bad right now because i see my peers living normally while i struggle with this anxiety and panic attacks i had my last panic attack last month and this year i had a total of 5 6 panic attacks it genuinely hurts to live like this im not going to lie sometimes i wish i was dealing with other mental illnesses other than chronic anxiety i feel misunderstood as well because of the thoughts that cause me to have anxiety and panic attacks very few people struggle the same way i do and it makes me feel way worse and lonely and i feel like my thoughts are very convincing and i m discovering some truth no one knows

please help what s happening to me is this ocd am i going crazy i m desperate and i don t understand okay so i ve been struggling a lot for like 4 months now and it s not like it came out of nowhere but nothing like this has ever happened to me before so i m very confused when i started uni i struggled with health anxiety and panic attacks then agoraphobia but all that went away after a while now i m struggling again but completely differently i d like to preface this story by saying that i never struggled with intrusive thoughts or anything like that when i was younger the first time something like that even occured to me was when there was that tripophobia thing circling the internet where i thought how peculiar it was that something that didn t make me uncomfortable before now made me uncomfortable because someone told me it should then a thought crossed my mind that if it can happen with this it can happen with other things but not much changed then years later i was learning about ocd for a class in uni and i got so scared of the thought that it could be possible to implant anything you want into your mind and that s where all hell began for me i d have a random thought and be like oh no what if this sticks now i d also like to add that i ve suffered with some tics here and there and what rly scared me was implementing ticks so i would get rly scared and then start doing the tick because i can t get it out of my head and so i d prove my own theory that i can implement anything into my own head just like that i implemented into my own mind that i won t be able to sleep because a friend told me that she keeps waking up early unable to fall back asleep and since then i have had fear of sleeping on and off and even issues with failling asleep but not because i m not tired but because i kept jolting awake in fear another thing i ve also had big freakouts in the past about random stuff i implemented inside my mind one time i made myself feel like i can t speak and i would legit struggle to start speaking but i could still forget about it if i plays a game or something but that went away too so basically i ve had anxious freakouts and hyperfocus on things for a while it s like i always needed something to be anxious about that said none of that existed before that big revelation that you can implement anything in my last year of uni but sadly things got really bad for me this summer in mid august i started having stomach pains after prolonged stress in life and at work i had countless labs and after a few weeks i was diagnosed with ibs which got me extremely scared since i googled and learned it was incurable i got very anxious lost my appetite and got hyperfixated on fixing the issue after a while it was all that i could think about i was so scared and frustrated that i couldn t get it out of my head that it quickly turned into a fear of not being able to get it out of my head and relax which is so stupid i know it got so bad that i was prescribed prazepam which i took for like 2 months i want to add that even at my worst in the past when i got prescribed benzos i didn t really take them and only took a little when i couldn t sleep before an exam or so prazepam helped a bit but i was still scared hyperfocused on my stomach crying several times a day and became disinterested in anything else i got off it because you re only supposed to take it for 2 months a few days before i stopped taking it i experienced a worsening with my stomach so i started extreme dieting again and slowly started tapering off the drug days later i completely lost my appetite then i got scared what might happen if i now thought about appetite loss every time i ate and got anxiety because of it so my appetite would never return and it would be the same as sleep this spiraled very quickly this part happened at the very end of october and since then i ve been very anxious with almost no ability to disconnect from my thoughts about all this and it s not always active thoughts i can watch a show for example but i m unable to just watch it and forget about all this there s still this feeling in the back of my mind that s creating a knot in my stomach like i get a second of peace and it s back to this terrible feeling and me trying to relax and not notice it so far i ve tried to block it ignore it rise above it everything but now i m so poorly that i can barely eat i start randomly gagging for like 10 times in a row keep jolting awake at night with this terrible pit in my stomach i can t focus on anything else and i m especially unable to relax like when i go to sit and watch tv or play a game my mind goes okay here it comes now relax and the feeling kicks in again i also feel traumatised by all this so even thinking about a previous day makes it feel like i m reliving a traumatising event i m completely unable to function or do anything my stomach is still so bad i tried so many different doctors meds and supplements but it s not even about the stomach anymore i d also like to say that i had some pockets of days where i had some appetite or a few good hours or so sometimes the thoughts or the feeling will be there still but i d feel better especially on a short trip to switzerland this month there i even slept most night for 8 9h with some sleep meds however ever since i came back a week ago it s been hell i ve spiraled so much right now my days are hell and my nights even worse even with the meds i keep jolting awake nauseous and then i keep trying to calm myself down by thinking about something else which i m unable to do most of the time but the frustration just grows and i keep feeling worse and worse and my brain just keeps adding new things to be anxious about what if this what if that and then it really starts feeling whatever it imagines right now i m in bed just googling unwilling to start my day please help me it feels like my life is over i m so scared that i won t ever be able to relax or think about anything else i m unable to feel anything or get excited about anything i m just anxious and scared what s wrong with me have i created ocd for myself is this anxiety where do i go what do i do please i m at my wit s end and the worst thing is i know that if i could just forget about all this i d be myself again i even started having these pictures in how i finally quit vaping and kept my anxiety under control just wanted to share something that s helped me in case it helps someone else i ve struggled with anxiety for a long time and vaping became this constant crutch i began not really enjoying the vape so i wanted to quit but my anxiety just wouldn t let me every time i tried to stop suddenly my anxiety spiked and it felt like too much so i d end up going back to it what finally worked for me was taking the pressure off completely instead of quitting i just delayed my first vape of the day no rules no punishment no forcing it even pushing it back 10 minutes each day felt manageable and weirdly that alone reduced my anxiety because i wasn t fighting myself all day over time the urges softened and the panic around needing it faded it took me about 50 days by slowly pushing my first vape of the day later and later it eventually blended into my bedtime and one day i realised i d gone the whole day without vaping this approach felt way kinder on my nervous system than cold turkey ever did no gum no replacements no white knuckling honestly the feeling is like no other finally beating a habit i d struggled with for years it felt like a little win in a world that can be pretty harsh not saying it s for everyone just sharing in case anyone else feels like quitting makes their anxiety spiral sometimes easing off instead of ripping the band aid can make a big difference i ve put all the steps and tips into a small guide if you want it send me a message and i ll happily share sorry if this post is against the rules genuinely just want to just help people

evolution and anxiety just joined so forgive me if you ve heard it before i learned that anxiety was integral in the evolution of our species a bunch of cave men go out hunting and come to a fork in the path they take the right side and a saber tooth tiger jumps out and kills one the rest run back to the cave they still need food so they go out again the next day and come to the fork they remember what happened yesterday and can imagine a future scenario where the same thing will happen if they go right they go left unfortunately technology has advanced so much and there are fewer real threats out there but our brains haven t had enough time to catch up and that survival mechanism is still on high alert on the bright side we might not even be here if our species did not have this double edged sword i ve had it all of my life and absolutely hate it besides meds and alcohol only helping other people and seeing my nieces and nephews seems to take it away temporarily i seriously considered getting a lobotomy to get rid of that part of my brain if that s even possible we re all in this together better days ahead

ongoing physical symptoms anxiety spiral struggling to feel normal again hi everyone i m posting here because i ve been having a really hard time and i don t know how to break out of this cycle about 7 weeks ago i started feeling unwell at first i thought it was just the flu but it never really stopped i felt constantly tired and off without being able to clearly explain what was wrong because of this i ended up doing a lot of tests: multiple blood tests x rays an ultrasound and even going to the er everything came back completely normal except for ferritin which was elevated around 370 with the upper limit being 250 i ve spoken with two doctors and both told me that there s nothing to do right now and that all the tests look fine overall physically things have started to improve a bit but this long period of feeling unwell really triggered my anxiety everyone just say that i m recovery from a virus or something similar and it might take a lot of months now i m stuck in a constant loop of checking my body for symptoms and thinking that something terrible is wrong or that i m about to die even though the doctors say i m okay some days i feel bad physically other days it feels like the anxiety itself is what s making me feel bad and most days it s probably both either way i don t feel like i can have a normal day anymore i had been doing much better with anxiety before all of this and it s really discouraging to feel like i m back at the beginning again i guess i m just looking to hear from anyone who s been through something similar especially health anxiety after a long unexplained physical issue and how you managed to cope or slowly feel normal again

how do i breathe normally again hi guys this is my first time really posting on reddit so please give me grace as i don t really understand what i m doing i was diagnosed with ocd a couple of months ago i ve had an anxiety diagnosis since i was 13ish i m out of therapy until january due to insurance issues i ve been so anxious lately to the point where it s creating physical symptoms i have bad health anxiety but i do realize nothing is wrong with me and im healthy im almost 18 with no health conditions and i went to the doctor this past summer and they said im great and have 100 oxygen levels anyways these past couple of days ive been obsessing over my breathing and now im having shortness of breath and chest pains im aware this is normal for anxiety i was just wondering if anyone had some tips for how to be able to breathe normally again and not have anymore chest pains i ve looked this up a bit and it seems like this is normal thing for those suffering with ocd christmas and my birthday are coming up and i just want to feel normal thank you in advance iz

check your weight okay so it probably should ve been obvious but if u have a history of elevated blood pressure even at a healthy weight u probably shouldn t go overboard with how much u are eating so what happened is that after a month or two of a dirty bulk and sedentary lifestyle i woke up with my legs feeling restless and relentless anxiety then for a year or two i had crippling anxiety and panic attacks and a general feeling of being off been to the er twice and general check up once done the ekg multiple times because of suspected heart problem they would always start with the blood pressure finger monitor and then they would escalate to the ekg i ve been through it at least 3 times anyways after trying to narrow down the million possible things that could be causing the crippling anxiety i ve found that slimming down greatly alleviated it at my peak weight i was still at a healthy bmi but i had always been skinny so i guess my body wasn t used to the bulk i dropped down a significant bit and must have crossed some threshold where my body is able to comfortably sustain my blood pressure

nervous about increased anxiety for medication changes about 5 years ago i had a bad breakdown where i was having panic attacks everyday was convincing myself i was losing my mind and overall just having unbearable anxiety and decided to go on paxil it worked for my anxiety but i was having trouble sleeping and my psychiatrist changed it i ve been prescribed effexor for my anxiety and depression but admittedly wasn t taking it like i was supposed to until about 4 5 months ago about two months ago so 3 mo into taking 75mg of effexor i started getting panic attacks where i convince myself i m gonna faint feeling like i m gonna have a heart attack or a stroke convincing myself i can t breathe etc now it s just been everyday where i m shaky and on edge dizzy especially while driving having really bad derealization and am just an anxious mess about two weeks ago my psychiatrist decided to lower my dosage to 37 5 mg to begin tapering because i just want off these meds and we d meet again to see what to do from there though he warned me lowering it may increase these symptoms and it hasn t improved at all i feel like i can t take this anymore i ve seen people suggest doing a prozac bridge to minimize withdrawal symptoms and while i ve seen people say it works wonders for them i ve seen some people say it made their anxiety worse i literally can t handle my anxiety getting any worse it s affecting my daily life it takes everything in me to go to work and i m having panic attacks the whole time convincing myself i m gonna pass out i ve been prescribed hydroxyzine and propranolol as needed for panic attacks and neither has helped at all i m also scared of taking benzo s to help because part of my anxiety is about feeling lightheaded and out of it i m just curious what ssri i could bridge to get off effexor that is least likely to cause my anxiety to increase any advice

i couldn t go through with a medical procedure today just wanted to share i went to the doctor for a non invasive supposed to be very quick nose surgery and was incredible nervous for it because i just don t like the idea of my body changing in that way especially in this area where i breathe but i really did my best to prepare i took off work and i ate a meal beforehand i made it all the way to the office and immediately just started crying nothing had even happened yet the doctors came in were very nice gave me a stress ball and an ativan and explained everything and i felt like i could go through with it then they hit me with a first round of numbing spray cotton balls in my nose and it was at that point that i began to freak out because i needed to breathe through my mouth and i could feel the numbing happening in my throat and nose and it was just scary the doctor came in and i explained that the numbing was uncomfortable and he quite soberly said well things are going to get more uncomfortable because they hadn t even fully numbed me up yet and i started crying again and the doctor said he could see i wasn t ready for this and that we shouldn t go through with it until im ready they kept saying please don t feel bad lots of people get nervous and we just want you to be comfortable for this but it s hard not to feel bad about it when i know that this is a super common procedure it s getting the turbinates reduced and i guess when am i ever going to be ready i don t think i ve ever been to a doctors appointment when u haven t been nervous ive puked at blood draws i get scared of ct scans i don t know why i thought i d be able to handle this surgery it all just very embarrassing to still be experiencing at my age im almost 30

anxiety getting worse after doctor said i have tb without sputum test hi everyone i m really struggling mentally right now and i just need to vent and maybe get some perspective for about 5 months i ve had a chronic cough during this time i ve coughed up blood twice the second time was recently and it was more than before which really scared me because of that i finally went to the hospital they did a chest x ray and the doctor said it looks like tuberculosis they wanted to do a sputum test but the machine was broken so it wasn t done based only on the x ray the doctor told me i have tb and started me on medication this is where my anxiety completely spiraled i don t really trust the diagnosis because: there was no sputum test i have no other symptoms like fever night sweats weight loss or feeling sick i feel mostly normal except for the cough mucus stuck in my throat and the two times i coughed blood now my anxiety is really bad i keep thinking what if it s not tb or what if something else is wrong i can t stop overthinking and every sensation in my body makes me panic the coughing blood especially traumatized me i know doctors are trained and x rays can show tb but my brain keeps doubting everything because there was no lab confirmation i m stuck between wanting to trust the doctor and being terrified that something was missed or misdiagnosed has anyone been diagnosed with tb based mainly on x ray or dealt with severe anxiety while waiting for confirmation tests any advice or shared experiences would really help right now thank you for reading

sleep anxiety: does anyone else find bedtime stories weirdly helpful for sleep anxiety my sleep anxiety has been absolutely spiraling lately it s that awful feeling where the second the lights go out my chest gets tight and my brain decides to replay every awkward conversation i ve had since 2012 it s exhausting and makes me dread going to bed i realized recently that the only thing that actually calms me down is basically being treated like a toddler i felt silly asking but i eventually got my boyfriend to tell me a bedtime story about my teddy bear just to get my brain to focus on his voice instead of my thoughts it worked surprisingly well it just made me feel safe i guess kind of like how my parents used to read to me when i was little the only problem is i feel incredibly guilty asking him to do this every single night he s tired too and half the time he falls asleep before i do i tried listening to podcasts but they were too engaging and silence just let the anxiety back in i went looking for something to fill that gap and stumbled on a platform called lullaby it s been a decent substitute for when my boyfriend is too tired or asleep you can basically set it up to tell stories in a specific voice which helps mimic that being read to feeling without the guilt of keeping someone else awake it s not exactly the same as a real person obviously but if you re single or your partner is a heavy sleeper it might be worth a shot hope this helps someone get some rest tonight

all different things i experienced for the last 3 months i have been on all these medications supplements in the last 3 years finasteride 2 years daily quit dutasteride 1 year daily quit oral minoxidil 1 year daily quit vitamin d3 once every few months zinc once every few months iron once every few months biotin once a month magnesium once a month mirtazapine just for 3 days propranolol only 8 doses in 1 month omeprazole 1 month in the last 3 months i have experienced migraine headache light headedness left side chest pain acid reflux gas noises in stomach cold hands and feet constantly for years coughs constantly mucus in throat scalp itching burning sensation anxiety tingling in feet gynecomastia cold sweats electric shocks body zaps internal tremors trembling restlessness muscle ache stiff neck pins and needles feet and hands ocd insomnia and panic attacks on and off weekly i have had 3 blood tests in 3 months all came back normal i had 5 ecg and ekg in 3 months all came back normal i had a chest x ray that came back normal i had my eyes checked for retinal detachment and vision problems and all was normal constantly feeling at edge and ocd is playing right through this i eat healthy i sleep whenever i want between 5 am to 7am and wake up afternoon sometimes my sleep right now is poor for months i sleep between 5 hours and half to 8 hours i used to go the gym 6 months ago daily this all started after i had my first panic attack 3 months ago propranolol helps with the heart racing but my anxiety mentally is still present and anxiousness is still present constantly thinking about anxiety 24 7 i don t know if this is generalised or something else i can t get my mind of anxiety daily it s what my mind thinks about a lot unless i am distracted by gaming watching tv or going out anyone experienced something remotely similar or had any symptoms of these from anxiety

anyone else get anxiety adrenaline reflux panic like symptoms until they have a bowel movement i have experienced poor gut health since my early teens along with ibs i am now 30 years old over time i have noticed the development of intense episodes of anxiety and adrenaline that seem to be directly triggered when i become constipated or significantly bloated particularly when it feels as though there is a heavy buildup of stool in my bowels during these episodes i experience a surge of adrenaline that leads to a range of physical symptoms commonly associated with gerd and panic attacks these include an increased heart rate sweating shaking and a strong sense of impending doom i also experience widespread tingling throughout my body especially on the left side along with acid reflux that rises into my throat notably these symptoms resolve almost immediately once i am able to have a bowel movement and feel relief particularly a sense of lightness in my stomach at that point the anxiety subsides the physical symptoms disappear and i return to a state of calm and comfort i tend to notice these symptoms more when lying down in bed at night it sometimes feels as though there is a form of internal pressure or compression affecting my nerves although i m not certain what exactly causes this feeling

make a move or wait it out when timing is off how to decide when if it s wise to give them space while holding onto hope and trying to enjoy what is f 50 m 47 female here met on a dating app he said he was looking for friendship casual we met for a hike and subsequent outdoor activities in addition to hikes like biking and walks exploring new places and working out at the gym also dinner and shopping together he is newly divorced almost a year and i ve been divorced for nearly 8 years he seems interested we have shared mutually that we are enjoying each other nothing physical has been introduced yet aside from hugs he offers me his time to help with home projects and we have worked well together the time flies by and is never boring we both have older children similar ages it s been about 5 months now since we met initially and i have feelings for him beyond just friendship i haven t confessed the feelings as i m not sure he s ready as he s still adjusting to his new life as a single divorced dad we talk all the time about the adventures to come trips hikes bike trips etc he will mention coming over and helping with x y and z no definite dates plans but i have no reason to think he is anything but sincere the problem is i m conflicted about making a move or giving him the green light and waiting instead for him to let me know he s ready i read posts that go both ways on this and i m not sure if he would make a move or not i wish i knew if he was waiting for me to make the move i don t want to seem pushy or desperate but when we are apart i ruminate about this question of do i or don t i he is a great friend and i would not risk the friendship but the anxiety is increasing as the days go by especially the longer the time between hearing from him thanks for your advice

monday night my eyes are heavy and dried out i refuse to take my contacts out a rush of uneasiness flows through my body steady consistent i am calm enough i ve trained myself to keep control so the feeling doesn t get worse though it s still there i can t tell if it s my wife or the dog lightly snoring beside me in our king sized bed i stare at the ceiling and try to clear my head try to think good thoughts my mind rushes one thought after another and then another a memory from more than fifteen years ago suddenly appears as if it happened yesterday it isn t a good memory i don t want to write it down my ears are ringing i try to ignore it but it s there no matter what i think i hear something in the house what could that possibly be i think to myself my brain sends signals to my body making me more alert deep down i know the sound is nothing my heart rate and awareness rise then slowly settle back down i focus on taking deep breaths my eyes are heavy my thoughts are still racing is something wrong with me i turn my attention to a happy memory and ask myself to have good dreams i crack my toe i try to crack my knee it hurts it s my acl repaired knee but the pain is comforting it s getting late i start to worry about not getting enough sleep for tomorrow s busy day my mind races again my eyes are dry the uneasy feeling is still there i say good night in my head like i m speaking to an audience but it s just me why am i addressing an audience who am i speaking to no one can hear me no one would care if they could i think there s something wrong with me

i feel like i am constantly being watched judged and am unable to perform even the most basic private actions without paralyzing fear i am writing this because i am struggling immensely with what i believe has escalated far beyond normal anxiety i feel like my life is constantly under surveillance even when i am alone in my own home my anxiety makes it impossible for me to perform basic private acts of life without intense fear and hyper vigilance i experience a complete loss of privacy i cannot masturbate in the bathroom or in my locked room because my mother is highly invasive even though she only walked in on me once the anticipation that she will catch me is debilitating furthermore i face public paralysis: i cannot look at my phone in public because i constantly imagine people staring judging or laughing at me the very act of visualizing their eyes on me while i use my device is unbearable in social interactions i cannot make eye contact with people especially service attendants i struggle to hold my head up or speak without stuttering when talking to them because i am simultaneously focused on avoiding their gaze and panicking about my performance this feeling extends to my own home as a constant surveillance i am consumed by the feeling that someone is observing me constantly i cannot use my computer if the door is open nor can i open a bottle of medication or do the slightest act without the overwhelming preoccupation that i am being watched the core fear translates into daily chronic worry about being caught or judged for anything i do no matter how insignificant i live in fear of being caught even when smoking a cigarette on my own balcony i have the overwhelming sensation that i am sitting weird or that my hair doesn t look right i feel the need to constantly anticipate someone opening the door so i can hide or put out my cigarette and i worry intensely that someone will hear the music i m listening to and judge my taste this constant anxiety has severely compromised my quality of life autonomy and freedom the fear of external judgment has taken away my ability to simply exist in peace i am looking for advice or shared experiences from others who have struggled with this level of crippling social anxiety and hyper vigilance

gut anxiety feedback loop hi everyone i feel as though this might be a long rant but i m so done right now and was wondering if anyone else had experienced anything like this to try to start at the beginning around i started to be under some pretty intense stress in january this year though the actual implications and breakdown of all this didn t really make itself clear to me until april may april may june july were all an intense period of anxiety and panic attacks for me i couldn t go to classes without having to stop walking on the way there to catch my breath etc the anxiety and panic was debilitating and all encompassing and i genuinely thought i was dying but at the same time i was functioning and going to my classes and seminars doing my work and trying to push through it all i don t think i truly realised how trapped in a panic anxiety spiral i was at the same time as all these things started to feel off with my gut i thought it was just that i wasn t eating well so i tried to eat my fibre and veg etc but if anything that just made things worse but again i ignored and pushed through because i had no idea what else to do tbh i refused to think deeply about these things i was worried something was seriously wrong with me but i couldn t and refused to face it i thought if i got to the summer everything would just get better then it got to summer and i still had these horrible gut issues where sorry its tmi the consistency of my stool was all over the place i ended up going on holiday with some friends and it felt like torture trying to keep up with other people when my body felt like it wasn t functioning right i was eating whatever and i felt so bloated and god damn awful the entire time and it was so so hot which i don t do well with at all i ended up making excuses to not go on 2 trips to the beach because the idea of being so far from where we were staying and a toilet was scary to me but once i was home things only escalated every time i left the house it was all i could think about my gut issues also became worse because i would now get these seemingly out of nowhere incredibly painful like i m about to pass out or throw up chills sweating etc lower left abdominal cramping where my body would feel the need to expel everything in it again tmi sorry these episodes were happening once or twice a week and seemingly only getting more intense i was supposed to go to germany this summer i couldn t bring myself to do it i went on the train to stay at my sisters and i felt so ill the entire time it was like my intestines and stomach were on fire again still eating everything i felt so seriously unwell and any journey out of the house it was all i could think about even when i was home it was all i thought about a constant loop i am still stuck in eventually i started to cut out foods basically all food i went to the doctors to whom i don t think i described my experiences well enough who took my blood and a stool sample and then told me nothing was wrong and it was probably ibs i ve also gone to the doctors for my anxiety done online courses and cbt been prescribed anti depressants which i haven t taken yet because i m scared on what effect they ll have on my body and gut they said it could be celiac but that as i haven t been eating gluten they can t tell since then i ve basically been on my own this was in september i became so miserable but had to start thinking of how i was going to move back to uni and function i identified a handful of safe foods i could eat and stuck only to them i went back to uni i have amazing friends who have been very supportive and kind but i still am missing out on so much i have been gradually trying to expand what i eat but its still only around 10 15 things that i stick to and due to in person lectures and meetings i m in my third year i have just been wanting to be stable the good news is that since keeping my diet like this i haven t had any painful episodes though some weird stool consistency but even writing that its been 2 5 months without an episode feels like tempting fate like im cursing myself same with leaving my room house it s the constant what ifs i ve missed out on my friends on being around them ive stopped socialising as much i only leave my room when i need to because otherwise being outside stresses me out so so much and all i can think of is what ifs this is my issue now i want to eat more foods and expand but it scares me so so much i m back home for a month for christmas and my family doesn t know anything about any of my struggles we aren t close and don t really share this kind of information i feel so limited i m just so terrified of everything and the fact that i still have no idea what is wrong or what caused any of this is scary is it ibs is it an intolerance is the way i m thinking about this arfid ocd anxiety anyone s experiences or thoughts would be so greatly appreciated i just feel really alone

bupropion buspar propranolol ssri feel like i ve tried everything i ve been dealing with anxiety most of my life 29 but for the last 5 years it s been near constant and i have the physical symptoms mostly it initially stemmed from my previous job and boss but as i m in a new job and different point in life while the anxiety has tapered it still remains about 3 years ago i started medication which began with ssris which were overall s pretty negative experience after trying a few of them lexapro fluoxetine i eventually stopped with them and began wellbutrin for depression and anxiety almost immediately the wellbutrin improved my depression and has been great since but the anxiety persisted worth noting that when i have gone up on wellbutrin the first few days feel amazing and my anxiety all but dissipated only to return in the last year i ve been taking buspar starting at 10mg twice a day eventually going up to 15mg twice a day but had to go back down due to dizziness and i never have felt that it works for me this past week i was prescribed propranolol 10 mg to help with the physical symptoms and i haven t noticed any changes the few days i ve taken it so far i feel like i ve tried so many medications am in therapy and have not seen any improvement and i don t see the light at the end of the tunnel for my anxiety curious if anyone has had similar experiences and would have any advice to share thanks for reading

if you feel stuck overwhelmed and unable to act this might not be anxiety i ve noticed a recurring pattern in a lot of posts here people describing feeling slow stuck overwhelmed unable to decide or act and assuming something is wrong with them what you re describing doesn t sound like weakness or brokenness it sounds like a mind that s trying to process too much at once constantly scanning for outcomes before acting when thinking becomes a protection mechanism action starts to feel dangerous not because you can t act but because your brain is overloaded overthinking isn t always a thinking problem sometimes it s a capacity problem you re not failing at thinking you re thinking beyond capacity i m curious how many of you feel mentally exhausted not because life is hard but because your mind never stops simulating everything before you move

my advice on where to start with a baseline i think its important that everyone with anxiety cuts out common causes for a time to get a general baseline before trying other things so these are the changes id suggest to make for one month to get a baseline: 1 no caffeine of any kind some people are extremely sensitive or it can be a multiplier for anxiety you can go one month without it to be sure 2 no alcohol its proven to directly contribute to anxiety 3 no weed for the same reasons as alcohol 4 30 min of nature a day light walking its a human and needed thing for me 4 no artificial sweets if you need sugar have sugar in moderation anecdotally it can affect gut biome which can exacerbate anxiety this one is a bit more out there but worth trying 5 sleep hygiene dark room no phone and book if you cant sleep yet same wakeup and sleep every day including weekends important note: you might still have anxiety at the end of one month but starting with cutting out common causes can give a baseline to work off of you can rule out these things as a cause if im wrong and if your anxiety is much lessened you can then start to figure out which of these was a cause

sleepless nights caused by false vacuum decay theory i recently went down a rabbit hole on human consciousness and just how conscious works and ever since then i have been experiencing anxiety attacks and sleepless nights once or twice every couple of weeks i have become horrified by the idea of losing my conscious experience and never experiencing anything every again what s been on my mind lately is a theory i remember hearing about a while ago called false vacuum decay the theory is that randomly at any point in the universe a bubble could form and expand outwards at the speed of light inside the bubble all of physics essentially becomes rewritten and there s literally no way to predict if a bubble is coming our way now what scares me about this is that we have no idea if there is a bubble near and if one does arrive then we don t just die we get erased instantly there is no pain there is no suffering there s no nothing and honestly i feel like just having the constant stream of experience suddenly stop rather than slowly fade away in front of my eyes is much more terrifying i ve done some research on the topic and learned that the chances of a bubble forming are so astronomically small that we may as well just consider it zero the chances of one forming are something around 1 in 10 100 which i can clearly see and acknowledge is unfathomably small despite this my brain is not satisfied with any number greater than zero i know that i m way more likely to die from lightning or a car crash or from literally anything else but i feel like literally everything else is somewhat within my control i can kinda control whether i get into a car crash or not i can kinda control if i get struck by lightning but i can t control whether a bubble of vacuum decay is about to arrive at earth in a few seconds has anybody ever dealt with this kind of anxiety before or does anybody know how to cope with this it s gotten bad lately and i m looking into therapy because of it i m even thinking that i might want to try getting prescribed xanax or something like that because these attacks last for a long time are extremely distressing and don t really seem like they have a good way of being handled as opposed to ptsd depression etc

if they re mad at me i typically overthink almost everything i do and profusely apologize for even the smallest mistakes this led to some people including my s o not valuing my apologies as much as i d hope for them to which really upsets me i ve always wondered if medication was the right path for me to take once my parents experienced my first anxiety attack which resulted in my screaming and needing to be restrained by my father they took me to therapy i didn t say a word to my therapist not that i resented her in any way i just couldn t bring myself to open up to a stranger i ve tried many ways of overcoming my anxiety but it seems to fluctuate and has even been getting worse over the years to the point where i m crying in my closet over trivial problems more on my s o she keeps trying to offer me advice but i feel helpless i try to explain to her what i feel when i m having an attack but i never seem to really get the point across my best explanation to her would probably be : imagine being forced to picture every possible outcome of every action you make filter out everything positive and you re left with the negative consequences now you have to live out every single scenario simultaneously while dealing with real life at the same time i don t know if this is accurate for any others in the subreddit but this is accurate to me i guess this is more a venting advice post if anything how do i manage my anxiety without shutting myself out from the rest of the world thanks for reading this this is the first time i ve publicly shared my experience with anxiety

where to draw the line between pushing myself and overdoing it for a bit of context i had severe childhood ocd and i ve had anxiety almost my entire life but up until this year i d been doing very well for around 2 years i suspect i may have some kind of other neurodivergence that plays a part in my social anxiety i started a new job 5 months ago in an office wfh after experience workplace bullying in my previous role retail duty manager i love my new job however the adjustment from managing stores to an office environment has been tricky it takes me a long time to feel comfortable around people and i ve found the office quite overwhelming at times we hot desk so i rarely get to sit with my direct team and i ve struggled to form bonds with people but in the last month i ve felt a lot more settled within my direct team and some new people have started too which has been nice however i have this horrible crippling fear around socialising with people i don t know very well i find it really draining and confusing as if everyone is reading from a rule book that i was never given i feel like i m trying to perform some version of myself and i can t relax at all i overthink and overanalyse everything and end up saying nothing last week we had our team christmas lunch and i was very overstimulated by the level of noise multiple conversations going on and trying to keep up with everything now this wednesday we have my worst nightmare planned in we have a team breakfast with the wider team then a lunch with the two smaller teams then our christmas party for the business area we work in and an after party at a bar i didn t rsvp to the after party because i didn t realise it was separate from the christmas party i was purposefully not looking at my calendar more more than a week ahead because i knew i d start panicking everyone else is excited as it will practically be a work free day but i feel sick with stress at the idea of having to perform for a whole day when i d rather just be at my laptop this is more socialising with strangers than i usually do in a year nevermind in one day if it was just the one event i would push through as i know i need to make an effort to be closer with people so i don t feel as lonely and sometimes social events will be more enjoyable than i expected and i ll be glad i pushed my comfort zone but three events in one day is incredibly overwhelming for me and i ve been worrying about it nonstop this past weekend i grind my teeth in my sleep i have to wear a mouth guard due to this thanks anxiety and everyday atm i am waking up with jaw pain from clenching i m scared that tuesday night i will start freaking out and i will wake up wednesday morning mid panic attack this has happened to me before i could be honest with my boss she is aware i have anxiety but we ve never discussed it but i find it so hard to open up about it even to people i m close with i would rather just say i have the flu it s going round at the moment than have to get into it but i feel bad for making excuses and not trying but then i also know this is probably too much in one day so i really don t know thanks so much if anyone has read all of this

few years i ve really developed some scarier thoughts during the night regarding my safety i am just so anxious that someone is watching my everyday routine from my back garden my bedroom faces the back or alternatively my house is going to get swarmed and broken into via the back any little noise and i m so hyper aware of everything some honourable things to mention: lived in this house my whole life parents house and only ever had one issue regarding my fears and they were quite minor some man was just going through cars and rubbish bins and another time police had used our side gate to catch someone jumping from fence to fence terrified of the police helicopters and they hover almost every night in my area and surrounding sometimes it s car chases i once asked back at school or apparently just overall surveillance it only makes my fears grow that someone is hiding in my area or more specifically my backyard while it was never confirmed an old neighbour that has since moved unfortunately went through a few traumatic assaults i am constantly hearing things foot steps rattling thuds breathing or anything that could raise my alarm bells i do live in a little bit of a dodgy state apart from my older sister who doesn t live with me anymore during one of these nights i fell asleep a lot earlier than usual maybe around 11pm i then woke up super super super distressed and been around 2am when she didn t answer i was calling my mum shaking and borderline hyperventilating no one was answering me and i gave up and called 000 australia s emergency line they obviously did very well and i managed to walk to the front end of my house as for some reason i felt more secure there maybe an hour later the police called me on a private number just to ask some general questions
