where does cleanliness end and ocd begin hi everyone i have a question that comes from deep within me: where is the line between logical cleanliness and obsessive compulsive washing cleaning in my home my mother who is the primary rule maker lives with diagnoses of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd generalized anxiety disorder gad and obsessive compulsive personality disorder ocpd the combination of these three has made her a legislator with good intentions but sometimes without a clear awareness of healthy boundaries i am aware of her obsessions and their impact on me however i have doubts about cleaning washing ocd how can you tell if a behavior is part of a disorder for clarity here are some examples of the rules in our house: washing fruits eggs and food packaging washing all newly purchased clothes before wearing them disinfecting new phones and books with alcohol transferring purchased pastries to a home container placing outside documents like mail or files in a dedicated cabinet and washing hands after each touch showering after using a public restroom or after wearing clothes for shopping it s worth noting: due to alcohol damaging devices and respiratory issues i ve recently developed i sometimes reduce these rituals out of my mother s sight for years i thought this level of cleanliness was the standard everywhere but now after seeing my friends lifestyles i ve noticed a stark difference almost all of them believe that cleaning ocd rules our home why is this question vital to me the household rules probably won t change but as an individual i need to know for my own peace of mind which behaviors are rooted in logic and which are rooted in anxiety this self awareness is the key to gaining control over my own thoughts and worries i feel this contradiction: in others homes i try to act like they do but inside i m full of bad feelings guilt and an incomplete sense of enjoyment i maintain my interactions but you know it s a bit hard i pretend everything is normal i go along with everyone everywhere and do everything but only i know that i m wearing a mask to pretend that nothing is wrong perhaps the problem lies with me even if others aren t ultimately that clean the issue is mine for not feeling comfortable at the normal level of society perhaps the problem is mine for becoming a hindrance when others want to enjoy themselves in the dirtiest of places in the end i don t know what the standard is who defines what is normal and abnormal i need to reach an understanding so i can begin to take mental control this search is essential for my own self awareness i have just one question for you: in your opinion what is the criterion for diagnosing washing cleaning ocd where do you draw the line please share any thought experience or perspective you have big or small even if you don t have a definitive answer just share your personal take on where this invisible line is thank you for taking the time to read my post

it does get better i wanted to get on here because two years ago around this time i couldn t do absolutely nothing i had to quit my job because my panic attacks were out of control i literally couldn t sleep shower drive drink water eat be in public be alone stay still etc i mean it was a nightmare i was experiencing dpdr constantly i thought i was never going to get my life back or live a normal life again thankfully through therapy and learning about myself and my roots and recognizing and accepting my anxiety i now have a job i travel by myself i go out by my self i m making new friends etc i honestly couldn t even fully tell you guys how i got here because it was quite a journey and still is but i just want to give hope that it s possible i mean i literally couldn t even live my house i always felt like i was dying or something was going to happen now i travel to see my best friend last week i worked 46 hours yesterday i went to the movies by myself things i would ve never thought i would ve been able to do i just want to give hope for someone who may be going through the same thing by the way i still experience severe anxiety and panic attacks now i try not to spiral and be scared of them i remind myself i m okay i eat a sour candy chew some gum drink some water eat something call a loved one breathe listen to my favorite podcast if i can i take a nap shower etc lol like funny enough i m actually experiencing a panic attack now i feel like i m melting

going through a rough patch i ve been suffering from anxiety and mild depression for a few years now i was diagnosed in 2018 and i ve had my ups and downs i ve had therapy cbt but never meds two years ago i ve had a shit year work wise that messed me up last year was better and this year i feel like crap again i have these pitfalls that are signs that i m slipping again and i was ticking all the boxes i was tired overworked and overwhelmed joyless unmotivated and generally not taking great care of myself i thought: in december work will slow down a bit i will take better care of myself and meet up with friends and see my doctor because i m afraid i m depressed again and then last week i had a nasty fall and broke my shoulder in three places i m a bit of an invalid now and moved in with my parents because i can t even feed myself or get dressed or take a shower i now have doctor s appointments and x rays and physical therapy and my anxiety is through the roof every time i stay inside the house because i m scared to fall again the first day after the fall i almost passed out and now i m very scared of this happening in public and hurting myself again i ve been to the supermarket and the hardware store with my dad to get me out of the house and my anxiety has never been this bad i m having pt in an hour and my body is in flight or fight mode and i haven t slept a wink i m thinking of seeing my doctor waiting lists for therapy are very long but maybe there are other solutions but i don t have any privacy at the moment and i m ashamed of feeling all these things i just needed to vent i will probably feel better as soon as i can use my arm a bit i m also self employed and i won t be able to work for several months i have money set aside but it still sucks work was always my escape from anxiety and my feelings and now i can t work thanks for reading

the trauma it leaves 25f here have lived with anxiety for as long as i remember a high functioning adult considered smart an overachiever by peers yet i knew somewhere that i was slowly falling apart a few months ago right in the middle of my phd after having a brief breakdown i literally collapsed trembles high sensitivity to light and noises insomnia gut went hell nausea like it would k ll me by vomiting panic attacks one after another derealization depersonalization what wasn t there and i was all alone abroad so afraid that i didn t let anybody know with zero support network thinking about it makes me tear up i never knew it could all be anxiety i went to multiple doctors proctologist gastroenterologist gps cardiologist all results coming out clean whilst i felt like dying every night i messed everything up started skipping my lab cause i literally wasn t in physical condition to go yet i couldn t explain to my faculty cause what would i tell them when i didn t even know what was happening to me then i started beating myself up for missing lab and failing life messing everything up adding fear to my fear skipping meals going malnourished inviting depression to my mind and body writing this makes me all tear up then like a ray of hope i bumped onto claire weekes books could it be anxiety i went to a psychiatrist immediately got prescribed ssri long term and xanax as a rescue medication things slowly started to change since then practicing self compassion dare by barry mcdonagh acceptance and commitment therapy gradual exercise and socializing along with medication things started to slowly get better after 4 months now as i m stable enough but missed my precious phd time i m just incredibly sad i process emotions better now thanks to therapy and socializing i enter meltdowns every now and then though they pass away quickly as i don t resist them i felt like i d die and none would know and now i m filled with nothing but guilt i m trying to recover even proposed to someone i fell in love with though got rejected still i never even allowed emotion less love and vulnerability to enter my body i m recovering but incredibly sad the trauma is there cause somewhere my body believes whether i enter that state another time i m really gonna d e i m trying to return to daily life slowly i ll likely return to lab soon but don t know what awaits me in future perhaps this sounds like victim talks but thanks for reading

working in news with death anxiety has been harder than i thought need advice i m a reporter for a digital paper former mmj i thought digital would be better and i m fully remote which is a huge plus and i get health care again haven t had for a bit they want us to put out 7 stories a day granted they can be shorter stories and reach about 400 500k page views a month the issue is that if there isn t a lot of breaking news crime crashes etc then i don t have as much to put out and will have to write longer features and interview folks which i love but are time consuming and can t do 5 in a day i had a horrible story in one of my towns in my coverage area recently and it bumped my page views up it s such an unsettling feeling knowing my job is secure and my boss is happy because of this i know breaking news crime etc is what gets page views but i hate living like this every day wondering if i ll hit my page view and then having this disgusting feeling after realizing i m set for the month after a tragedy does it get better i started working here recently i know it s a bit different than being a mmj but i would take being an mmj over this i would rather have 1 2 stories to focus on and dive into for the day than 5 7 throughout the day spreading me thin i have pretty bad anxiety outside of work and feel that stepping back into news may not have been the right decision i know it s almost like exposure therapy or becoming desensitized but i don t know anymore i m scared if i leave this will impact future jobs as i ve only been here a short time i didn t realize how much breaking news and horrible stories it would be daily i ve declined going to cover stories at funerals because i don t feel comfortable doing that i went from being an mmj to features writer for a paper to now reporter of all stories for a digital site i enjoyed features so much and that s what i want to do i just fear if i leave now after a short time it will negatively impact future opportunities in features at a different pape i haven t been able to go to the gym cook regularly clean do any hobbies etc because i m mentally drained and consumed by this new job i am thankful it s remote as i m also trying to plan a wedding but feel as though everything is too overwhelming right now and the holidays and wedding planning has been darkened by this new job and the decline of my mental state i can t seem to get into a good routine or good habits to break out of this headspace i wake up and first thing i do is look at the press releases of crashes etc and put out a story in 15 30 min or i ll be reprimanded that it wasn t put up fast enough and if i don t have any breaking news still reprimanded even though every other type of story is longer to research find write etc my entire feed on fb social media etc is all things happening in my area for pitching stories but so much more horrible news lately and i know that s the life of a reporter but when i was working in features it felt lighter and more manageable i truly love talking with people hearing and sharing their stories but i don t get to do this as much a few times a week if that and i m always so happy when i get to but then i don t even end up writing the stories until a week later when i find time or on a weekend how would i navigate this

anyone else experience anxiety after consuming dairy with lactose intolerance so i 29m have had lactose intolerance since probably middle school for me my symptoms after ingesting dairy was simply diarrhea for the longest time although it was a battle in it of itself however about a month ago all of the sudden now i get anxiety whenever i consume dairy i m not sure if it s the gasses or the inflammation that s causing the anxiety i read that there are studies on the gut brain axis that shows that gut health can directly impact brain function so i feel like perhaps this isn t uncommon and i m not alone in experiencing something like this but i m so confused as to why this is happening to me all of the sudden i m convinced it s the dairy causing the anxiety because after i go to the bathroom anxiety symptoms start resolving my doctor says give it a month of no dairy and try reintroducing it to my diet afterwards little at a time to see if it resolves itself but alas it s been well over a month and it s still happening i wouldn t say it s debilitating but honestly it s been making me really depressed to think i ll never be able to enjoy ice cream or pizza now without experiencing full blown anxiety feeling hot and sweaty mind racing trouble concentrating feeling like something s wrong brain fog trouble remembering things my question is: 1 anyone else experience anxiety with lactose intolerance 2 do you think it s normal for me to suddenly develop this kind of response to lactose after years of simple diarrhea

and the idea of putting myself out there to meet new people has always been a terrifying venture i m always by myself and while i appreciate my independence i do struggle with loneliness i ve positive post just wanted to share some positive news on here and spread hope on this subreddit i feel like i m finally getting better i have been able to go out with friends and family more have normal interactions more etc i feel like i can finally hold off on the anxiety and just sit with it and not let it control me i can push past that anxiety that s telling me it s safer to stay home and not go out obviously i m not 100 percent and i will still have some really hard days but i don t know if i ll ever truly be back to my old self i don t see an issue with that either some positives have come from my anxiety i quit drinking i stopped taking those small moments with friends and family for granted and it made me appreciate my health and situation i have in life i wouldn t have been able to get better without the help of my friends and family for pushing me to face the discomfort and to not be ashamed of the anxiety thank you for reading and i hope everyone gets past their struggles

significant health anxiety and brain tumor worries hello anxiety reddit i am going through an especially rough spell of health anxiety and could use some strategies and reassurance to help combat my fears of a brain tumor or some type of tumor in my head face ever since i was 8 years old i have suffered from pulsing migraines that happen anywhere from 3 times a month to 3 times a week over time i have learned to live with them but they have been a significant factor in my life for a long time as i am 23 now about 2 years ago i started taking a low dose of amitriptyline which has helped greatly and has reduced the number of headaches i have my last severe headache episode was about 2 years ago when i went to the er for a headache that lasted for 3 days straight they did a ct scan that showed nothing gave me the er migraine cocktail and sent me on my way that provided reassurance for a decent amount of time within the last month or so i ve started having an increase in eye pain which i m not sure is eye strain or something else it feels as though the muscles in my eye are being pulled when i look in a certain direction additionally when i press on my forehead pain radiates down my forehead through my left eye and into my left nostril i had an eye exam a few days after the first episode and my doctor said everything looked very healthy and my prescription needed minimal adjustment again this gave me some piece of mind for a while until the eye pains started again today i am on day two of significant eye pain which again feels like soreness behind the eye i am on screens all day for work and on my phone far too long each day and i am trying everything i can to convince myself that this is just from severe eye strain or other environmental factors i underwent a full panel of bloodwork at the start of september under my primary care doc s orders which showed nothing out of the ordinary however i can t stop my mind from making connections to other symptoms i have had trouble sleeping for the last 6 months or so since my wife and i got married and moved into a new place i feel like i ve been more forgetful recently and maybe that could be related i ve been more fatigued than i feel i usually am ibuprofen doesn t seem to help with the eye pain which comes and goes seemingly at random my mind starts to spiral into all of the different possibilities with the end conclusion being that i should make a trip to the er and get a scan of my head to rule out a brain tumor please please please any suggestions on how to curb my obsessions and endless googling and reassurance that this is my anxiety talking not a growth in my head obviously nobody here is a doctor and can say with 100 certainty i understand that i have lost the last 2 days of my life going down rabbit holes on google and chatgpt and i would like to find some peace and sit down and play a video game without feeling like i need to be researching my symptoms online thank you all in advance

buspar side effect caution i wanted to share my experience i have taken buspar off on for years sometimes a couple year break i have medication anxiety so it s the only thing so can allow myself to take because i can control going off i felt comfortable it was a safe med not saying it s not just watch the dosage your bodies reaction i requested dose increase from 30 to 40 a several weeks ago highest dose since period originally prescribed i ended up feeling wildly paranoid i could not determine this at the time obviously i was going to request an even higher dose because didn t feel working i was a mess however because i was so exhausted sleepy i dropped to 35 to see if would help my mind has cleared enough to realize how paranoid i had been looking back i realized i experienced the same thing first time i took it many years ago i had always thought i had a mini mental break it s one of the reasons so refused to try different meds i had anxiety it would make me crazy

my partner struggles with anxiety and overthinking and this is what s been helping recently my partner has been dealing with anxiety and constant overthinking for quite a while now it doesn t always show up as panic attacks most of the time it s racing thoughts difficulty switching off at night and feeling mentally exhausted for no clear reason we ve tried a lot of things together over time breathing exercises journaling routines even just sitting quietly and talking things through some of it helped some of it didn t stick what s been surprisingly helpful recently is having something very simple to reach for in the moment especially when their thoughts start spiralling and they don t want a long exercise or a full conversation i ended up putting together a small app mainly so they could quickly do a short breathing reset feel gentle vibration cues and just dump what s in their head without overthinking it it s not therapy and it s not a cure but it s helped them slow down and feel a bit more grounded in those moments i m sharing this here because i know a lot of people deal with similar day to day anxiety and overthinking if anyone s interested i m happy to share what we ve been using in the comments and if this post isn t appropriate here mods please feel free to remove

time anxiety hi everyone for a long time i ve struggled with time anxiety but not in the existential type of way where i m afraid of the passage of time itself although i m not entirely sure that doesn t play a role but for me the bottom line is: anytime i have to do something that is unrelated to whatever productive thing or hobby i actually want to do i start feeling anxious about how much time i have left to complete the unrelated thing and how to maximize the time remaining to do the desired thing most often it is related to when i want to write my passion so an example could be today: i m meal prepping and cleaning the house and i know i want to write something for a ttrpg campaign later so every part of meal prepping and cleaning the house feels like a distraction and like something stealing away the time i have to be productive it s messing with my head quite a bit the result is that i don t live in the moment often i m always thinking of the next part and maximizing my time i m really curious if other people experience this and how they go about dealing with it it would be a way for me to understand my own version of it better

anyone suffer side effects of solar flare geomagnetic storms i didn t know this until a couple of months ago until something popped up on my feed but geomagnetic storms from solar flares can affect us like the moon can with some so i did some proper research the sun has been extremely active with large flares and geomagnetic storms hitting us the last couple of months and if i correlate the times on the most recent ones i can say they have impacted me in a very negative way worsened anxiety fatigue panicky nausea palps depressed and interrupted sleep foggy head popped into a few groups and many hundreds of people also being affected so it can t be quackery noticed i went downhill again all this week double checked and yes another damn flare scientific research suggests solar flares and associated geomagnetic storms can affect mood causing anxiety irritability and mood swings possibly by disrupting our circadian rhythms and nervous system though direct causal links are complex and effects vary with some studies showing links to depression in susceptible individuals while others find mixed results on overall mood was wondering if anyone out there has felt really off this week especially friday and what have been your symptoms

hydroxyzine praise post absolutely everybody and every experience is different i suffer from general and health anxiety when one goes up the other joins them i have been stressing about work and an upcoming doctors appointment my anxiety shows in physical forms before mental so i absolutely think somethings medically wrong instead of uncertainty and nerves after much contemplation i reopened my hydroxyzine bottle yesterday and wow i missed my old friend when i was prescribed it 1 5 years ago the first place i came was reddit to scare the shit out of myself i read how much some people hate it and was sooo scared to take it it took me weeks to build up some courage but i finally did and it saved me i m back after about 10 5 months off and the first morning of no anxiety in a few months feels so soothing like there is nothing wrong with me i take 5 mg a day i am very sensitive to medication so i know that sounds like nothing to some but to me it s perfect the first dose i ever took was 25 mg prescribed from my anxiety attack urgent care visit and that took me 2 full days to recover from my dr recommended 10 mg i was nervous so figured i d start with 5 and have liked it so much that there s no reason for me to increase the reason for this post is to shed some positive light on roxy and share hope to my anxiety friends be brave try the medicine love u

panic attack while driving hello everyone i just had one of the scariest experiences ever in my anxiety journey basically i was driving to my parents place and i suddenly got a weird feeling in my chest it s an anxiety symptom i ve been having since years but somehow it still scares me well the next moment my hands start to tingle really bad and numb up i can barely move them the legs came next and then my whole ribcage squeezed together and tingled i was hyperventilating at that point and continued to drive the remaining 20 min to my parents place i was shaking by the time they opened the door for me and i was for the very first time convinced i needed paramedics we called them and they did their testing getting a little blood sample and looking at my heart and all that i describe the symptoms and that i thought i was having a stroke but they confirmed that it wasnt and it was a panic attack i thought i could handle my anxiety but now i m not so sure anymore does anyone had something similar happening or some kind words i really need it right now

going back to zoloft from lexapro hi all i m looking for any similar experiences advice about 5 years ago i developed extreme health anxiety and panic disorder i couldn t leave the house work etc and had debilitating anxiety 24 7 and panic attacks multiple times a day eventually i got on zoloft and after getting up to 100mg it essentially fixed me 99 9 i could workout hard have lots of caffeine with no problem before anything slightly raising my heart rate would freak me out last year i decided to taper off as i thought i was cured lol i went from 100mg to 75mg and within the month of that the anxiety came back my doctor told me to go back up to 100mg after being on 75 for 4 weeks when i went up to 100mg i could only make it 3 weeks as the side effects were too bad i felt no emotion besides dread and panic i felt extremely depressed and anxious and my panic attacks were back 100x after this i went back to 75mg and cross tapered to lexapro for about 3 months i sitting in a hospital parking lot every night and having bad panic attacks everyday about a year later now and i m on max dose of lexapro which helps with my general anxiety but still get panic attacks during excercise lexapro makes it impossible to feel fully awake i m always groggy and it makes my appetite nuts it works about 60 as well as zoloft with 10x more side effects talking with my doc about possibly going back to zoloft as maybe the side effects from when i tried to taper and go back up are going up and down in dose in a short amount of time after being stable for so long not sure what to do looking for advice or similar experiences thanks guys

sertraline sex life a big role in the eruption of what was merely ocd tendencies into the full wham pure ocd is sexual intrusive thoughts i m pretty happy with my progress in the past year i used to get on my own merit and l was met by psychosis now i take a much more balanced perception and i m the strongest i ve ever been i m not fully cured but that s beside the point one problem closes and another one appears i was okay on 50mg i was okay on 100mg now here s where things get tricky my parter and i had to temporarily move into my mum s house and we never found our alone time i started 200mg daily around that time because i desperately needed that emotional ceiling to control my anxiety for pure ocd i think we had sex once in the 2 months we lived there we have our own place and it s been 1 month and we ve had sex once here i lowered my own medication i know it s not ideal and i plan to speak to my doctor but i felt stuck and needed to experiment carefully my mental health feels okay but my sex drive isn t coming back as quickly as i thought it would it s coming back very slowly i think i ll adapt somehow it s just when my partner initiates sex i feel very sad she is very supportive and strong in herself it s my problem to grow through

anyone else have ocd anxiety that fixates on money or what if everything falls apart did prozac help tl dr: i have ocd anxiety that fixates on money and worst case financial scenarios even when i m objectively doing fine just started prozac 10 mg and wondering if others with similar rumination noticed it helped reduce the constant mental looping and how long it took one of my main anxiety ocd themes is financial anxiety even when i m doing objectively fine my mind fixates on worst case scenarios loss of income something going wrong or everything falling apart financially a lot of this is rooted in past experiences including an unforeseen medical issue that lasted years took up a big part of my 20s and drained me financially since then my brain seems hyper alert to anything money related and the obsessive rumination has gotten worse as the economic climate in my country has continued to deteriorate i m working with both a psychiatrist and a therapist today is day 1 for me on prozac 10 mg and i m wondering if anyone with money focused anxiety ocd or similar ruminative anxiety noticed a reduction in the constant mental looping after being on it for a while and roughly when that started to happen i know this medication works very differently for everyone and on different timelines but i m really just hoping to hear a few success stories for some reassurance and encouragement i am going up to 20mg a week from now

feel so much better off ssris so i was on ssris for about 4 months well these drugs are really a pain and doctors never bring this up started prozac well prozac did nothing but give me a panic disorder so after 8 weeks got off that zoloft i then tried which did work but 10 weeks in i was just so out of it just like i was on drugs silly mistakes at work that were impacting my career a lot super tired all day which was terrible because i m big into fitness and bodybuilding also i work physically demanding jobs it s hard to get work done when you re tired all day thank god i quit these right when sexual side effects started after now being off them i look back and realized how out of it and different i was my family was actually the ones that said you need to stop these i had family and friends telling me i don t seem myself and seem not too with it just a forewarning for anyone trying these drugs my anxiety is about the same because i feel like these medicines never really did anything tbh i have just really gotten better with exposure mostly starting a new job had made my anxiety absolutely worse but now having been working it more i feel better imo these drugs are best suited for severe cases not saying mine wasn t but i was still function able my life is just harder with anxiety just gonna go back to my cbd and low thc which did more than any ssri has

face fear directly the moment you stop running fear becomes energy you can control most people think fear is something to get rid of it is not fear is raw energy with no direction running from fear scatters that energy and keeps your nervous system in a chase loop avoidance gives fear momentum that is why it grows returns and feels uncontrollable when you stop running and stay present with it something strange happens fear loses its narrative the body charge remains but it is no longer hostile it becomes available energy this is the shift avoidance equals loss of control presence equals ownership fear only dominates while it is framed as an enemy when you face it without acting suppressing or dramatizing it the polarity collapses what remains is clarity drive and stability you do not defeat fear you reclaim it

my experience with weight change on sertraline timelines specifics i spent a long time searching forums for clear comparable experiences around weight gain on sertraline and how long it took to reverse after stopping so i m sharing my own experience in case it helps someone else looking for data points rather than reassurance background female 35 naturally slim my whole life 5ft 6 pre children: 8 stone technically underweight for my height unable to gain weight post children pre sertraline: stable at 8 8 stone highest my weight would increase to was 8 10 stone long standing water retention previously only in legs and manageable by limiting very carby foods i have 2 dogs so i walked a lot but i never spent time actively exercising on sertraline started sertraline: october 2023 initially i lost weight: by early december 2023 i was 8 stone 5 then i had rapid weight gain: by mid december 2023 early january 2024: my weight increased to 9 stone my new weight fluctuated around 9 5 stone 9 9 stone heaviest recorded weight: 9 12 stone although this weight range is medically in healthy range for my height it was significantly higher than my lifelong baseline pattern of weight gain weight gain appeared hormonal in nature distribution was uneven: upper body remained unchanged weight and fluid accumulation primarily from abdomen downward i developed abdominal water retention which i had never experienced before dietary strategies that had previously controlled water retention lower carb intake became ineffective i experienced increased cravings for sugary and fatty foods assumed medication related though intake did not significantly change prior to sertraline i could eat freely and reduce carbohydrates for 1 2 days to manage water retention this strategy no longer worked maintaining baseline physical activity had no effect on weight or fluid retention motivation for exercise reduced significantly i walked the dogs because i had to not because i wanted to stopping sertraline stopped sertraline: 9th may 2025 post discontinuation timeline may 2023 october 2025: no meaningful weight change despite stopping medication weight and water retention remained the same no immediate reduction in bloating or abdominal fluid exercise factor began running: june 2025 the motivation behind this was body image distress rather than fitness goals outcome: running did not lead to weight loss or reduction in water retention in the short or medium term no visible or measurable change while hormones were likely still adjusting my view: exercise may now be supporting weight loss but it did not trigger it the change appears more closely linked to hormonal normalisation over time when weight began to shift first noticeable change: november 2025 approx 6 months after stopping sertraline current weight 8 12 stone change was gradual rather than sudden suggests delayed hormonal recalibration rather than calorie exercise driven weight loss key takeaways from my experience weight gain on sertraline can be delayed hormonal and water retention heavy weight may persist months after discontinuation exercise alone may not override hormonally driven weight changes for me meaningful change did not occur until hormones had time to stabilise posting this because i couldn t find many experiences that included: long term timelines hormonal suggestions water retention changes delayed post discontinuation changes weight gain in someone without prior weight issues i hope this helps anyone looking for comparable data for context i m very pro medication i have gad and panic disorder and sertraline was necessary at the time to stabilise my nervous system enough to engage in therapy it was effective and helped me through a severe period if i were to relapse i would take sertraline again without hesitation i m sharing this purely for informed consent reasons weight gain wasn t something i felt prepared for and knowing in advance that it could be hormonally driven and persist after stopping would have helped me manage expectations and cope better with the physical changes

is this health anxiety or should i get more tests done details inside this will be a bit long description thanks for reading i m 32 years old with no significant past health conditions though my mother is a type 2 diabetic and my father had blood pressure issues and underwent angioplasty about 20 years ago over the past 3 4 months i ve experienced multiple episodes of waking up in the middle of the night with a racing heart the initial episodes were quite distressing as it was a new experience for me and i even had one during the day these incidents led me to become hyper aware of any changes in my heart rate at all times i started constantly checking my pulse trying to assess whether my heart was racing or if it was normal even the slightest sensation in my chest made me worry that something was wrong with my heart i became overly sensitive to any heart related sensations in more recent episodes i ve learned to manage the situation better i reassure myself that it will pass lie in bed breathe deeply a few times and slowly my heart rate returns to normal so far i don t have any other symptoms during these episodes no shortness of breath dizziness or anything else however sometimes i feel some bloating near the stomach diaphragm area which makes me wonder if my symptoms could be related to poor lifestyle habits especially around sleep and dinner which may be affecting my circadian rhythm here s why i think that might be the case: for the past 3 years i ve averaged only about 6 hours of sleep per night i often get caught in overthinking certain aspects of my life which causes mild anxiety though nothing too serious i typically have dinner around 10 pm go to bed at 1:30 or 2 am and often scroll through social media before falling asleep i ve also noticed that i snore which makes me wonder if there might be some breathing obstruction causing me to wake up with a racing heart however i can t confirm if i ve always snored or if i ve had previous episodes of waking up like this without paying much attention also 4 out of 10 times i ve been having some kind of dream though i m not sure if it s a nightmare when i wake up with the racing heart i ve had blood work done three times this year and the latest results were normal in terms of hemoglobin lipid profile cholesterol triglycerides etc and other parameters the only concern was my high sensitivity crp which came back at 4 56 anything above 3 is considered high i consulted a cardiologist with these results but i feel like he didn t fully understand my situation he prescribed beta blockers for anxiety and blood pressure but i feel the prescription was based more on my blood pressure reading during the appointment which was 149 88 and a heart rate of 117 i think those readings were influenced by my anxiety about seeing the doctor and i don t believe they accurately reflect my usual condition additionally the nurse who took my blood pressure didn t seem to pay attention to my posture and she took the reading three times the cardiologist also mentioned that my circadian rhythm might be off due to my poor sleep and dinner habits i chose not to take the prescribed medications and instead sought a second opinion from an experienced family member who works in pathology he advised against taking the blood pressure medications since i don t have high blood pressure he suggested that i could take amitriptyline in a very mild dose if needed but only as a last resort this whole experience has led to increased health anxiety and now i m afraid of going anywhere alone any time i feel a twitch or unexplained pain in my chest i immediately worry it s something related to my heart i d appreciate any advice from people who ve overcome similar situations thanks to everyone who took the time to read this long post and offer their advice

used nasal spray every night for 2 years quitting was brutal sharing what helped posting this because i wish someone had told me earlier after a nose surgery i started using a decongestant spray just to sleep that turned into every single night for more than 2 years if i skipped it my nose felt completely blocked i d wake up early anxious mouth breathing feeling stuck eventually i learned the spray itself was the problem rebound congestion stopping was hard days 3 5 were brutal even around day 10 12 breathing still felt uncomfortable i even slipped once because i was desperate what slowly started helping: completely stopping the decongestant switching to budesonide nasal spray budenase aq non addictive but slow saline spray and steam sleeping with head elevated or on the opposite side breathing exercises when i felt like i couldn t get air recovery timeline rough based on my experience : days 1 3: didn t feel much improvement nose still felt blocked especially at night this phase tests your patience days 4 7: breathing slowly became easier less constant stuffiness sleep started improving a bit days 10 14: noticeable improvement nose felt lighter less urge to reach for the spray weeks 3 6: swelling continued to settle breathing felt much more normal and stable big thing i learned: healing is slow this isn t a 2 day fix it takes weeks if you re using nasal spray daily and feel stuck you re not alone and you re not broken your nose just became dependent i m still recovering but it is improving sharing this in case it helps someone else feel less alone

difficulty inhaling and exhaling tight chest anxiety hi i wanted to share my experience and if anyone has a solution or has gone through the same thing it would be very helpful from my first episode of tachycardia i felt like i was getting tired faster as i had more episodes i felt like my chest was getting harder to breathe i still couldn t understand it and as the episodes continued and time passed i started to feel my chest and even my back tightening more it was progressive which makes me get tired more easily i ve had generalized anxiety for three months now and it s become a bigger problem it s constantly the case that i don t feel like i can breathe properly when i inhale and exhale it feels too slow like there s a blockage it doesn t let the air in or out and it feels heavy it also makes it difficult to speak and the air constantly hits my throat which has irritated it but it seems muscular because when i do a stretch i feel like my breathing gets really tight before i went for walks when i could still do them and i felt like the more i walked the easier my breathing became but i felt like there were lumps in my chest and back when i breathed like there was a blockage there s a lump there that jumps with my steps when i walk lately i feel it s getting worse and now it causes a sensation in my nose and shortness of breath when i walk a lot yes it feels like i can t fill my lungs completely it s worth noting that i ve already had several health tests if anyone has experienced something similar it would be helpful to know about their experience thanks in advance community

life after gad did anyone here take paxil for gad i was diagnosed with gad and depression 3 years ago and was prescribed paxil i took it for 8 months and it did magic for my anxiety but i had to stop it because i gained so much weight my psychiatrist told me to try to stop completely without replacing it with another medication which i did and even after stopping it my anxiety got so much better i m still doing therapy and i still get anxious but it s much better than before after stopping l i went through a rollercoaster of emotions where i would just start crying uncontrollably but this lasted only for one month and got much better afterwards however after more time i started to feel that my whole life changed like i became more connected to myself now that the anxiety was gone but i was still feeling my emotions very intensely i m working with my therapist to try to identify emotions as i couldn t do this when my anxiety was present i went through a lot of hard times last year and they affected me a lot but i also found myself having obsessive tendencies and couldn t regulate my emotions at all i would fall into cycles of obsessing over a thought sometimes for days without being able to think or talk about anything else it became a bit too much on my friends and my partner but no matter how much i tried i couldn t break the cycles until i got very burned out and i feel that when my anxiety was worse my emotions were more under control but now i can t control them at all i can t even do the things that used to help me before like writing or listening to music i don t know if this makes sense or if it s related to the treatment or it s related to the events that happened last year but i ve never felt like this in my whole life has anyone had a similar experience with gad and paxil

two years of medication five years of therapy still at the same place this may be a bit odd post but i am looking for suggestions on what other approaches can i try a bit of context before that: since i became a father i have crippling anxiety regarding the health of my children every time they get a fever i get panic attacks and severe anxiety i also start showing obsessive behaviour such as checking temperature of my kids every 10 minutes when they are ill i also get super worried taking to the doctor in fear that they might diagnose something serious interestingly the trigger for this behaviour is primarily fever i don t have a problem taking my kids to the dentist or worry so much for a physical injury but a fever triggers a fear or unknown and lack of control and i spiral unfortunately young kids fall ill a lot as their immunity is developing so this has made life hell for me and family for last 5 years i have been seeking psychiatric help for this condition i was put on ssris for two years which definitely helped and then the doctor weaned me off saying i only need therapy i have been in therapy on and off for 5 years i have gone through everything from it is normal for parents to worry about their kids to looking at childhood issues that can be causing such strong reactions i have been practising cognitive behaviour therapy meditation spirituality everything but nothing has brought any meaningful improvement two different psychiatrists and therapists have said that i don t need treatment anymore and i can manage unfortunately as soon as one of the kids start coughing and the thermometer shows fever all the anxiety panic and crippling worry rushes back i am looking for advice if there are any alternate treatments i can try as the traditional methods have not brought any meaningful change it s really affecting my ability to function as a good father and i am already noticing my anxiety is rubbing off of my kids negatively personal life is hell as well and my wife is fed up

can t handle the dentist anymore and my teeth are dying i have been cavity prone my whole life and i ve had severe irreversible dental decay for 5 years i m a smoker and i ve had arfid for 17 years due to my arfid i ve been repeatedly getting new cavities every single year since i was a kid and i m in my 20 s now i ve had more fillings and root canals in my life than i can count but every single dentist appointment they are always finding new cavities that developed since my last appointment i geniuenly can t remember the last time they said i didn t have any cavities i also have a half grey tooth that has also been half grey since 2022 despite it being pain free for three years now all of a sudden it hurts like hell surprisingly even though i still have a ton of cavities inside my whole mouth none if my other teeth hurt i currently have 10 cavities all throughout my mouth some of these cavities i got filled earlier this year and some i ve had since 2022 the smoking isn t helping either i know unlike the arfid the smoking is my fault but thankfully i have nicotine patches and i m hoping to be a non smoker again in a few weeks all my other teeth are still pain free but my one half grey tooth is now suddenly hurting so bad it s making it hard to eat and talk whenever i move my cheek too high it hurts really bad i have to make as minimal lip movement as possible when i eat or talk and i have to chew on the other side if i accidentally chew on that side or accidentally move my mouth wrong while talking it hurts i also have a hard time yawning so being tired or bored is kinda awful rn because whenever i yawn it inevitably hurts due to the cheek movement but the cheek movement just makes the pain worse to the point i m visibly in pain the pain is always there even when my mouth isn t moving at all its just mild without the cheek movement clearly i need to go to the dentist and possibly even get this tooth extracted depending on how dead it is rn but my dentist anxiety is so severe i cannot handle it and some dentists can t even handle it every time i ve tried to go to the dentist at my most recent appointments i shake and gag uncontrollably almost the entire time to the point where it s extremely embarrassing for me and makes it very hard for dentists to work on me because i can t stay still and gag whenever tools go in my mouth at certain angles dentists often have to wing it with limited dental x rays when deciding treatment for me because i can t get through even the x rays properly because i can t stop gagging when the chip enters my mouth and then whenever they need to do an actual procedure due to the uncontrollable tremor and senstive gag reflex i ve had dentists have to stop the procedure early because they couldn t work on me only really good and really patient and really experienced dentists can finish a procedure on me and it s still hard for them to because they sometimes get slightly frustrated with me and keep telling me to try and control my breathing even though that clearly doesn t help i actually got dropped by my local dentist because they couldn t complete even basic procedures on me and so i had to switch to a dentist 10 miles away since it s the second closest one that takes my insurance i was put on laughing gas once but it actually made things even worse because i know this isn t a typical reaction so idk why i reacted this way to the nitrous but for some reason the laughing gas masked the effects of the localized anesthesia so i felt the pain during the procedure and started crying that was the only time i ever felt pain during a dental procedure was when i was on laughing gas so never again i was also still highly intoxicated as i was leaving i seemed really drunk the only reason they let me leave was because someone was with me most people begin to sober up the second they re taken off the mask but it didn t wear off for me until a full 30 minutes later the localized anesthesia they inject into my mouth effectively blocks out any pain during any procedure so i typically do not feel any pain so i m never nervous about pain since i know it won t be that painful so that isn t what causes my tremors and gagging it is purely just a physiological reaction to the sensory input the sensory overload from the extremely loud and distressing noise of the tools right in my face make me begin to feel super anxious which then gives me the tremors and the gagging is just because i have an extremely sensitive gag reflex i gag when yawning or even when just brushing my teeth it could play a part in my arfid because i will actually throw up when i taste something i don t like which is why i can t tolerate most foods or some medications the fear of the nausea is what leads to me eating less than 10 foods and its almost all junk food and some of it is acidic or carbonated hence the repeated cavities i always get year after year i ve also tried noise canceling headphones but it doesn t work and then my headphones broke by having it on my neck for so many hours while i was out and so i had to get brand new headphones so at this point some dentists literally can t work on me because i m just too difficult and i literally can t get through an appointment because everything about the reactions and dentists getting frustrated with me and the possibility of wasting my time taking the train to the dentist just to not even be able to get much done it all just gives me way too much anxiety since even laughing gas failed there is absolutely no way to get through dental treatment except generalized anesthesia i truly believe the only way me and most dentists will be able to do it now is if they just fully sedate me if they fr just fully put me under so i don t we will get better for context i am 20f you can check my page and look at my previous posts on different subs if you wanna hear my background etc long story short after a short flight i had a huge breakdown i live with my partner about 10 minutes away from my parents house but im currently staying with my parents i experience horrible anxiety dpdr and the physical symptoms are horrible it s hard to have hope sometimes i have my first therapy session in 5 days since this has all gone done and to be honest i am scared to leave the house because i m afraid to feel these symptoms while not at home but i m proud of myself for accepting help i upped my lexapro dosage from 10mg to 20mg the first week was actual hell on earth i was so up and down and i was convinced i would never get better week 2 i felt symptoms lifting slowly but surely i was able to have a shower and just be present and not roam around in my thoughts and spiral if i m being honest the past 2 days have been hard as my parents have gone away for 2 nights maybe i m out of routine not sure i have moments where i feel horrible but then i have moments of clarity i m holding onto hope and i know that the medication and a physiologist will help me in the long run please give yourself grace this is such a hard thing to deal with the medication in my system is still leveling out from what i have read it can take 4 8 weeks or even up to 3 months for you to really see the benefits i am excited to get help and be able to live my life again

but here goes well firstly i felt very hot this was the first thing i noticed when leaving my room as it was hot inside i had my jacket and a jumper on and i could feel i was getting almost too hot and couldn t cool down then i felt a tightness in my chest whilst driving as i couldn t cool down then i felt just like something was wrong i can t put my finger on it but something was wrong with me and during this it s like something hit me i became so crucially self aware of myself almost like i was so aware that it became incredibly overwhelming this felt like too much followed by my i think usual chest pains which doctors claim to be lactic acid very likely which then caused like a pulsating through my body like i was trying to jump out of my skin like my body was trying to be extremely quickly sick like it was trying to jump out of me whilst not really being incredibly nauseous and this pulsating jumped through my body a few times before i called my partner speaking i felt like i it ll pass 3 hey everyone approx 2 years ago i had a really bad weed induced anxiety or panic i am not sure tbh attack and was convinced i was having a heart attack and that i was about to die i ve never had anxiety panic attack before until that time i developed a fear about having heart attack after that day whenever my heart rate increased even a tiny bit my whole focus would shift to my chest i d check my bpm several times a day my hands would get sweaty all the time couldn t focus on anything etc it sucked real hard after the cardiologist visit and wearing a holter for 2 3 days i was certain that it was pyschological from that day on i kept telling myself it s all in your head you won t die today every time i felt bad btw after that anxiety attack i realized i was also afraid of death and that s something i still work on today internally in my case it wasn t about just my heart today i realized it s been around a year since i last worried about my heart and i can smoke again without my heart going crazy during that time i was seeking comfort from here occasionally by reading what other people are going through so maybe this ll comfort someone: it s a temporary situation and it ll pass first you need to eliminate the physical conditions and considering you are probably an average young person trust me it s really unlikely you to die from a heart attack don t let it control your life try to observe as it happens just observe don t react you know it s all in your head so there is no need to feed that negative loop don t try to run away from it either it s a part of you that you need to work on it even though it s said easier than done with time it gets easier it ll take different time for everyone since everyone is different but i assure it ll pass one day also little side note before all of that i thought people were exaggerating it about anxiety panic attacks and i was thinking them as weak people oh boy was i wrong lol

how can i tell when my symptoms are anxiety and when something is medically wrong with me i may be wording this poorly but i m not sure how else to ask i ve been diagnosed with panic disorder for just over a year now and while it s gotten easier as i learn more about my symptoms i can t help but stress that something else may be really wrong with me every time they occur one of my main symptoms is brain fog dizziness and it shows up seemingly out of nowhere i can be having a pretty normal day and then i get a little dizzy and suddenly i m convinced something must be very wrong and then i start panicking and having other symptoms other things i get like shivering numbness and tingling are all definitely unpleasant but feel manageable to me and on their own don t lead to a full on panic attack although they usually occur once i m already having one one of my other issues is food i know this one is pretty common but my appetite and my anxiety have a very odd relationship sometimes i won t have any anxiety until i ve eaten a full meal and then once i feel full for some reason i feel afraid like i might get sick sometimes i eat and my stomach feels indescribably strange like i can somehow feel the food i just ate in my stomach the best i can describe it is as if i can feel my digestive process i know i can t i definitely got some odd looks from doctors by saying that sometimes i avoid eating because i m afraid of these feelings so i get dizzy and i already talked about how that goes i just wanted to know if anyone else has these symptoms worries i know health anxiety is huge for so many people here and i ve definitely experienced my fair share of overthinking my symptoms and fearing i may be dying or sick but one of my biggest issues is that dizziness and stomach issues are both symptoms of so many other serious illnesses and i m afraid i ll never know for sure if i m just having my normal anxiety or if something really is wrong i m also worried my diagnosis will always be a way for doctors to brush aside my concerns and not take me seriously having anxiety doesn t necessarily mean i there isn t something else going on and i just wanted to know if anyone else has had any luck differentiating between what is being caused by anxiety and what needs to be seen by a doctor

driving anxiety returned after accident i ve struggled with severe driving anxiety resulting in me only getting my license this past summer at age 26 shortly after i got a job that requires a half hour commute on the highway there is no public transit option i was doing it and things were going pretty well until we had our first real snowfall of the season it was that sort of weather where the snow is half sticking half melting i m still not entirely sure what exactly happened but on a bend in the road at highway speeds i lost control of my car it slid left then right then left again across the oncoming lane of traffic and into the ditch thank god no one was hurt nothing was hit and my car wasn t even damaged however the ditch was too steep to drive out of so i had to call for a winch in the moment itself i was actually pretty calm but the aftermath is that this has destroyed my confidence in driving what fucks me up is that a i still don t really know what caused me to lose control like that and b things could have been so much worse braking had zero effect until i was off the road in the ditch which was grassy i lost control of my car it was only luck that no other cars were around to be hit thank god no one was hurt and my car wasn t even damaged i missed work that day but had to go in the next the whole day i felt like i was falling apart like no one understood or cared how scared i was and how hopeless i feel however taxing i found regular driving winter driving is 1000x worse i ve gone back to asking my parents to ride with me because i m afraid of doing it by myself and i absolutely hate losing that independence i hate that independence requires driving but that s another rant for another post i ve made peace with the fact that most of my anxieties are irrational like being afraid of talking on the phone is objectively pretty silly and i can accept that but driving is something that seems completely rational to fear and this incident has only reinforced it in this instance i feel like i m the sane one and it s everyone else who s crazy why are people okay with piloting around giant hunks of metal at high speeds when it objectively leads to thousands of accidents and injuries every year why do people just accept this as part of life i genuinely do not understand it the only advice people give me is to get back on the road how every time i start feeling confident in myself that s when things go wrong

had my first anxiety attack in years this week post title is pretty much the tldr i had my first proper anxiety attack in 10 years this week and now i m worried that i might be regressing tw: mention of emetophobia fear of vomit being sick i got some last minute theatre tickets with my family and on the day of i woke up feeling a little nervous about it this was a familiar feeling as the theatre has been a big trigger for me in the past i think it s something about the sense of feeling trapped and like i can t easily get out if i wanted to i have also struggled with emetophobia in the past so there is also an element of worrying about feeling a need to be sick and not being able to get to a bathroom in time i tried to push the anxiety away but as the day went on i started feeling worse and by the time i made it to my seat that evening i could feel my heart going a million miles an hour i tried sipping on a bottle of water and practising deep breaths but nothing was helping eventually the nerves became outright panic and i didn t even make it to the end of act 1 before practically bolting from my seat thankfully our row was quite empty so i was able to get out quickly some staff members responded very quickly to check on me while i was hiding in the bathroom and i told them what had happened and they were very kind and offered to get me some water and a different seat nearer to the exit i reunited with my family at the interval and they were really worried asking if i wanted to go home but i brushed them off and assured them i was okay i did move to a seat at the end of the row and thankfully was able to finish watching the show but the experience has nonetheless really rattled me as i said in the first paragraph i have not experienced such intense anxiety symptoms in at least 10 years back in february i went to a different theatre production and sat right in the middle of a sold out show with next to no legroom either side of me and was absolutely fine back in september i did experience something similar on a plane as we were approaching to land again with that anxiety about feeling trapped in my seat fear of being sick meaning i had to wake up the person sat next to me to make another dash to the bathroom to calm down i am now really worried that this anxiety is going to become an issue for me again it nearly ruined my life before i could barely get on a bus or a train without feeling panic i fought like hell to get past it back then and i have absolutely zero idea what might be bringing it back now does anyone have any advice on what i might be able to do to prevent further attacks or if there might be some deeper psychological thing i need to work through i have been feeling quite tense recently due to stress at work plus tensions with my family meaning that home doesn t feel like a relaxing environment so i wonder if this could be a manifestation of that thank you for reading

trigger warning: symptoms and potential diagnosis hi whoever reads this i hope you are well if you have seen my previous posts they are still there if not you will be able to see that my anxiety started a few weeks ago now and the physical symptoms have ruined my life i have been to the doctors 7 times and the hospital 3 times they all told me the same thing i m perfectly healthy i m manifesting the symptoms due to my anxiety i have now registered with a new doctor and my first appointment was today i also went to the hospital 3 days ago my new doctor told me that with his patients he will read through their history but he likes to get to know them and judge from that the second i told him my symptoms he told me that my vitamin d is extremely low 17 and that i need to start the strongest tablets today he then did my blood pressure standing and sitting and told me i need to go straight to the hospital because of how low it is even though every time i ve been to the hospital and doctors they have not mentioned this once i obviously started freaking out but was relieved someone finally was listening luckily he was able to access my x ray from a few days ago and could see that my lungs and heart are working fine but was concerned about organ failure i need an urgent cortisol blood test and have had an urgent referral put through for a cardiologist and have been told if i faint i need to ring 999 straight away i know with anxiety especially health anxiety it s hard to know whether you are manifesting this physically or if there is actually something wrong but please if anyone is not 100 certain and you do not feel like yourself go to the doctor or go to the hospital and if they dismiss you change doctors this isn t to scare anybody as luckily this is really fixable with tablets but the fact this could have been solved 7 weeks ago rather than me get worse is crazy i will always advocate for myself now and will never settle for you re fine it s anxiety if i even have the slightest doubt that it isn t

you didn t waste that year i saw some posts about regretting wasting time being anxious and fearing that when you look back you ll realize you never truly lived during what should have been your best years my first thought reading it was: why do we always look back and blame the person who was already doing her best when we grow and reach a new level of understanding it s easy to feel disconnected from who we used to be but don t judge her that younger self that person was doing everything she could with the knowledge and tools she had at the time she was surviving i used to see the college entrance exam as more important than life itself back then everything around me family school society was telling me exactly that i didn t have the awareness to question it let alone push back now i understand because i ve grown i ve left my hometown seen more of the world read more watched more stories that moved me but i would never say to the girl who stayed up until 4 a m every night from anxiety who sometimes needed medication just to get through the day i would never tell her you were wasting your time instead i want to say: look how far i ve come from that place i am so much stronger than i knew and i m really proud of her proud of me we don t move forward by criticizing who we were we move forward by thanking her for enduring and by loving who we re becoming you didn t waste that year you were gathering strength you didn t even know you had

i overcame debilitating public speaking anxiety and survived a 30 minute presentation i 27m have always had an irrational fear of public speaking presentations ever since i was in school i would go to extreme lengths of making up excuses faking sick to skip presentations or any form of public speaking this stemmed from early horrifying experiences of public speaking when i had no choice but to present i would find myself completely frozen my face would turn red lips would start quivering and my facial muscles would stiff up severely the worst this would even happen during social situations if i m caught off guard for a mini speech or if the spotlight was suddenly on me for presentations i wouldn t be able to look anyone and i d end up reading off slides with my back faced towards the audience funnily enough i was able to mostly work in remote roles early on in my career even when i had to go to office and present it would typically be in a low stakes catch up meeting with less than 10 people it wasn t nerve wrecking as i d present while seated with the rest of the team which made it feel less intimidating fast forward to this year i was asked to deliver a 2 minute demo in front of my entire company 100 ish during our townhall the first time they made me do it i got so nervous i made up a ridiculous excuse and got a colleague to cover i knew this wouldn t be sustainable so i prepared myself for the next couple of townhalls stumbled upon propranolol while researching on ways to combat anxiety and was able to pull through the presentations were very short just a couple of minutes and both times i had someone to present with i remember the first one going great because i addressed the crowd directly without feeling nervous the second time felt somewhat scary but i could still do it i took roughly 30 40mg of propranolol both times fast forward to recent events i was asked to present for 30 mins in a company wide event the moment i found out it completed killed me i ve never done this before i spent the next month leading up to the event debating whether to do it couldn t focus on anything it was all i ever thought about how on earth was i going to present for 30 minutes in front of so many people somehow i psyched myself to do it out of fear of being found out on the day of the event i considered strongly whether to still continue as my anxiety was debillitating however i felt it was too late to pull out as soon as i stepped into my office the fear paralysed me i was so so incredibly close to just walking straight back out and going home with an excuse of feeling unwell however i knew deep down avoidance would just grow this fear to the point of no potential return i should mention that i took 60mg of propranolol highest dose yet to get me through this yet it only helped with the physical symptoms so my mind was still racing somehow by god s grace i decided to just go up there when it was my turn to my surprise it went a whole lot better than i expected i absolutely killed it adding points which i didn t have during my practice runs making light jokes engaging with the audience it was as if the anxiety just dissipated within the first 30 seconds i m very certain propranolol helped because it s usually the physical symptoms that send my nerves to the extreme by the end of it i got a solid applause and compliments on my presentation skills everyone thought i was a natural which is insane considering i ve barely ever presented in my life in front of that many people if i could impart some key takeways from my experience it would be: 1 if i can do it so can you trust me my fear was irrational beyond belief 2 propranolol is a game changer my hr is usually in the 100s during these things it stabilised between 60 80 this time 3 practice practice practice this definitely made me feel confident in pushing through

anxiety about taking xanax got prescribed xanax for my anxiety frequent panic attacks yay i got prescribed 0 5mg and 30 of them a month i have general anxiety all the time but i m in therapy and really focusing on managing my anxiety through techniques other than meds if i m being honest though i ve been trying this for the last 10 years and i ve made a lot of progress ive definitely been able to calm myself down from a couple panic attacks i still panicked for a bit lol but i feel like i managed to calm down quicker with some doing breathing and grounding techniques anyway despite my best effort it s been too long of forcing myself to white knuckle through my anxiety thinking i just need to try harder and i ll be fixed one day ironically i m having anxiety about taking xanax i ve always had anxiety about taking any medication i had a traumatic experience as an infant where i had to be restrained to be worked on of course they fed me pain meds and all kinds of stuff because this was due to the tip of my finger being cut off i guess subconsciously this messed me up somehow so now i really struggle with taking any medications given the anxiety i already have around any medication on top of that i know all of the stigma around benzos and how they can be highly addictive i totally know i sound irrational but i have anxiety what can i say my mind tells me what if i become dependent what if i have a bad reaction is my anxiety even bad enough for this should i wait until my anxiety attack is severe before i take one i know i m not the only one with anxiety around taking benzos and i guess i m just looking for some advice and support for those that take any benzo do you take it regularly or only on your high anxiety days what is your personal threshold for when you know okay i need it now this is something i m working with my therapist on but i d love to hear from others who have had similar experiences with meds

how do you know it s high anxiety day besides the obvious what ways does your body let you know it s been a high anxiety day i know mine has been extra rough when my eye sight gets really blurry also the absolute back to back palpitations and the wonderful feeling of dread doom and unease in my chest aaaand the shaking lol kinda hard to word this how does everyone else know when their anxiety has been super bad other than you know being anxious kinda curious sorry if this makes no sense lol edit i just wanted to come back and say that when i made this post i didn t think i d see so many similar sensations and feelings to what i have and experience it s amazing how tied together you feel with total strangers who go through the same things you do it really does make you feel like you aren t alone in this battle there is always someone who is going through their day to day life feeling the same as you and it really takes courage and bravery to push yourself out of that comfort zone even if it is just a simple task like getting the mail or taking a shower thank you so much to everyone who has commented and shared their feelings i know how awful this may feel but if we keep pushing and boosting each other up we can do this happy holidays to each and every one of you i pray that the new year brings us clarity relief and happiness

mental health counseling only helpful over the short term hello everyone i am 25m in the usa with autism similar in severity to what was once known as asperger s and generalized anxiety disorder i ve had both of these conditions since i was a kid i am seeking some input here from my fellow reddit users i have a somewhat troubling history with mental health counseling also known as talk therapy that i m wondering if others can relate to i have this problem where i will utilize talk therapy for several sessions due to my anxiety issues complete the program and then relapse back to feeling anxious within a few years of completing the program i have attended therapy programs on four different occasions with four different therapists and have had the same end result with all of them i will provide a few examples below therapist 1 2012 : i worked with a therapist for a summer at age 12 i felt less anxious after completing the program but by spring of 2013 my anxiety symptoms had returned this was the year i started middle school and i had also been forced to discontinue my anxiety med at age 11 due to health issues so not as certain with this particular instance therapist 2 2015 : i worked with a therapist for several months during 2015 age 14 15 for me i did really well with this program but by the end of 2015 i had fallen back into rather significant anxiety and by may of 2017 i was having panic attacks which i d never experienced before then i was a high school student during this time therapist 3 2017 : i worked with a therapist in summer of 2017 age 17 due to the panic attacks i did well with this program but had relapsed into anxiety by probably mid 2019 i was nearly finished with high school during this time therapist 4 2021 : i worked with a therapist for several months in the summe of 2021 age 21 as my psychiatrist ordered therapy as part of my anxiety treatment plan i failed to make any notable anxiety progress with this therapist and am still struggling with my anxiety up to this day do you see the pattern here i always seem to see some improvement with my anxiety for a short time after working with a therapist but then always fall back into anxiety within a couple of years does anyone else who s been in therapy experience this pattern if so what do you do to break out of it i am asking because i ve been having some personal issues after the d c and my pmdd is out of control i see a specialist for this and we have tried to alter my medications progesterone naltrexone and it has only made my anxiety worse before meeting my
