my pcp minimized my anxiety to my face and i can t stop replaying it i just need to vent because i m still upset about how dismissive my doctor was today i ve been on disability for severe anxiety and burnout since the beginning of november my therapist had originally referred me to a disability clinic for the state paperwork but they don t handle my employer s disability insurance since my pcp already knew everything i d been dealing with i thought going through her for the next part made sense she s the one who treated all the physical symptoms i didn t even realize were tied to anxiety when i kept having constant nausea and vomiting she referred me to gastroenterology gi found nothing when i broke out in stress hives and had a mild autoimmune marker she referred me to rheumatology they also found nothing she prescribed prednisone and hydroxyzine for the hives xanax when the anxiety turned into chest tightness and even buspirone earlier in the year because my depression anxiety screening scores were elevated she had every piece of evidence that things were getting worse i even called her office before scheduling to make sure she handles mental health disability paperwork they said yes if they had said no i would ve found somewhere else but the appointment was awful i came in with a full timeline because this didn t happen overnight and i didn t even get through the first part before she cut me off and basically told me to get a new job as if switching industries in your mid 30s after a 12 year career is easy as if i m mentally stable enough to job hunt as if the la job market is booming as if that magically fixes months of anxiety and physical symptoms then she said she can t do more because other people have real disabilities hearing that made me feel like she thought i was exaggerating or trying to avoid work even though she s the one who has been treating the vomiting hives chest pain insomnia and elevated anxiety scores for months my therapist recommended several months off because she believes i hit full burnout i wasn t asking for anything unreasonable i just needed documentation for what s actually been happening she did fill out the paperwork i needed but it was obvious she was reluctant and only signed off through the beginning of january because that was the maximum she was willing to do one month not what matched my symptoms just where she personally decided to stop it didn t feel supportive at all and the worst part is that instead of having time to rest or work on my mental health i ve spent most of this disability leave stressed out about paperwork approvals and whether i d even be believed the first part of my leave hasn t felt like healing it s felt like navigating a system that doesn t take mental health seriously i left feeling embarrassed invalidated and honestly hurt i know i m not faking anything but it still stings to be treated like you re not disabled enough especially by someone who has been treating the physical and mental fallout of this the entire year i m exhausted and i hate that asking for help made everything worse i just needed to get it out

heart related nerve compression issues gerd or anxiety has anyone experienced these symptoms age: 30 height: 5 11 weight: 103kg this random attack suddenly happened to me while i was working back in april i had a strange inner chest tightness and my left arm became tingly and numb i remained conscious throughout the whole experience my body was shaking and during the tightness which lasted around 10 seconds i remember my surround sound stopping and all i could hear was my heart pounding in my ears i put myself into the recovery position because i had no idea what i was going through i was in shock and the first thing i thought was that i was having a heart attack it was a very strange feeling and still difficult to describe to this day an ambulance attended my workplace they conducted an ecg checked my blood pressure and sugar levels and everything was normal i was taken to the hospital where blood tests and further ecgs were done and they all came back clear for the first two weeks after the attack i was severely distressed because i still had no idea what had happened to my body this distress caused the chest tightness to occur two more times and i had to call an ambulance again further ecgs and blood tests were carried out and again everything was clear since then my whole nervous system feels dysregulated i constantly feel a rush of adrenaline and have weak jelly like legs i have a constant pressure in my head and body i feel like the chest tightness episode caused trauma my whole chest wall has felt tight ever since i sometimes get a burning sensation in my chest like something is stuck in my throat i get shortness of breath i also experience a loss of balance almost like a sinking feeling behind my sternum my left forearm and hand constantly have an electrical tingly pins and needles sensation i experience heart palpitations i just feel physically exhausted with these ongoing constant symptoms that won t go away going to sleep with this feeling can be difficult at times i do suffer from neck issues stemming from a car accident in 2022 my neck has worsened over time i constantly feel the need to crack it and when it flares up the pain can this blew my mind: your gut reacts to stress way before your thoughts do something i noticed that changed how i see anxiety: my gut reacts to stress way faster and way louder than my actual thoughts it doesn t understand fear danger or what if thoughts it only understands: tension pressure breathing patterns how fast i m eating how safe or unsafe my body feels and when the gut freaks out it sends these intense signals upward that feel exactly like anxiety what confused me for years is that the body can create the anxiety feeling even when the mind is calm sometimes it s not: what am i anxious about but: what is my body trying to signal right now things like: not sleeping enough eating too fast holding tension in the diaphragm shallow breathing feeling rushed sitting in a weird position can create the same physical sensation as anxiety it s wild how the body can set the emotional tone before the brain even forms a thought this made me realize: sometimes the feeling comes first and the thoughts try to explain it afterward

finally recovering from years of panic disorder and somatic ocd : hello everyone its been 3 years now that i ve been suffering from a panic disorder and somatic ocd and i guess i really wanted to get this out and finally be able to express myself and what i went thru and hope that my post can help others suffering from this combination feel less alone and hopeful about their future and share my progress with you all as im very proud of what i have achieved for the past 6 months but i have no one to share it with i m 23 and most of my life i have always been fairly normal except for my social anxiety as a teenager which i guess started all of this unconsciously ive never thought once in my life that it would get this bad and id be dealing with this hell of a disorder 3 years ago is when everything started one day i started noticing my breathing and i couldn t stop noticing it which lead me to start breathing manually at first it was fine as i thought it would go away on its own but it never did and i found myself breathing manually for 70 of the day i couldn t sleep and i couldn t talk to people at all which made me thought i would be like this for the rest of my life i would never be able to breathe automatically again this experience lead me to develop the panic disorder everytime i was breathing manually so many about 15k times a day i would panic cause i thought this would never end and i broke myself and in the span of 6 months it became so deeply ingrained that it essentially became a pattern after 6 month the manual breathing went away as in 2022 chatgpt came along and i was finally able to get a tool where it could give me direct advice and understand it and it gave me solid advice to just not fight it and let it happen and it worked but the panic stayed as my brain made it a new baseline to panic every time i breathed like conditioning and i was experiencing a panic attack about every 10 minutes or so and everytime i breathed every day for the next 2 years it was horrible i think a lot of people here knows how it feels like so i don t really have to describe it but it was hell nothing worked to stop it 6 months ago i finally started seeking therapy for it and my therapist recommended me act and exposure therapy where you accept the feelings and let it happen and expose your brain to it until it becomes desensitized to it on its own and it has finally been able to break me out of this hell i fought so hard every day to expose myself to the panic to different triggers and now although i still have it i am able to function normally despite the panic attacks being here from times to times and im able to make it background noise and know that nothing will happen to me its so freeing to finally get myself back my freedom and being able to do things knowing it cant hurt me i saw a huge reduction in the frequency of when it happens from like every 10 minutes to every 4 5 hours or so and when it happens now it subsides quickly like after 30 seconds or a minute i only get peaks now and it goes away im very proud of myself from what ive accomplished and i keep looking forward to my future and finding my peace and i hope that anyone else suffering from this does too just know there is a light at the end of it and i hope you all find your light its hard but we are incredibly strong its a horrible disorder and yet we are palpitations pvcs ruining me i don t even know where to start i feel like pvcs have been controlling my life for months now and i m honestly exhausted i ve always been a little prone to health anxiety but it was never debilitating until this whole pvc mess started it s like the second i felt that first weird thump in my chest everything in my life got divided into before and after for most of my life i never really thought about my heartbeat i knew anxiety could make me feel off sometimes but i never paid attention to the physical stuff too much then one night completely out of nowhere i felt this huge thud in my chest like my heart literally flipped over it scared the hell out of me i sat up immediately convinced something terrible was happening but then nothing else happened until it did more random thumps then quiet then another one i barely slept that night because i was just lying there waiting for the next one after that it was like my brain locked onto my heartbeat 24 7 i couldn t stop scanning myself every little flutter or pause sent me spiraling i tried to talk myself down at first telling myself it was just anxiety but i d never felt anything like that before so of course my mind automatically jumped to the worst case scenario i finally went to the doctor totally prepared to hear something terrifying they did an ekg which of course came back normal because my heart always behaves perfectly when someone else is looking at it eventually they sent me for a holter monitor i wore the stupid thing for 24 48 hours felt like i was hyper aware of every beat while it was attached and when the results came back they said it showed some pvcs and pacs but still under the concerning range apparently benign love that word benign it should ve made me feel better but it honestly didn t all i could think was: if they re so benign why do they feel so awful why do they feel like my heart is tripping over itself i cut out caffeine completely which was its own nightmare i cut out alcohol i drank more water than any human should i tried breathing exercises stretching sleeping earlier everything sometimes the pvcs went away for days which gave me false hope and then boom one random night i d get a cluster of them and be right back at square one it s like my body waits until i finally relax and then throws one in just to keep me unstable the worst part is that when i m doing something fun or distracting i barely feel them at all which tells me anxiety is definitely feeding the fire but the second i m quiet or trying to sleep or even just sitting still my whole brain zooms in on my chest is that a flutter was that a skipped beat am i about to go into some deadly arrhythmia it s honestly pathetic how much time i spend just thinking about my heart i used to worry about normal life stuff now i worry about whether one rogue heartbeat is going to kill me i know logically pvcs are common i know tons of people have them and don t even notice i know my tests were fine and my doctor wasn t concerned but it feels like i can t escape this loop i m tired of constantly checking my pulse i m tired of bracing myself for the next thump i m tired of being scared to lie down at night because that s when they hit the hardest i feel like my entire personality has been replaced with someone who just obsesses over their heart rhythm all day i guess i m just venting because i don t know what else to do i don t want pvcs to take over my life but right now it feels like they already have if anyone else has dealt with this or gotten through it i would genuinely love to hear how because i m starting to forget what normal even feels like

anxiety hangover in full effect on saturday night i started to not feel super great and went to bed wearing my fitbit and before falling asleep saw my pulse was at 110 lying down proceeded to sleep about an hour before waking up panicked and seeing my pulse over 110 again that kicked off 5 hours of me being unable to sleep for the rest of the night and just laying in bed panicking and not feeling well attempted to get up and go to work and felt ok after a shower and for the first half hour but when i tried to eat my breakfast just felt sick was constantly either too hot and sweating or too cold and freezing eventually decided after 2 hours at work to go home and rest after getting home i check my blood pressure to see it at 145 100 and checked my blood sugar i am diabetic to find it at 250 that lead me to driving myself to the er after some blood tests being hooked to a ecg and blood pressure monitor that showed me at 160 115 and a full bag of saline drip got told it was likely just a stomach bug and to go rest it off but realized after they released me they never did blood tests to rule out clots and started to panic i was having a heart attack ended up going to my moms and having a good cry and felt much better and was able to sleep that night although tossing and turning pretty regularly decided to call in the next day to rest and relax and got an hour walk in and was feeling a lot better a more restful sleep later and i went to work the next day and made it through about 75 of the day before feelings of anxiety came back got off work went for another walk and then took a shower before bed where i took 40mg of cbd gummies and a 3mg melatonin gummy felt alright and went to bed only to wake up freaking out again this time no nausea but just a heart burn like pain in my chest and joint soreness in my shoulders and elbows ended up staying awake for 4 hours before i was able to get a little more sleep in and go to work where after 75 of the day we went to a company bowling event before i showed up to work was able to meditate and stop the nerves in my body from being on end but still felt plenty of anxiety throughout the day and random chest tightness heartburn feelings as well as pain in between my shoulder blades now i m at home sitting on a heating pack on my back and trying to calm down thankfully i don t work tomorrow but just feel so tired done with this feeling that something is wrong even though i know that if i were having any kind of cardiac emergency it would ve been more pronounced and more of an issue either on my walks or while bowling with my co workers i guess i just wanted to vent but if anyone has tips for things i can do to not be so on edge or even just to help someone know they re not alone in their feelings right now we will get through this and feel better i know it

nuropod actually seems to have helped so about 4 months ago i decided to talk with dr gpt about anxiety and see if it had any suggestions i hadn t already thought of it actually mentioned one that i had messed with in different ways but never this directly vagus nerve stimulation i had tried various forms of vns in terms of breathing exercises meditation even stimulating the dive response by putting a cold mask on which is supposed to stimulate the vegas nerve however none of them every really seemed to make a big dent i found several vegas nerve stimulators online however the nurood it s pricey came with the most research behind it what you do is attach a little clip to your left ear and it delivers tiny electric shocks it feels like a slight pulsing i do it for 20 minutes in the morning while doing breathing exercises and then 30 minutes at night while watching tv in bed from what i have read you don t want to overdo it as it can cause overstimulation that way however i can say that it certainly seems to have helped my anxiety spikes don t seem to be as debilitating as they were i recently did something that used to cause me huge anxiety walk instead of drive to the supermarket so i didn t have a quick escape and while i felt some anxiety it wasn t the usual 9 10 i would get which is what led me to just drive instead even though it is only a mile away this is not a cure by any means and it is expensive 900 but it does seem to have helped so i wanted to share just google nuropod and you will find it

just admitted to myself that i have food anxiety what now i 26f have been struggling with i guess you could call it disordered eating or food anxiety i never had an eating disorder per se but for as long as i can remember i ve had anxiety about food when i was born i was premature by 2 months and have always had issues with eating my mom even said that whenever she was breastfeeding or bottlefeeding she would have to feed me in increments because i would always throw up i never really had a big appetite and as i got a little older there was a period of time where my father wouldn t let me leave the dinner table until i ate all of my food which would cause me to get sick again ever since then i would have frequent occurrences where i could be starving but as soon as there s food in front of me i would get nauseous and can t eat there would be instances where i would be at a restaurant with my family and as soon as the food comes out i get nauseous try to take small bites then start gagging and have to go outside it could be triggered by even the sight and smell of food it has definitely gotten better now that i m an adult but i still experience this food anxiety in certain situations for example this past thanksgiving i started getting anxious when it was dinner time it was a sit down dinner not like previous years where everyone kind of grazed throughout the night no tv no music just everyone at the table eating i m prescribed an anxiety med that i take for emergencies which definitely helped with the anxiety symptoms sweating deep breathing etc but i still had no appetite and would get nauseous whenever i tried to put food in my mouth it isn t until later when i m calm that my appetite comes back and i can eat everything in sight my mom thinks that it s a subconscious trauma response to my dad force feeding me since i ve never explored it until now i don t know what form of therapy or what kind of specialized doctor would be able to help me with this it s very embarrassing and something i m upset i can t control any advice is very much appreciated

20 m need some advice for anxiety in the first week of october i developed a gut infection after several painful episodes of diarrhea which was followed by a bladder infection and a uti over the following weeks this sequence of illnesses triggered muscle spasms nerve tingling burning numbness abdominal and groin pain debilitating fatigue and significant stress i had never experienced that level of pain all at the same time ever in my life i was prescribed levofloxacin for the uti along with a few other medications and vitamin supplement to manage the gi symptoms during this period i became extremely stressed and hyper focused on my symptoms constantly looking up diseases and catastrophizing worrying that this might become a lifelong condition by early november the accumulation of symptoms and fear caused my stress levels to escalate even further and i was only sleeping about two hours each night although the primary infection symptoms have now subsided i m still dealing with lingering issues: nerve tingling headaches often accompanied by a heavy feeling in my head fatigue shortness of breath rapid shallow breathing frequent yawning and muscle aches in my neck shoulders and back since early november i ve also had a persistent dry burning sensation in my eyes for which i m using eye drops it feels like my body is stuck in a constant fight or flight or freeze mode my doctor believes this is generalized anxiety disorder gad and suggested both cbt and an ssri been to 1 session of cbt don t think it was too useful because i couldn t attribute what my anxiety trigger was will continue cbt though all of this is very new to me i ve been through stressful situations before but i ve never experienced anything like this even caffeine makes my physical symptoms significantly worse so i ve had to stop it which has been a huge bummer most days now i feel mentally calm but physically pained and exhausted its not like a thought is triggering physical symptoms of anxiety its more like these symptoms are always there throughout the day right now i ve started doing yoga meditation and trying to improve my diet just wanted some advice from anyone who has dealt with something similar especially regarding medication as thats something i would preferably want to avoid sorry if this is too long

advice on anxiety freeze response i have this chronic freeze thing where my brain shuts down very easily physically and mentally whenever i try to do anything like thinking speaking tasks hobbies etc i don t feel the panic my body jumps straight into freezing but i m also hyper vigilant at the exact same time i notice everything and everyone around me i notice how their energy and moods drop and it signals danger which makes it worse and then if i try to force myself out of being frozen i start spiralling crying and hyperventilating etc or sometimes this just comes after being frozen too which then leads into autistic shutdown it feels different to my normal anxiety because i don t feel any warnings at all it s like someone slamming on the brakes and i jump headfirst into freeze with no warning before i feel a drop of the worrying feeling anxious and scared i feel like i m constantly like 60 70 frozen and only like 30 of me is actually doing what i m supposed to do but i also experience chronic brain fog i m not sure if that s also related my freezing or if that s its own thing it s very weird i m not sure if i m even describing it correctly so i m sorry i m autistic so putting things into words and sentences is also difficult for me i have tried cognitive behavioural therapy but it doesn t help at all because there s no thoughts to challenge when the freeze hits i ve tried grounding but honestly grounding exercises only make me angry grounding helps if i m having a panic attack where i m hyperventilating or having spiralling thoughts but it really does not touch the freeze it feels like anything i do to unfreeze my brain just triggers me again and i m extremely exhausted from it any advice would be greatly appreciated and knowing if there s others that experience this would also help me not catastrophise my experience because so far i ve only learnt i m not worthy of help because the help does not help at all everything i ve tried so far as had no positive outcomes

10 14 day anxiety waves false windows and now starting mirtazapine quetiapine anyone else relate day 10 of latest episode hey everyone i m in the middle of another 10 14 day anxiety episode and i feel completely overwhelmed i ve tracked these cycles for months but this one has hit really hard and i m hoping someone else out there understands this pattern my anxiety doesn t come as single panic attacks it comes in waves over many days full body surges buzzing nerves morning cortisol dread doom thinking then random short windows of calm before the next crash my typical pattern: emotional trigger a few days later the morning anxiety starts waves throughout the day sometimes hours long brief windows that have me into thinking i m ok late evenings i am mostly ok perhaps slight lingering anxiety then an even worse day after that the peak always lands around day 7 10 things only really settle after a couple of solid nights of sleep this episode started around 1st december after a difficult emotional trigger involving family stuff slowly built into full hyperarousal: barely sleeping buzzing legs adrenaline dumps internal shaking doom the lot medication timeline this part feels important : i was originally prescribed mirtazapine 7 5mg about a month ago i took it once back then but didn t like how it felt day 7: took 7 5mg again actually slept really well that night day 8: took the same 7 5mg but this time the anxiety completely overpowered it horrible sleep constant waves felt like i was falling apart day 9: ended up in a e because the waves were relentless and i couldn t cope they reviewed everything and prescribed: mirtazapine 15mg at night quetiapine 25mg twice daily so day 9 last night was when i actually started the 15mg mirt quetiapine combo last night on the 15mg and 12 5mg quetiapine i finally slept properly again deep long restorative sleep but today day 10 i m still getting strong waves emotionally i still feel shaken and unstable where i m at right now: day 10 of this episode physical intensity strong today even after solid sleep emotional intensity still high terrified tomorrow might be another bad day really hoping two nights of good sleep will break this cycle these episodes feel like my nervous system is stuck switched on for 10 days straight it s horrible does anyone else get these long multi day waves where one day looks promising and the next day hits harder and if you ve taken mirtazapine or low dose quetiapine for this kind of prolonged episode how long did it take before things genuinely eased any replies would really help

propranolol might be a life saver i just wanted to share my experience because i was hesitant to start any drug i started therapy and met with a psychiatrist this week for my driving and flying anxiety the anxiety is so bad like almost immediately and automatically a panic attack when getting on the freeway the psychiatrist gave me 10 mg propranolol and today was my first time trying it after an hour i could not feel any inkling of anxiety so i decided to see what would happen if i hopped on the freeway my brain still had some fear but not feeling any of the physical symptoms almost immediately changed the way i view driving i wondered why i ever felt scared most of my anxiety stems from the physical sensations and i think my brain learned to fear things based on what my body tells it so i think the propranolol will help to train my brain to not be scared of these things on top of therapy emdr i think this might be the golden ticket

panic disorder advice insights s hey ive been suffering from panic disorder since i was very young maybe 13 14 this has hindered my life and opportunities a great deal it started out once every couple of months at the time i had no idea how to describe what i was feeling so i called them headaches what i ultimately was feeling after alot of psychological imput was anxiety attacks w depersonalization i was so impacted by the depersonalization effects that i started to retreat and avoid situations and places all together for a time i became very agoraphobic ive been on ssris currently 250mg daily of sertraline generic zoloft for a long time w 1mg clonozapam daily for over 15 years ive began to see how its affected my brain memory some cognitive function lack of creativity sex drive the clonozapam has always been a staple but ive switched ssris a few times because of them ceasing to work affectively also ive never really stopped getting these episodes just have become more manageable recently my symptoms of depersonalization have come back and i find myself retreating back into old habits i dont have insurance or a support system like i had in my youth my meds and psych appts have been all self funded for at least 12 14 years and i need some advice on how people have dealt with depersonalization successfully specific meds therapy any insight would help right now im 38 now and i would definitely like to see a positive future i feel like if this monkey was off my back my health drive determination life experiences and success would all be on track because as of now i feel like ive only been managing thanks

how do i convince myself i m okay 20f have had severe panic attacks health focused since 17 severe hypochondria i have tried meds and therapy several times but it s so hard for me it has gotten worse over time but has periodical breaks without panic attacks i also have gerd pregnancy has made this 10x worse 20 wks 2 days how do i convince myself okay i m severely cardiophobic any high heart chest pressure pain i get even with an explanation sends me spiraling my chest feels funny right now just like a shortness of breath thing high heart rate anxious heaviness and weirdness for a bit but i also did have some spicy acidic food today my brain cannot compute this as normal or to calm down despite having had cardiac symptoms due to panic before i ve been to the hospitals and drs numerous times since 2023 with bloodwork and other tests which never came back badly or different i make myself short of breath and panic and my body can only focus on the physical feeling cardiophobia is my nightmare my body is hyperaware of every single small feeling that s not ordinary in my body all the time and it intensifies i can t seperate the two a majority of the time i just start thinking about how the doctors must have missed something and about my arteries my blood pressure my aorta everything i have seen countless countless online stories about women having issues that get dismissed by anxiety and their symptoms are dialed down to anxiety but later on find out it s something more with pregnancy it gets chalked up to just pregnancy stuff everytime i try to talk about it my health consumes my mind i have educated myself on stuff happening in my body somewhat unintentional to the point where i try to diagnose it s making me miserable i have no clue where to turn i m reluctant to starting meds especially now with pregnancy and all of my emotions and thoughts now get dulled to my hormones i feel stuck

finally healing from my panic disorder and somatic ocd : hello everyone its been 3 years now that i ve been suffering from a panic disorder and somatic ocd and i guess i really wanted to get this out and finally be able to express myself and what i went thru and hope that my post can help others suffering from this combination feel less alone and hopeful about their future and share my progress with you all as im very proud of what i have achieved for the past 6 months but i have no one to share it with i m 23 and most of my life i have always been fairly normal except for my social anxiety as a teenager which i guess started all of this unconsciously ive never thought once in my life that it would get this bad and id be dealing with this hell of a disorder 3 years ago is when everything started one day i started noticing my breathing and i couldn t stop noticing it which lead me to start breathing manually at first it was fine as i thought it would go away on its own but it never did and i found myself breathing manually for 70 of the day i couldn t sleep and i couldn t talk to people at all which made me thought i would be like this for the rest of my life i would never be able to breathe automatically again this experience lead me to develop the panic disorder everytime i was breathing manually so many about 15k times a day i would panic cause i thought this would never end and i broke myself and in the span of 6 months it became so deeply ingrained that it essentially became a pattern after 6 month the manual breathing went away as in 2022 chatgpt came along and i was finally able to get a tool where it could give me direct advice and understand it and it gave me solid advice to just not fight it and let it happen and it worked but the panic stayed as my brain made it a new baseline to panic every time i breathed like conditioning and i was experiencing a panic attack about every 10 minutes or so and everytime i breathed every day for the next 2 years it was horrible i think everyone here knows how it feels like so i don t really have to describe it but it was hell nothing worked to stop it 6 months ago i finally started seeking therapy for it and my therapist recommended me act and exposure therapy where you accept the feelings and let it happen and expose your brain to it until it becomes desensitized to it on its own and it has finally been able to break me out of this hell i fought so hard every day to expose myself to the panic to different triggers and now although i still have it i am able to function normally despite the panic attacks being here from times to times and im able to make it background noise and know that nothing will happen to me its so freeing to finally get myself back my freedom and being able to do things knowing it cant hurt me i saw a huge reduction in the frequency of when it happens from like every 10 minutes to every 4 5 hours or so and when it happens now it subsides quickly like after 30 seconds or a minute i only get peaks now and it goes away im very proud of myself from what ive accomplished and i keep looking forward to my future and finding my peace and i hope that anyone else suffering very small win this is a super baby step but i feel proud of myself and wanted to share some hope last night i woke up in a panic attack typically i ll take my meds but still end up jolting out of bed shaking pacing calling a friend and possibly needing a ride from them to the er because i believe i am dying it typically escalates but for some reason last night i stayed in bed shaking and continued to remind myself this is just really uncomfortable not dangerous i closed my eyes and took deep breaths to slow my heart rate the catastrophic thoughts did still come i thought about calling paramedics but i kept redirecting those thoughts to rational ones and eventually i wasn t nauseous or shaking anymore and i fell back asleep 13 years of panic disorder and that s the most control i ve had over it in years

adhd autism masking as panic disorder i m 30f and have had anxiety panic attacks since i was a child i have been reflecting a lot on how i ve had treatment resistant panic and anxiety for the majority of my life i ve been considering whether i have been neurodivergent this entire time and my lived experience has just been a constant battle of feeling overstimulated overwhelmed and no one really understanding why i have all of the symptoms of adhd i fidget constantly struggle with focus have extreme rejection sensitivity struggle to learn didactically and have poor working memory i do however have very fast processing speed and verbal comprehension and have intense hyperfixations so i m academic and am also risk averse so i was never the naughty kid getting bad grades at school like other children with adhd issues my parents used shame as a motivator for behaviour change and so i ve mostly just used fear and shame as my mechanism for helping me push through my school work and leveraging on hyperfixations this obviously has made my life look functional but i have explosions of panic attacks that occur every 12 months on average i think i may have just been labelled as anxious and that became a vicious cycle making my panic attacks worse because i ve been trying to treat them via a neurotypical framework only and now i just have this intense issue with shame and feeling different has anyone else got the same or a similar journey

panic attacks gone off dairy reintro brought them back hi there i just wanted to share my story since i was a toddler i had anxiety panic issues i d beg my mom to wait outside my room until i fell asleep not because of paranormal reasons just because i had genuine unknown fear and her being there wouldn t give me comfort but it would at the same time and i ve dealt with adhd symptoms on top of my panic attacks and also a weird feeling of stabbing pins and needles in my tongue which would cause me to tear up my whole life i ve had ups and downs of me freaking out when it s night time acne which worsened panic and living on a farm for a lot of my childhood adolescence didn t help with all of it essentially without getting into grave detail i started working out at 16 i m 23 now and began to get self conscious about how i looked and my main initial motivation for working out was to make myself attractive enough so that i might have a future chance with the girl who just rejected me that motivation lingered but my main goal switched to just being healthy and strong i changed my diet a lot and i d occasionally notice that my anxiety would drop to almost 0 two instances were: 1 i went meat only for a month i felt euphoric by day 28 2 i switched to plant based protein powder my confidence and clarity skyrocketed recently i fasted for a week and then ate like 1 2tbsp of goat cheese and i had a near instant tongue stabbing episode and i was terrified that my tongue was going to swell up and had like a day long panic attack too so i cut out all amounts of dairy along with gluten chicken and chicken eggs about 30 days ago and i made changes to my diet so that i get a ton of water and high electrolytes of the main three sodium potassium magnesium and i take a lot of d3 and i get roughly 111g of protein without going crazy on calories btw for the last three months i ve been completely housebound because the last three times i tried to drive i had massive panic attacks it s been insane my focus is starting to creep back my panic and forgetfulness adhd symptoms are dropping and exactly 7 days ago i tried reintroducing dairy again as an experiment to isolate variable and within 1 hour i had a panic attack that made me feel like i couldn t escape and i felt numb in the head and my nighttime freakouts came back for the next 4 5 days now that the dairy symptoms are manageable enough to feel kind of like myself i wanted to write this in case anyone noticed they would feel panic flare ups after eating sometimes that might be the issue and i used to smoke a lot of weed at 17 20 and when i was 20 i fasted for a month then ate a cheesesteak sandwich and then smoked a joint and had the worst panic attack of my life basically i m linking my panic symptoms to diet because i want to smoke weed again and have it feel good like it used to and with almost 100 certainty found the answe for my panic symptoms i m getting blood ige testing soon to confirm but the elimination re challenge results are already undeniable

this is what a panic relapse feels like right now i m in a bad panic flare right now it s another pad relapse i ve had these cycles for 20 years and i m now 42 years old lately my baseline is anxiety with daily panic attacks layered on top of it some of the attacks are manageable and minor nuisances i can ground myself while experiencing them some take over my mind and whole body so intensely that i recently called 911 i ve had years in the past when panic attack disorder lets up and gets less heavy it usually takes intense regimens of cbt to accomplish this it does work for months a few times a year this time it came back and has really stayed i ve not been able to shake it i ve had some very big life changes recently my relationship ended and we started co parenting for our 3 year old so i ve recently moved out and started rebuilding i received a promotion at work which is great and what i wanted but the reality of the position is not at all in line with what i did to get there none of this is too much for me by itself but as a whole my nervous system hasn t kept up with all the changes one thing that s been hard to admit is how complicated help becomes when i unconsciously begin relying on it my safety behaviors are turning into crutches support from loved ones and hotlines is slowly turning into total dependence my interoception is through the roof what was healthy awareness has turned into hypervigilant monitoring data from wearables has become obsession i have so many great tools designed to keep me safe and should be reassuring but they have begun to quietly convince me that my body is in danger everywhere the anticipation is so much to bear my body is always waiting for something that never quite arrives there is one sentence i try to consider and come back to throughout the day: this is discomfort not danger i m grateful though because i m fortunate that between episodes i have no depression or hopelessness i love my life and all that it has to offer it s in these attacks that i can t see straight so right now what i m holding onto is the difference between what s happening in my body and who i actually am i know this is happening to me not who i am

advice for existential panic and dread a couple years ago i developed panic disorder and it was existentialism that was the most terrifying for me i got so stuck in trying to figure out all those big terrifying questions that felt even scarier whilst in that state of panic if that is where you re at drowning in the overwhelming fear and dread then you need to take a step back there is no thinking you way through it when you re stuck in the fear from experience the best thing you can do is connect connect with anything nature or a friend express yourself move your body the spiral gets so intense when it remains so purely in your mind and it s not to say distract yourself and never think about existentialism again but you need to approach it with a calm nervous system so rather than trying to answer an unanswerable question get out of your brain and try to interact with the world till it feels less scary to approach i promise that it all feels so much less terrifying when your body can calm all my love from an internet stranger with a chaos brain

hi everyone hi everyone i just needed to spill this somewhere it s wild how you can wake up thinking you re fine thinking life is more or less steady and then out of nowhere panic hits like a sucker punch you try every coping skill therapy ever taught you but your body has its own agenda today was one of those off days i ve got a mountain of responsibilities but my whole system just wants to curl up in bed and melt into the blankets i m drained emotionally and physically and doing my best to slow the panic and ground myself before i was diagnosed i used to think something was wrong with me i carried so much guilt and shame for not being able to push through like everyone else seemed to getting diagnosed and doing the work has taken a lot of that weight off i m kinder to myself now i don t spiral into that same shame but there s still a tiny part of me that wishes i could just be normal even with that i have so much more compassion for myself than i ever used to and honestly i m grateful i stumbled into this group tonight i really needed a safe space to land thanks for being here and listening

i give up i need hope advice hello i write because this january my life got turned upside down my post history has all the details as i vented my frustrations in other posts but long story short i got months by then he suggested to start taking escitalopram lexapro again like in the past and i did the problem is that my sensitive stomach was not tolerating it anymore i would get panic attacks reflux interactions with my ppi medication my stomach would be all over the place i stopped functioning although it did improve my mood and helped me survive as long as i have i ended up taking it for shock for months my breathing seems to be doing better but it was all triggered a few days ago i did not understand why when i would get up to use the rest room i would get so anxious and on brink of a huge panic attack pulse that normally was at 74 was resting at 100 117 on my propranolol i attempted to go to work and my manager sent me home so i decided to go to the walk in to get a note to excuse my absence i am stressed about missing work and figured whatever i can do to help not panic and feel like i m letting anyone down he said my lungs sounded awful and i m dealing with athsma i was super confused i have had exercise induced asthma growing up but never heard of reactive asthma he wanted me on prednisone and that made me panic more at this point i was getting the sweats and was feeling trapped i explained to him that last time i took it it was not good for me i had a high heart rate kept getting panic attacks and almost had to go to the er due to my blood pressure being stupid high and was hot and sweaty he then said we ll your asthma is really bad sounding agitated bedside manner is not his strong suit it seems as any doc should know asthma makes people panic already and i have panic disorder on top of it anyways i told him i would be diligent on using my inhaler even if it raises my pulse so i would feel better and he said if it gets worse to go to the er my oxygen has been doing well 96 and above i ve been taking mucinex for chest congestion trying to drink a lot and added water to my cpap machine to help with moisture to help break everything up i ve had multiple showers putting breathe easy essential oil in the corners and doing controlled coughing to help move stuff out but i am still getting huge waves of panic mainly at night since everyone is better to explain it it sucks because i am a mother i have a 6 yr old i feel like i should have my ish figured out by my age but a little cold can just set me off to be fair last time i was sick was half sister what i want the headstone to look like and what to be written on it and i am assuming it is effecting me more than i realize makes sense timing wise and i have been so sensitive past few cant sleep since panic attacks hey everyone im relatively new to this situation but i wanted to share my experience and where im at now incase anyone could relate or had advice i had my first panic attack 3 months ago at work out of nowhere at work and i wasnt anxious or anything leading up to it i am someone with an anxiety disorder but it was manageable prior no medication or anything i was able to sleep after this one but had another the next day at a restaurant and then another a week later another one happened after i started buspirone and i woke up once half asleep and blew up into a panic attack that caused me to pace all night and i havent been able to sleep on my own without 25mg seroqual antipsychotic since i am on 100mg of zoloft now and the panic attacks have gone since september but still having anticipatory anxiety here and there when in public because i feel like ill have another panic attack which makes me anxious even if it doesnt happen ive tried to sleep here and there without the seroquel and genuinely cannot i cant nap in the day i either dont sleep or get very minimal sleep not sure on exact hours but i wake up a lot and very early sleeping in doesnt exist anymore and even after long days that would typically knock me out im still awake at night even with melatonin i dont know what to do at this point i dont know why i still have daytime anxiety and why i cant sleep or how to fix it i want my life back because this is keeping me from a career right now as i dont feel confident to apply for jobs as a new graduate

beta blockers for physical symptoms hi everyone quick disclosure before i start: my doctor has already reassured me about this medication but if you struggle with health anxiety you know how hard it can be to trust reassurance and try something new i deal with intense physical anxiety symptoms racing heart shaking headaches but only when i have to leave the house at home i feel totally fine my doctor prescribed me propranolol 10mg to help calm those physical symptoms here s where my anxiety gets in the way: if i m at home and not having any symptoms i m too afraid to take it because i worry it could slow my heart down too much since it s already normal but if i m about to go out and i am having symptoms i m scared to take it then too because the idea of trying a new medication while already panicking and being away from home hospital access makes me fear i ll have side effects and spiral even more i ve been reassured multiple times that 10mg is a very low dose and won t do anything dangerous to my heart but the fear still takes over so i m wondering: has anyone taken propranolol before having physical anxiety symptoms just to see how their body reacts first or is it something you should really only take when those symptoms kick in and your heart is racing any insight or personal experience would mean a lot

to start so i was taking it slow it was around 8 pm and i just gotten back home from getting a fruit bowl i sat down on the couch noticing some sharp chest pain but i didn t think much of it and figured i just needed to chill out we were gonna watch something on tv so i got up to go get my glasses from my bedroom and the chest pain got a little worse and i was feeling dizzy i could feel my heart racing for apparently no reason so i sat back down and figured i needed to just not move for a little bit but it wasn t going away i used a blood pressure monitor to check my blood pressure was elevated a little and my heart rate was 125 while trying to be as calm as possible i deemed i should go to the er because i don t have family medical history and i had a brother die at 25 i m 24f non smoker no drinking etc from a heart attack and my father just died at 66 from a heart attack but my dad was a heavy drinker and smoker so maybe that had something to do with it anyways on the way to the er the pain starts getting worse sharp stabbing left side above breast spasming and i m freaking out because i think this is it i m gonna die it s also burning like icy hot on the inside i get to kind of just posting here to see if anybody s been through anything similar and has any sort of comforting words to advise me or if there s a better option i m guessing if the pain comes back i ll it feels like i m in hell i don t like to write on reddit but i feel like i can gain some good insight here i 21f am autistic and was diagnosed with this and anxiety at a young age i also have emetophobia i ve managed pretty well without physical symptoms when i get overstimulated or panicky i feel i need to outline my timeline in order to get some perspective on my issues and if anyone can relate when i turned 21 last month i tried an edible for the first time the weekend after i greened out terribly because i ate too much while on it causing terrible nausea but i couldn t throw up because i have a fear of it i phased out of the effects after a couple of hours but it was a terrible experience for me for the past month after i would have a similar headache on the weekend trouble swallowing and nausea which would start while i was eating food every weekend like clockwork this happened and i would take tylenol and pray i also had shaking burping inability to swallow and i would empty all of my bowels and my mouth would just dry up for reference i call these episodes last week i had an episode on tuesday and i stretched my neck out realizing that it was super tense and that it had been stiff for a very long time so i got into the habit of stretching my neck the problem is i had an episode on saturday where it felt like my neck was being weighed and tense and i had the usual trouble swallowing and breathing while eating of course but i hadn t made this connection yet face numbness neck spasms disoriented trouble speaking ear pressure and for the first time i noticed my anxiety the pain wouldn t go away with the tylenol which i also realized that day these episodes would last around 2 3 hours then yesterday i had an appointment with the clinic the doctor diagnosed me with anxiety and said my physical symptoms are interconnected with it she told me to journal my usual feelings when i have an attack in order to figure out what my trigger is so i sit down and journal and i realize that the common trigger is food so i think it s over and done with no more panic attacks wrong i got one while making dinner but i thought i breathed though it enough to eat my food and the symptoms completely went awaythen i m laying down for bed a couple hours later mucus gets stuck in my throat and it triggers a really bad panic attack that makes me feel like i m dying and my brain is shutting down i have tea watch tv sleep with my neck on a heating pad which helps i woke up for work this morning felt amazing this was 4 am i progressively get another panic attack and i m completely alone here the only thing that works is sleeping the problem is i can t sleep during these episodes but i always get super tired after the episode subsides and i take a nap after work i feel really good after my nap then i go to a public dining hall and when i look at the food and take in the atmosphere i feel my stomach muscles contract and i start to panic and i feel the same symptoms as before i get over them within 30 minutes i am currently recovering from a panic attack right now it started 3 hours ago with me doing dishes and getting hot flashes then i sit down to eat and all hell breaks loose my mouth is so dry right now my neck would jolt to where i d temporarily stop breathing and it felt like death i felt so tired i am so very tired but my body is still in panic i thought figuring out my trigger would help but i m in a constant state of panic i was referred for counseling and anxiety meds and i try to affirm that it s all in my head do the breathing techniques and coping skills but nothing works i just want to know if i m alone here any response helps thank you update i was diagnosed with tmd and my anxiety amplifies my symptoms i m doing a meds consult today

anxiety and medication i ve been doing some research and i think i have an idea of how to recover from this anxiety is supposedly the fight or flight response of our nervous system and the only way to overcome it is to expose yourself to and accept the symptoms okay i understand that but right now i feel exhausted and i was advised to start medication the problem is that i want to heal from the root cause not just get rid of the symptoms is there any way to take medication just to stabilize myself and continue with exposure therapy basically using medication but experiencing the symptoms as a 5 10 instead of a 10 10

do your panic attacks feel this bad i used to have really physical panic attacks my heart rate would shoot over 190 bpm verified and i also have svt sometimes but this was sinus tach i take 120mg propranolol a day now plus 1mg klonopin and the meds have honestly changed my life i m stable i work two jobs i m a wife and mom i travel i function like a normal person usually but because the meds block the physical symptoms my panic attacks feel totally different now i don t get the racing heart or shaking anymore which is great but now they come on as this weird sudden wave of dread that s honestly harder to identify in the moment it feels like: this random something is very wrong feeling like i want to crawl out of my skin the world feels surreal dark or unsafe i get this intense discomfort where i wish i could just sleep it off or disappear for a minute like i m about to die but without the obvious physical signs strong urge to reach out to others for help texting or calling friends family i had one yesterday lasted about 30 minutes and then i literally just went on with my day and even went to work afterward so clearly they do end but in the moment it feels impossible to believe that how do you convince yourself it s just a panic attack when the symptoms are more mental than physical now what do your panic attacks feel like i tried being curious this time and imagined i was a human being studied by doctors or aliens lol trying to understand emotions weirdly it helped the most helpful thing was just realizing it did pass eventually i d rather experience pretty much anything else because the worst part is that you don t know you re going to be okay i have a high tolerance for uncomfortable experiences but these get me everytime

six months since my last panic attack i realized today that it has been six months since my last panic attack so i wanted to celebrate and offer encouragement to anyone who feels like the panic cycle will never rest i had my first panic attack at 32 m and for the better part of the next year fought off relentless anxiety and panic attacks to say it was one of the hardest seasons of my life would be an understatement between therapy loved ones support books podcasts and online resources i became of student of my panic and anxiety i learned a lot about what triggers me what coping mechanisms work well for me and forced myself to let panic and anxiety co exist with me as you all know co existing is the hardest part when everything in your mind and body tells you you re in danger i know i m not cured and i don t have a magic cure for others either i suspect i ll have panic attacks in the future and i still have moments and stretches of days where anxiety is humming in the background too my panic and anxiety often prompt shame spiraling and my inner critic is loud so i m taking a moment to choose gratitude and celebrate how far i ve come instead

new and sudden anxiety possibly a bit vent ish but i m mostly hoping people can relate and share advice if they have any background: almost 3 weeks ago i had a really bad panic attack and went to the er i think being on effexor for a few days then stopping bc it wasnt right for me could have contributed plus i had at least 300 400mg of caffeine that day usually doesnt bother me but still i ve only had 2 other ones in my life and it was just me being light headed and fainting for a few seconds so this was pretty horrifying i felt like i couldnt breathe and my heart chest and stomach was painfully tight and i was tingly and having tremors everywhere and my fingers were all bent and stiff they gave me hydroxyzine which helped then i continued to take it for a few days but stopped because it made my heart and anxiety feel worse since then i ve been constantly on edge and still have increased heart rate and chest pain discomfort just the other day i had half a monster and it got worse i dont drink caffeine all the time but when i do i can handle much more than that now i m too scared to have like a starbucks i ve been unable to enjoy life cuz of depression and now i m unable to enjoy life cuz of anxiety this feels so sudden i don t want to be stuck with it or have to treat a whole other problem i m hoping its just medication effects so i can get back to focusing on depression is this the start of a lifetime of anxiety

panic disorder and non stimulating adhd medication tldr if you dont wanna read allat i have panic disorder that is mostly dealt with realized i have what is likely executive functioning issue interested in trying non stimulating adhd meds have a pyschiatrist appointment today but looking for personal experiences or thoughts for people with panic disorder who have tried atomoxetine strattera guanfacine intuniv or bupropion wellbutrin im especially interested here because it seems to address my issues the most but also is mildly stimulating wondering how much it will effect panic please read the rest of the post for background and specific symptoms hi guys i have a psychiatrist appointment today and im not looking for medical advice but wondering if yall have any personal experience with the issues or medication im talking about here so i can get an idea of what peoples experiences where i don t post here much except some comments because ive been mostly treated for pd quick background around 4 years ago i started having panic attacks largely because i was smoking weed alot and the stimulation and heartrate increase was making me freak out etc even after i stopped i had severe anxiety about my heart and thought i was dying all the time typical panic attack stuff psychiatrist prescribed 75 mg zoloft about 3 4 months later i felt mostly better couple years after that i thought i could be without zoloft because i didnt have panic attacks anymore and i thought it was giving me brain fog and dissociation etc 3 months later panic attacks again metal clarity and brain fog never fixed went back on 25mg zoloft feel fine now i guess i only need a smaller dose now after all the healing and therapy and stuff i ve done everything with panic disorder at this point is pretty much fine besides extra anxiety during certain events like plane flights of which i have benzos prescribed all of that was background real questions start here so for pretty much my whole life i ve always performed bad in school bad grades never motivated to study procrastination etc as a kid i remember taking some sort of adhd test and being negative my parents said that the explanation we got from the psychiatrist was that i didn t technically have adhd but i had anxiety and ocd that kind of presented like adhd my parents always wanted me to get on some sort of adhd medication but i always pushed back because i guess i thought it was like special help and i wanted to be able to perform without it like other kids could fast forward to college still having all of those issues but after the whole panic attack thing i had lots of really bad dissociation depersonalization derealization etc over time it became less of dissociative episodes and not feeling real and more of just like a persistent fog where i never really feel present or cognitive like i used to before panic over the past couple weeks i ve realized that i ve probably been in denial about my productivity focus issues i ve been doing bad enough in college and taking longer to graduate than i should and i cant keep doing that i always just thought i was lazy or bad at getting stuff done but after talking with a really close friend who does have diagnosed adhd and has been helped hugely by medication i started realizing the things i ve dealt with aren t really normal: 1 : motivation and making the right decisions there are tons of times when i know i should be doing homework studying etc and i want to and plan to but like i just can t like i literally can t make myself similarly every new semester i always tell myself im gonna fix this and that or do things differently but when it comes to actually making those changes i just don t and its not because i dont want to its like theres a disconnect between me wanting and planning to and actually doing it 2 : focus i do have diagnosed ocd and this is probably huge here i feel like i can t stay focused on one thing or when i can focus on 1 thing its not what i should be working n i either get distracted by compulsions or by short term goals or by thing that are easier or more fun getting distracted or wanting to do easier or more fun things as opposed to hard work can be something that anyone deals with but for me it feels unrelated to how disciplined i am or how hard i try or care and just how it is 3 : brain fog and mental clarity all the time i feel some sort of dissociation or brain fog it almost feels like my mind is out of focus like a camera or eyes would be but like not optically just how my mind feels i feel like i m in a fog all the time i have a super visual mind and can imagine objects in scenarios well but when i try to visually organize all the things i need to do and work it just all fogs together in a mess i feel like im not present or clear at all in my mind and it sucks now i always thought that with panic disorder i couldnt take adhd medications because the stimulation would just make me freak out right away which is probably true with normal stimulants but i recently decided to look into non simulating versions from my understanding the options are: 1 atomoxetine strattera : non stimulating helps with motivation and focus norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor improves executive functioning signal 2 guanfacine intuniv : alpha 2 agonist originally a blood pressure medication now fda approved for adhd helps your brain differentiate between the main goal and distractions reduces noisy neural firing filters out distractions has a calming effect due to lower blood pressure so is almost the opposite of stimulating 3 bupropion wellbutrin : this is actually something my psychiatrist recommended a year or two ago when i was dealing with binge eating issues my understanding is that it also increases the executive functioning signal directly improves motivation and energy i ve even heard it can feel like that brain fog is lifting off of you also understand that it helps initiate tasks and improve impulse control this sounds amazing for my issues but i also understand that it s mildly stimulating which scared me cus i dont want to trigger panic i suppose i could take a xanax ive been prescribed as needed if it starts to make me panic but still scares me this is the one im most curious from yall about anyways im just wondering for yall that either have adhd or functioning issues along with panic disorder how did you deal with it did u take any of these medication or others how did it effect panic

28f experiencing daily panic attacks trigger warning for sa hi everyone not sure if i m looking for advice or venting or what i am currently trying to go back to work after having five years off for medical reasons this new job i have is amazing it s what i ve studied for the team are lovely and i do genuinely enjoy the job however after my first week which went so well with no anxiety i had to take some time off for a family funeral during this family funeral i was forced to interact with a family member who attacked and assaulted me as a child and raped me as a teenager it has been ten years since i ve had to see him and in those ten years i ve done a lot of work on myself to get to the point i am now i was no longer having panic attacks nightmares or intimacy issues this has all been changed since the funeral i am now experiencing daily panic attacks mostly surrounding leaving my house and going to my new job i ve managed to speak to my manager and she is being incredibly understanding about everything but i am still so new and i m worried this will have lasting impact on my employment there i m feeling so out of control of my emotions right now which in itself feeds my anxiety all my usually strategies aren t working and my support system is worried i have made a drs appt to seek professional help but i m just a bit lost in this moment i think

tms for panic depression hello my psychiatrist had just approved me today for a referral to get transcranial magnetic stimulation or tms for short has anyone else tried tms for panic or depression i guess for a tiny amount of context i ve gone through many ssri s and my psychiatrist is not all that confident that an snri will work for me due to the severe reactions i ve had to medication my gene site test shows that most of the medication s are in the red section for me so it means i m more at risk for adverse reactions to almost everything they said they ve never seen a genesite test like mine before but it makes sense because i ve had awful reactions to everything so far i ve heard and seen overwhelmingly positive results around this procedure tms but i m still scared because back in the day my great grandmother had electro shock therapy for postpartum depression and it changed her personality for the worse and then it made her life really hard because no one wanted to be around her it makes me sad for her now i know tms is an entirely different procedure than electro shock therapy and it s so much more less invasive but i m still scared sincerely a permanently nervous guy

panic attacks evolved into sadness attacks anyone else hi there thanks for this sub i ve been lurking for a while but haven t participated out of fear that discussing my pa would trigger them thanks everyone for your discourse it s helped me feel less alone onto my question: after a decade of panic attacks i finally sought cbt for it after a year with my therapist they ve evolved into sadness attacks anyone else have this they used to always have a panic attack or multiple and then a deep sorrow that would usually break me down and i d have to find somewhere to cry pull over while driving etc now the panic attacks have become milder but the sadness starts instantly tw: my panic attacks manifest from a deep fear of dying i ve gone through bouts of xenophobia but have come out from it previously also with help of a therapist i didn t seek help specifically for the panic attacks until last year and i didn t realize how bad they were for me until my therapist had me log them and i d have upwards of 19 per week and as few as 7 we discovered the patterns around when where and how they happen and i started to avoid situations at first then confront them and mitigate and now i no longer have to use mitigation techniques and in an instant i m devastated to tears still about anything death related age time space history ancestry heritage existentialism existential history etc sorry to ramble i m scared about what they ll evolve to next like what is their final pokemon form and will i be able to not cry all the time

crippling panic attacks hello a little back story before we get into the main event i ve got a panic disorder ocd and depression a lovely cocktail i know i ve been on sertraline for over a year and have really benefited from it also had cbt not life changing but extremely thankful for the opportunity recently i ve moved to london from a small village to go to uni i love this city i ve wanted to live here all my life and the first 2 months i thrived however midway through october i started getting sick one of my huge triggers is throwing up health anxiety convinces me i m dying every time i didn t think much of it and put it down to being in a huge city and all sorts of germs were around over the last week i ve been having crippling panic attacks in one instance an ambulance was called for me because i blacked out and was inconsolable for about 2 hours now they are just coming out of the blue and are very very strong lasting for hours it feels like i m going to die like my head goes fuzzy my hands legs and face all go numb i hyperventilate feel sick the list goes on any physical symptom you can think of i ve probably felt it over the last few weeks yesterday was at its worst i had a 3 hour long panic attack which resulted in me having to get off the tube and then i fainted on the platform after having a full blown panic attack i was determined to finish my journey to get to my boyfriends house i relaxed a bit and was watching a film convinced it was over and then it happened again out of nowhere convinced i was going to die and i was having a stroke or i was going to have a seizure this lasted about 30 minutes i slept until 4am and then i woke up and it happened all over again until 6am i am exhausted drained really really afraid i got prescribed propranolol today and just took my first pill about 20 minutes ago im really hoping for the best i ve tried deep breaths going on walks meditation running my hands under cold water and nothing is helping any help would be greatly appreciated
