worried about never being ok again i ve had social anxiety for a very long time it started when i was a teenager about 15 i think but was relatively mild at the start but it increase greatly in severity after 17 then around 22 my psychologist and i managed to improve it significantly through exposure therapy but then after the pandemic both due to the pandemic itself and other personal reasons it got worse again it s still not as bad as it was before 22 but it s worse than it was before the pandemic regardless throughout all these years of ups and downs i haven t actually been able to shake it it s complicated though i still have anxiety when using the phone but a little bit less although it s mostly that i learned to deal with it better and still call and then when talking to people in general and just going about my anxiety was definitely decreased significantly after exposure it has gotten a bit worse again but again it hasn t returned to what it was at its height the anxiety did remain but at a manageable level especially before the pandemic but i also learned to handle it better and then in some situations the anxiety seems incredibly stubborn when i was in college group work was always extremely extremely difficult for me because being in a large group where i am expected to talk with many people i don t know well at once is basically the worst situation for my anxiety and regardless of how many times i ve done something like that it hasn t really improved my handling of it has improved a little bit in that i can just about barely do it when i really need to but it drains me completely afterwards and it is extremely exhausting so i can t do it on a regular basis i also know this person who plays dnd a lot with people and it s actually something i ve wanted to do for a long time and he s even invited me before but the thing is that i just can t do it if i really really needed to could i do it probably but it wouldn t be any fun because it would be extremely exhausting and i would feel severely anxious the entire time so i don t do it and then today i was talking to someone on a dating app and chatting online tends to be one of the easiest social interactions for me especially through text but dating apps increase the stakes so i still tend to experience social anxiety during it not as much as irl of course not even close but still enough to make things unpleasant like i m obviously thankful for any match i get but i also really have to wrestle through sending those messages and it s at moments like that that i wonder about my recovery because talking to people through dms online is something i ve been doing for a very very long time so exposure wise i am essentially working on it constantly but it feels like my anxiety isn t decreasing no matter how long i do it for and i really want it to it would make dating easier at the very least so at the end of the day i m left with a very complicated picture my phone anxiety reduced a little my handling of it got a lot better my in person anxiety in one on one conversations and being out and about decrease quite a lot and i got better at handling it but my anxiety in groups is still as high as ever despite exposure and i ve only barely gotten better at handling it and then in something like chats on a dating site the anxiety has barely moved despite significant exposure idk it s confusing and i worry about it i ve improved yes but social interactions to one degree or another continue to be a fight sometimes a huge fight i just want it to be like it was before 15 where i didn t feel any anxiety almost all of my life was so much easier that way

of mine are introvert low self esteem the quiet guy not being able to say no zero assertivity highly sensitive person i never was a social guy in my entire life and interactions with people drain me mentally add confirmed i don t know what s happened to me i ve started getting extreme panic attacks when meeting people or being in a group it started with meeting old friends i hadn t seen in years expecting to talk about my life and history it lead to me freezing up then it got way worse over the past years were i m actually starting to feel lightheaded and on the verge of fainting one time i almost fainted while talking to a girl i went to high school with and met at the library i also start forced smiling i can t even not smile it s like my face cramps up into this creepy smile and can t asap

even really like to sing by myself if i catch myself doing it i grow embarrassed i would love to do these things but i just can t i get emotional because i genuinely feel stuck like i can t move my does anyone else get anxious over the smallest interactions i feel ridiculous sometimes i don t know if this is relatable or just me being me today i went to a coffee shop and the barista asked hey how s your day going a completely normal question and my brain just froze i could feel my chest tighten my face get warm and all i managed to say was: good thank you even though my day wasn t good at all then i walked out feeling stupid for making it awkward even though nothing actually happened it s always the tiny interactions that hit me the hardest: asking a question saying excuse me ordering food speaking up when i need help or even just greeting someone i hate how my brain turns normal moments into a full body threat i m trying to get better some days i do okay other days it feels like i m broken in some weird way does anyone else feel this how do you deal with these tiny everyday panic moments just curious to know i m not the only one

exposure therapy is the cure exposure therapy for social anxiety works well and for almost every patient the reason it didn t work for you is you might not doing it correct because its little complicated than what we hear all the time say hi to a stranger take a walk in crowded space etc if you do these challenges while keeping your eyes on your phone rehearsing every sentence or distracting your self from the situation than exposure is not gonna work also if you are trying to control the situation so nothing bad is gonna happen it will not work just like anything in life it never works until you do it correctly the way exposure works is it is just like facing a phobia an example from my life would be me facing my fear of making eye contact in public with exposure here is what i did: before exposure: situation: walking in public while not avoiding eye contact and without distracting myself what i think is gonna happen: people is gonna laugh at me people will look at me thinking am weird strange and something like that people will come at me and say i don t think you should be here and stzrt bullying me etc how likely do you think this is what gonna happen: 75 percent what we want with exposure is to tolerate the risk either whats on my mind doesn t happen or it happens and i realize i can tolerate the discomfort i can handle more than i thought like being bullied or being seen as a total idiot hope this was little helpful let me know guys if want me to make a series of posts explaining this in detail based on my personal experience and the people i ve helped thank s

getting out of my shell in a festive way mixed feelings i m a 21 year old dude in uni making friends has always been nerve wracking for me but every major holiday for a few years i ve found a way to force myself to start conversations with new people this year i made christmas bags for almost everyone in my dorm there was some hot chocolate candy canes other miscellaneous treats i was able to hand them all out tonight and it was really fun the good parts: one guy gave me a hug and said he was grateful another group invited me into their dorm and we played videogames and talked about naruto for a while another guy exchanged numbers with me and we re gonna go play pickleball when it gets warmer it was nice to see everybody so happy i feel like i was able to make some real connections i enjoyed putting all the bags together meeting some really cool dogs and seeing everyone s christmas decorations the not as good parts: some people seemed really creeped out by me i don t know i guess it s sorta intimidating to have a guy knock on your apartment door after 6pm but i didn t really have any other times to get it done i was pretty jealous of how well other roommates seemed to get along and how well their apartments were decorated my new roommates are much better than my old ones but they haven t been very receptive to hanging out overall i m glad i did it i ve been working so hard this semester to get out of my shell it s a new city i don t have any friends here yet and i think 4 months of effort have finally started to pay off hopefully i can get a group of friends together soon i d love to have a group study sesh or make gingerbread houses that s kinda my dream it s still really hard i work full time and it s finals week hard not to get discouraged despite my successes but i m glad i wrote it down here it helps me be grateful

another presentation another flop i ve had to do multiple presentations throughout college i m a senior now and yet i panic and blank out every time once i get up there or when it s my turn to speak if i m working with others i end up reading as a crutch spluttering and it looks like i put in zero effort not to mention i sometimes make mistakes that other people don t make and look like a fool i think it s all really hitting me now that i m so sick and tired of feeling embarrassed the relief i usually feel after having gotten it over with is not as strong now i mostly just feel disappointed and upset in myself i cringe at the memories after every public speaking experience i wish i could just pluck it out of my mind so i don t have to remember the details propranolol did wonders for my physical symptoms but the mental ones are still incredibly overwhelming i struggle to have confidence

do you also feel that your pain is invisible feeling down tonight i ve come a long way from the worst of my social anxiety that happened in my teens now i have a degree and a job where i regularly have to talk to people things that were unthinkable a few years ago despite that i think i will never get over the lack of social interaction during vital formative years i carry a huge hollowness inside of me social anxiety is something that my life revolves around it heavily defined who i am as a person and yet i feel like there s still stigma that keeps me from talking about it to people you can t talk about it in casual conversation because you ll both ruin the mood and look like a loser can t easily talk about it to a potential friend or date because what if they decide it s a red flag or look down on you no one in my family acknowledges it either when i touch the subject with my parents they feel guilty and i feel bad it s like wherever i go there s this huge elephant in the room that we re all looking at and willfully ignoring interact with any normal person and they ll usually have tales and experiences to share about their teens and 20s and i have to be reminded of the huge decade long blank in the timeline of my life but not talk about it because it would ruin the vibe i feel pressure to act like i m normal when i m anything but this disorder is my skin and bones i was formed by it and when i can t be open about it i feel like i m in hiding like people don t actually know me it s just so lonely do you guys also feel that way how do you deal with it

i ve finally started to feel like me again i consider myself a somewhat social person but i don t really hang out with people as much as i used to i got out of an extremely toxic relationship just shy of two years ago and it affected me a lot more than i let on he was controlling manipulative and shattered my self confidence it got to the point where i just stopped doing anything because whatever i did he would get mad at and whatever i didn t do he would get mad about that i lost good friends because of him i managed to recover and reconcile some of those relationships but i was never able to cross the hurdle of meeting people in person again i was suddenly consumed by this fear that something terrible would happen to me that they d somehow someway hurt me too naturally i went to therapy to help myself get out of this box i stuffed myself in i won t say i m 100 good but lately i ve had a couple of victories after class i ll hang out with a friend at the library or get something to eat with them between classes i also made it a point to keep in touch with people even if they live far away so if the moment were to ever arise then we could meet up i also joined a discord gaming server where everyone is pretty chill i ve made a ton of great friends there who welcomed me immediately and talk to every day we play games together have conversations about literally anything and sometimes do movie nights i m so happy to say that i m starting to feel like my old self again i feel so loved where i am and that i don t feel as afraid anymore to just walk up to someone and make conversation some family members have gotten on me about not being very social and that it makes me weird but i m comfortable with the slow progress i m making

anyone else here pretty socially perceptive i was thinking about something today i was watching these videos of psychopaths diagnosed psychopaths talking and then i read the comment section and a lot of people really bought into it and i do get why one person in particular talked in a very jovial tone almost jokey a lot of the time he comes across as likeable of course if you know your psychology you know that psychopaths in reality are rarely the cold husks that tv likes to show rather a core part of the diagnosis is superficial charm and glibness so his tone was one thing but everything else was manipulative he would constantly subtly reframe the topic like when asked about trust he would reframe it first as being about reliability which allowed him to talk about himself positively he would always do that too start off very positive then sprinkle in some negatives while at the same time downplaying them talking about things as i never intended harm and it was just ribbing or i m just a thrill seeker or saying things like others say this to make it seem subjective or subtly shifting the blame he also constantly avoided discussing any details about his behaviour always speaking in vagueries like me and my brother went thrill seeking and often omitting key details i noticed all of this very easily and yet based on the comment section this guy had a lot of people convinced he really was a decent guy i also remember this time when in high school there was this new girl in class i don t remember exactly what i noticed but i remember noticing the first day she was there that she seemed untrustworthy i think part of it is that i felt an underlying coldness in her regardless of what she was actually saying my then best friend decided to date her and found out unfortunately that she was not a great person i still regret not telling him about my suspicions but i felt they were based on so little and i didn t want to sabotage what might ve been a good thing or another friend of mine he met a girl and within idk 10 minutes of talking to her i immediately noticed a bunch of red flags but again i didn t want to get in between and sabotage something potentially good and once again things turned out similarly and there have been a bunch of times where when i feel my anxiety spike in certain high stakes social situations i often don t trust myself and in the past i have often contacted my psychologist to ask her advice on what i should do but what i noticed is that a lot of the time i am better at predicting the person s reaction than she is obviously i m closer to the situation so that definitely helps but the point is i tend not to trust my own judgement when it comes to social situations like at all but objectively speaking i seem to be pretty good at it i can t shake the uncertainty though i never trust what i think or say or think of doing i m always scared it ll be wrong

i ve heard a lot about party chaos and i ve come along way : i m just copy and pasting a comment i shared on a post i m going into this season with 18 months sobriety but still in the trench moved to different suburb distancing from my parents blah blah so i m in turtle mode big time but i have been so i m not dealing with invites thank heaven anyway simply reflecting on this helped me so i m dropping it off it was regarding someone fearful they would lose real friends if they didn t go to a certain party firstly at 40 that sounds simply bonkers than i thought well why i must have felt that before yeah for sure i did so what has changed for me i stopped forcing myself to get through and i did this: here s the thing a human can be as is without any anxiety issues and still not like parties maybe you could try this on with time i ve started just putting my identity upfront getting to know me means you won t hear from me ghosted style at times i hate parties because everyone talks at once more often than not and the mechanics of that situation just doesn t fulfill my use of time i drain energy without gaining genuine connection in that setting so it s a disservice to others as well i ll be forgetful of what we talk about and that s not the kind of friend i want to be i put forward simply how i participate in the world regardless of my alphabet soup i happen to be autistic and alcoholic whatever i m just a human and in terms of processing and participating i simply pay attention to what brings success so i can keep up my end of the bargain and be a good friend etc thanks for connecting everyone it s so nice to still have belonging and kinship when the mechanics are just mental in my life right now

confidence shattered after job loss 5 months unemployment how do i fix my interview anxiety hey everyone i really need some guidance because i feel stuck in a loop i can t break out of earlier i used to be extremely confident in interviews i could talk smoothly think clearly and perform well under pressure i was so relaxed about results that even if i didn t get shortlisted it didn t bother me and ironically that chill attitude helped me perform even better but things changed i was asked to resign from my previous company and then i stayed unemployed for 5 months that break hit my confidence hard even though i later cracked a good off campus job as an ase in an mnc coming from a tier 3 college where even toppers struggled i still feel like something inside me didn t fully recover now i m desperate for a job again and that desperation has made my anxiety worse when a telephonic round starts i freeze my breathing gets heavy i overthink every sentence and i blank out it s not even fear of failure it s the pressure of i need this job earlier when i didn t care about the result i performed at my best now the more i care the worse i perform honestly i couldn t even put all of this into words properly chatgpt helped me structure my thoughts so i could express what i m actually feeling has anyone gone through something similar how did you rebuild confidence after a long break and a forced resignation what helped you deal with interview anxiety especially when you re desperate for a job any advice techniques or routines would mean a lot thanks for reading

how to reject going to a work lunch the company i work for is winding down for the year and our boss offered to take the office out for a fancy lunch at a 5 star restaurant i told them i wouldn t be able to go because of my dietary restrictions and the restaurant doesn t accommodate i m honestly relieved because i was dreading going to this lunch now the problem: my supervisor feels bad that i m staying behind while everyone else goes out and leaves early he said he ll take me out next week to make up for it but i really don t want to go i m extremely socially awkward and the idea of a one on one lunch is even worse than the group lunch my supervisor and i only discuss work and nothing more we don t have that casual rapport i don t want to sit through a meal trying to make conversation while feeling anxious and i don t want him feeling pressured to fill the silence either i feel more comfortable not talking but i know most people get uncomfortable with that i want to politely decline without offending him or making him think i m ungrateful i d rather spare us both the awkward lunch any advice edit: i tried declining but he insists saying it would be unfair i asked for the day off but was denied

group settings are impossible for me to open up in hi 29m here and i struggle a lot with opening up in group settings this has been a recurring theme in my life and i m at a loss with what to do with this issue as it s to the point of being debilitating it s a fairly similar script every time i go to an event or gathering with others i show up at my most confident ready to socialize and it takes about one awkward interaction or one conversational topic that i don t feel capable of contributing in to completely deflate my confidence these small things can trigger me to retreat almost entirely into my shell to the point of being non verbal i suppose this post is me venting and opening up in hopes others have similar experiences or some kind of advice to offer this particular dynamic is sooo confronting and hard to even know where to begin thanks for reading and much love to others who can relate and also those who cannot

my teacher gave the worst lecture and it s increased my rumination and anxiety my teacher for ict is usually average in her lectures she s good at explaining concepts but today she wasn t she basically talked about social media and it s harmful effects ie cyber bullying then talked about girls doing inappropriate stuff on social media i don t remember her exact words bc my brain has blocked it out but trust me if you heard it you would ve had a full on anxiety attack mind you the class is full of boys i m the only girl they started laughing she said other stuff that was so anxiety inducing i understand she s a teacher and has to talk about certain topics but she presented it in a way that didn t read the room and idk now i m ruminating about it constantly and it s debilitating

social anxiety coming back after stopping medication i have had pretty severe social anxiety disorder my whole life last year i was prescribed lexapro which basically eliminated all my anxiety it was incredible however my memory became terrible i had very bad brain fog all the time and i had no more motivation or ambition so i decided to stop taking 3 months ago as it was affecting my performance in college i was fine at first and the brain fog cleared up a little bit but recently my anxiety has been flaring up a lot now i become physically very panicked around certain people i now have to hype myself up to do something very simple like walking into a classroom when i didn t even need to think about it before once my wellbutrin runs out i take it twice a day my body just enters flight mode and then my mind follows it even if i m completely alone i ruminate over past events constantly to the point where studying is nearly impossible at times so i m in a bit of a dilemma i can t go back to the lexapro as it destroyed my memory and ability to focus be present which i still am recovering from i m also a pilot and i m not legally allowed to fly while taking two antidepressants at once i really don t know what to do i haven t felt this way in nearly a year so i feel like these symptoms are hitting me much harder than before i don t know how to function without anxiety medication advice

does it ever go away i have pushed myself out of my comfort zone so many times that pretty much everyone who has met me thinks i m not afraid of anything people think i m confident because i can dance at clubs alone attend large concerts alone eat at restaurants alone etc little do they know that the reason i can overcome anxiety to do those big things is because i get anxiety about everything for me the anxiety i get from getting gas is equivalent to going to a concert alone i get anxious going to the grocery store walking down the sidewalk etc pretty much anything outside my bedroom is outside my comfort zone people have told me for years that continuing to get outside my comfort zone will help me but so far that has not worked i get more comfortable in certain situations insofar as i get familiar with the specific location and my route there but if it s say going through a drive thru line in a new city then it s back to square one i want to be confident doing things in places i haven t been to not just be confident in my bubble even better would be to do new things in places i haven t been to and embarrassing myself and realizing it s not that bad to embarrass yourself has not helped either i have some seriously embarrassing moments especially from when i was younger ive crashed an e bike into a pole going 30 mph in front of 50 people i went to a high school party with people i barely knew and really admired drank too much and had a meltdown so bad they called cps can t make that shit up i once accidentally texted my crush who did not like me back a screenshot from my diary talking about their best qualities which i d meant to send to my friend a guy once stole my phone opened my gallery found a video of me dancing in my underwear and showed his friends once while walking down the sidewalk amongst a bunch of guys i stepped over a vent and my dress flew straight up into my face i also have the socially awkward experiences which sucked like eating alone in the cafeteria i am grateful i ll never have to return to that again but none of that has really helped me it all still feels exactly the same the one thing that does help is if i m looking my best have my hair done wearing nice clothes groomed etc but i don t want to feel like i can only go outside and do things if i ve spent half an hour beautifying myself i don t care that i can do things that i have the ability to physically go outside it would be nice if it felt good as well does it ever go away

belonging is so difficult i cant sleep i feel like i never fit it i can t hold a conversation for the life of me which is weird cus i work a social job im in childcare when i meet people i feel like they never stick since i m an adult now people i meet already have friend groups and social circles when i enter it feels wrong i start to feel unwanted uncomfortable and just start to feel like i don t belong i have many acquaintances but it s just that acquaintances i m just a nice person who smiles and waves to them i guess idk maybe they hate me i ve been through so much therapy but cannot erase the thoughts of nobody wants me here and nobody likes me i have so many hobbies and interests but it feels like a double ended sword yes i can use that to connect with people but i m not a master at any one thing so the conversation can only go so far socializing feels so bad it s almost like i automatically want to reject all social interactions and sometimes i come off weird or odd or mean or rude or whatever i feel like i can never do it right and that is why people do not want to be around me i talk too much i talk too little i can be a little mean i can be really nice i m easy to misinterpret i don t even know how i feel about a lot of things i can t make friends at work i don t know what parts of me are the real me or a me that i use to get by socially i want to feel like i belong but the idea of belonging is so distant i feel like i fuck up every chance i get that it just isn t for me i want to belong i want to feel like people want me around not just a person you can have small talk with not a person who just smiles and waves not just a nice person i want people to know me and want me around

ghosting silence i am writing to share an observation about business networking that has been causing me some concern and anxiety as a business owner i have been in business and sales for 20 years over the past two years i have noticed a marked shift in professional communication and engagement especially regarding networking individuals including those i have done business with for years are suddenly becoming extremely difficult to reach often disappearing or not responding to communications it appears that many people particularly employees within larger corporations are doing the bare minimum and are reluctant to develop or expand relationships getting any response from established contacts now feels like fighting tooth and nail which is a new and consistent pattern i ve noticed with dozens of people not just an odd few this trend is creating significant anxiety for me as a business owner i would appreciate any insight or advice you might have on how to overcome this challenge and adapt my networking strategies to the current environment i feel like it stifling growth and positivity it s almost like an attitude of i don t give a f anymore i ve had some friends over the last few years act in a similar way so if a common trend across different parts of life thank you for your time and perspective best

how to move forward i was unemployed for 4 years i finally got a job this year and have been doing extremely well i recently had a convo with one of my coworkers and they asked what i did before this and i started panicking and lied and said i was self employed when in reality i wasn t doing anything with my life before this my life was still being funded by my parents at an age where people should be financially independent and i was just rotting away in my room i know i should be grateful to have a job and be doing really well but i can t help but feel ashamed of my past it prevents me from getting too close with coworkers and people in general and i spiral at the thought of having to explain to my partner one day about the darkest period of my life i hate lying but i also don t want people to judge me if i tell the truth has anyone been in a similar position how can i navigate those conversations in the future without completely fabricating a story i had jobs before this should i just say that that was what i was doing and pretend the 4 year gap doesn t exist

challenged myself and it just felt like a cruel reminder went to a social gathering today polyglot kind of event should have stayed only for the first 10 minutes or so before the usual nasty self image and awareness came to ruin it in the end the experience just felt like a harsh reminder of why i have no friend why i took refuge in a boring computer job instead of playing music why i don t travel etc those social anxiety issues haven t improved a millimeter and i m now in my mid 30s i just want to quit my job buy some cheap rural land and live in a trailer with some pets and no human contact give up basically there is no evidence that improvement is possible in severe cases like me

new hire at my work inadvertently helped me with my social anxiety so today at work there was a new hire who was working next to me and she would often ask me questions because she needed help figuring out some work related stuff i realize me being in a position of teaching someone else gave me confidence i didn t know i had and the more she approached me to ask a new question the more i became less socially anxious she doesn t know this but she helped me so much and it carried over throughout the rest of my day i was in such a good mood i was talking more than usual and had more confidence when speaking to others i m beginning to think maybe i should pursue a hobby or something where i am in a position of teaching and explaining things to others because i really like that feeling of helping others it definitely got me talking and focus on trying to explain what i was saying the best that i can i wanna start small like helping people one on one maybe become a tutor since i am excellent with school related subjects i really don t know

do i want friends or do i just want them because everyone tells me i should i ve recently been wondering if i really want friends i only have one friend and i barely see him but it doesn t bother me that much if i think about it not having friends wasn t even a problem for me until high school when my parents and teachers started insisting i should have friends i never cared but from then on they really started pushing it and they still do it wasn t such a big deal for me until they made me realize i was doing something wrong i don t know i often think that half of my concern about never socializing is because i feel pressured to not because i m actually interested or excited about it whenever i think about putting myself in situations where i have to make friends i feel terrible i don t want to and i m not interested in the slightest but i still feel pressured like if i don t i m living my life the wrong way and it makes me think that s probably why all my social interactions go badly because i go around with the predisposition to be liked and make friends when in reality i m not even interested that s why i put in so much effort and get so nervous and when i see things go wrong i get disappointed even though i have no interest in getting anything out of it i m at home and i feel bad for not being out there making friends and living life but then when i do i have a bad time and i just want to be at home i think i m simply chasing social achievements that i couldn t care less about and that only cause me problems it s true that i want to improve socially in other areas like walking down the street without overthinking or being able to be in a public place without anxiety but otherwise i m not interested and i m just suffering for no reason what do you think

went way out of my comfort zone on friday and i m still proud of myself hi everyone just wanted to share a little personal win because i m honestly still kind of shocked at myself on friday i went to a house party at my friend s friend s place there were probably around 15 people there and i didn t know a single one of them i was completely sober too not by choice really i was super bloated and couldn t face drinking it took a while for my friend to convince me to go but eventually i said yeah okay and pushed myself to do it at first i expected to completely shut down because my social anxiety is really bad like i normally cry when i have to meet new people but somehow i just did it i talked to people a lot of people probably around 10 different people over the time i was there everyone was so nice to me conversations just kind of happened and i laughed way more than i thought i would i stayed for about two to two and a half hours and went home around half ten feeling honestly proud instead of drained or embarrassed which is new for me what really got me though is that a few people there actually said they really wanted to see me again and a group of them have invited me out to karaoke this thursday that has never happened to me before ever it pushed me so far out of my comfort zone but in a good way and i just wanted to share because this feels like a massive step for me if you struggle with social anxiety too i promise the small wins matter i m really proud of myself for this one

no one warned me how bad social anxiety gets once you become an adult since being quiet and obedient is often praised during childhood many kids and even their parents if they pay attention at all don t realize how serious social anxiety can be until it s too late more often than not social anxiety is dismissed as simply being introverted when in reality you can be extroverted and socially anxious at the same time it s only when you become an adult and start thinking about your career and future that reality hits the mild loneliness you felt from having no friends or being left out in school suddenly turns into a very real threat to your life it can affect everything from your job to relationships and your overall experience of living you don t just fail at small things the accumulated setbacks frustrations and missed opportunities gradually snowballs until eventually it feels like you re failing at life which can further lead to other mental health issues like depression yet social anxiety is still poorly understood compared to other mental disorders people assume you can simply snap out of it or just talk to people and make friends and they often treat you as if you are a creep or some lesser being when you show symptoms of social anxiety

why do teenagers in public bully me so much i m 20 yo ftm with autism yesterday as i got onto a bus these people were saying ladies first idk if it were about me or one of the females i remember a girl sitting on the same bench as me without my permission she looked as though she belonged to the girls on the bench right next to where i was sat and while on the bus they were making fun of me for wanting to keep my ticket the first and second examples count as what i call clullying e g a portmandeau of bullying and clocking it s as painful as both bullying and misgendering combined but not as offensive as sexual harrassment especially if the trans person victim happens to be asexual it is basically the act of making fun of a transgender person for exhibiting traits associated with their birth sex causing both embarrassment and dysphoria today when i walked into b m someone jokingly said my bad as i walked past them because they were slow and another person yelled coca cola because they saw me eating a chocolate flavoured protein bar this is so traumatic why does it occur so frequently

working in fast food i wanted to hop on here to see if i could get any advice from an outside perspective because i feel like i m not always thinking clearly due to extreme social anxiety i have worked at 1 other fast food place in the past for almost 6 months and now i am working at tim hortons which has been fine but extremely stressful for me i want to first explain the context of my social anxiety first off like almost anyone else i want friends and seek social relationships i just struggle making conversation and my body overreacts to social situations and my heart races etc it s not that im stuck up in any way i just struggle to come up with things to say and have sort of an off putting energy about me which is fine i ve learned to just accept it and keep practicing the main reason i m writing this is because after 3 weeks of working in fast food again i am really really struggling with my anxiety and when i wake up i cry every single day and when i get home i cry some more mostly as a way to release all the built up emotions after being treated like crap at work by mainly customers but also sometimes coworkers for not being fast or good enough still training by the way haven t been taught everything yet i m trying my hardest and i guess that s a good thing but it s becoming too much for me seeing as i don t want to be stuck in fast food forever i need to find a career option asap i might be being dramatic but this industry kills my soul and i really need something better where i don t have to talk or socialize all the time it s exhausting i feel stuck because i feel like most careers are built for people who are extremely social and able to easily fake their emotions and personality that s just not me though and i need something that s a right fit for me

i do it to myself we re having a secret santa party at my job in a few weeks today we all drew names and i was happy with who i chose because we get along well enough so it wouldn t be too hard to find her a gift i know she likes taylor swift reading and fruity candies so i m planning on getting her a gift bag containing cheap little trinkets and items that revolve around those things i ve been lightly brainstorming over it for the past couple hours and it just hit me that i m putting so much effort into getting gifts that involve her likes and interests when i probably won t get the same treatment in return because no one at my job knows anything about me in return my anxiety makes me really closed off and i don t really talk much about myself in general my coworkers are really nice and have made efforts to get to know me before but my social skills suck so the conversation never makes it that far it s even become a bit of a joke i once told to my manager that i really like classic rock and when she mentioned it again in a conversation with some other coworkers a couple days later they were all super surprised that she managed to find out something about me they were all super shocked they kept asking her how she managed to find that out about me i ve worked there for over 2 years something like that should be basic knowledge by now but i m so reserved that it was like they uncovered some deep dark secret or something i ll probably end up getting a generic gift like a candle or a gift card which is fine and i m greatful regardless but it would ve been nice if i could ve gotten a present actually based on who i am and what i enjoy doing i have no one else to blame for it but myself though :

dea have social anxiety but no one believes you i am someone who implodes instead of explodes so when in feeling extreme social anxiety it usually is an internal shut down not and external melt down and it also tends to manifest in a lot of intrusive thoughts that either prevent me from engaging in a social situation or send my flight response into overdrive because my symptoms are relatively easy to hide if no ones paying attention shakiness weakness cold sweats increased heartrate difficulty breathing scatter thoughts ect i dont think anyone who knows me would believe me if i told them i do pretty well in group settings when theres clear common ground ill just let the others do the talking and add stuff when i need to but the farther outside of my comfort zone the worse the symptoms i usually find a way to leave a situation before it gets bad the most annoying thing is even when im not in a situation where i feel intense panic with every interaction i feel underlying anxiety and insecurity constantly having intrusive thoughts and over analyzing every interaction the slightest perceived neutral negative response has me second guessing my entire existence and self worth ill be laughing with a coworker and then if they dont laugh at the next thing i say im convinced they think im the most annoying person they know and hate having to work with me i always read into whats not said and i hate it i hate it so much that i ve mastered hiding how insecure i am behind a smile and now i hate that im reaching my lowest point and i dont think anyone will believe me and therefor wont take me seriously if i ask for help

advice please im 16 years old and started a new school 2 months ago now ive spent the last 3 years of my life constantly skipping school each day and wandering around the city without talking to anyone or making friends and when i d come home i d stay in my room and never speak to anyone my parents applied me to schools over the 3 years and i got into a new one maybe a year into skipping but that didn t turn out well and i just started skipping again after the 2 week break leading to me losing all friends i had there and being socially outcasted the application to my current school wasn t being responded to after months so i decided to go in in person and ask what was going on leading to them reapplying me and a few weeks later getting in it s supposed to be a laid back adult learning experience similar to college where you can choose your own schedule and when you want and don t want to do work usually students come in a few days a week for a few hours but i wanted to come in daily for the full 6 hours for the first couple weeks i couldn t bring myself to talk to anyone i met there there was a large friend group in the school who all seemed really cool to me and one of them was especially approachable so one day i started talking to them and we had a lot of similar interests and the week later we spent like 4 hours hanging out after school and we got pretty close then after that i was more willing to open up to the others of the group and i ended up getting close with another two people i was close enough with 3 of the 8 to stay at their houses when my own living situation was getting rocky and two of them visited me when i was put in the psych ward for a week i really like these guys and want to be friends with them so bad and they say they re my friends but i don t feel it whenever we talk i m the one to message first none of them have ever messaged me first whenever they tell me something they include they already told someone else first they all have friends other than me that they prioritize over me and i can t stop feeling sick to my stomach jealous over it everyone has someone else and i have nobody like that it doesn t matter what they tell me when were together because i never feel it s true one of them told me about how they re only faking being optimistic because of how pessimistic i am and they re not as happy a person they come off to be because they say they don t have any friends and they re glad i m their friend then they go a week not showing up to school and when i message them they don t respond how can you say im the only friend you ve had in ages that you really care about and love but then not talk to me i see you re online i see you posting on your story i know you re talking to other people and i m being ignored i spent 3 years alone and now that i have friends it s the worst time of my life because i cant be as important to them as they are to me i feel expendable and when i am with them i feel like i m taking up time they could be spending with people they actually care about and i m scared they ll leave me because i m really just a shallow unsociable person and when i m not putting on my loud flamboyant act i feel like they ll ditch me after realising i m nobody special i deactivated my instagram a few days ago to stop myself from messaging them then spending the day checking if they re online and airing me i want to talk to them about this but i dont want to sound like i m guilt tripping them into talking to me more none of them have reached out on other platforms we have each other added on about my instagram being gone so that makes me feel even better sorry if i sounded selfish or whiney through this but i really need advice on what to do

my thought hi everybody today while spending some time with my nephew and his little friends something really struck me watching them grow up in this fast moving world of technology made me realise how much things have changed especially for the generation we now call gen alpha and gen beta it feels like somewhere along the way we ve stopped letting our children truly open their minds and i m not blaming anyone maybe as parents or future parents we all want our kids to be safe to never face what we once faced to never feel the pain we felt but i ve also seen how this turns into overprotection a child cries and everything is placed in front of them instantly no waiting no thinking no learning if we never let our children feel small struggles how will they ever understand effort patience or even basic survival instincts sometimes i think about how our grandparents lived they grew up farming cultivating their own crops raising cows and buffaloes not as pets but as part of life and responsibility kids used to take cattle for grazing help their parents in the fields and learn through real experiences they built relationships with neighbours and relatives because life naturally connected everyone but today it feels different we are drifting into a world where we don t even know who our neighbours are not their names not their families not their struggles technology was meant to change the world but it has also started changing the human inside the world maybe some people call this freedom maybe some feel it s modern living but personally i don t know i just feel something important is slipping away connection community resilience and the simple understanding of life i d really like to hear your thoughts on this what do you think

vent: how am i supposed to work on my social anxiety when i can t hear anybody i m beyond frustrated i have been in cbt for social anxiety for about a year it has helped me so much i feel like i ve gotten so much better at going to the social events that i would have done anything to get out of before i don t automatically shift my eyes away when someone tries to talk to me my hands don t shake as much and i don t feel like my heart is going to beat out of my chest i still get anxious but it s so much better than it was before here s the problem: my hearing sucks so bad and i don t know how i m ever really going to shed my social anxiety when i feel so awkward not knowing what people are saying especially at parties i legit have hearing aids and they help a lot but when i go to parties particularly the parties with people i would really like to develop better relationships with and learn how to be myself around i cannot hear them to save my life and it s awful i just smile and nod and pray it s the socially appropriate response to whatever they re saying i went to a party today and was in a conversation with two ladies whom i like a lot and i wanted to participate so badly but i could only make out maybe a fifth of what they were saying later when i was in a quieter room and one of the ladies was there i apologized and explained my hearing is awful she was so nice and was like oh yeah i have trouble hearing too and i was able to mention i have hearing aids but it felt awkward to bring it up and ugh i came home feeling so defeated like i still have all this work to do but how am i ever going to do it when i can t even hear people has anyone else ever had this problem is there anything that helped you did you tell people your hearing sucked and if so how did you phrase it

working corporate about a month into my first real job as an accountant which i m grateful for but geez sometimes i find myself wanting to pivot to another career and i m already starting to feel out of place i don t have much trouble asking questions about work related things but the social aspect of the job stresses me out my team is supportive and helpful but they re all pretty extroverted and talk a lot with each other during the day i sometimes try to chime in but i ll eventually just fizzle out of the conversation and focus back on my work instead even when we head out to take a coffee break together i rarely initiate conversation and find myself having nothing to add to what they re talking about they also enjoy drinking as do many people in the company many happy hour enthusiasts in this workplace i personally don t drink at all and i find happy hours so exhausting but i don t want to be perceived as a debbie downer by my team every option just makes me feel sick to my stomach

why do i sound less smart when i speak than when i think i struggle to express myself and share my knowledge and it frustrates me deeply i consider myself fairly smart and knowledgeable i ve always been curious interested in many subjects and capable of forming clear coherent thoughts at least when i m alone or writing when i write i can express myself easily articulate complex ideas and feel confident about what i know but the moment i m face to face with someone especially in conversation everythin changes my words come out messy i struggle to form sentences doubt everything i say sound hesitant and unsure even when i m talking about topics i m passionate about and have spent hours learning through reading documentaries and research it mostly happens with people i find interesting or knowledgeable people i actually want to connect with the pressure builds in my head my mind goes blank and i end up saying i don t know not because i truly don t know but because speaking suddenly feels too difficult i withdraw into listening mode instead of sharing my perspective which only increases my frustration with people who aren t knowledgeable about the subject i speak more freely there s less fear of messing up or being corrected so i feel safer expressing my thoughts without overthinking every word i genuinely don t mind saying i don t know when i actually don t know i have no ego around that what hurts is when i do know but can t express it and others assume i lack competence or even belittle me for it i m not sure what causes this : anxiety self doubt memory issues or something else but i know it s holding me back both socially and professionally i want to be able to express myself clearly showcase my knowledge and convey my competence so i can pursue opportunities i m truly capable of handling has anyone experienced something similar or found ways to overcome this i d really appreciate any insight or advice

23f my take on social anxiety hello everyone finding this and reading the first few post has really made me feel like i m not the only one who is struggling and the fact that having social anxiety isn t taken seriously from others who don t have it i m glad this exist because i don t have to try to explain myself repeatedly to people and expect them to understand social anxiety has affected most my life until now and although i m improving little by little i have come this far to have steady and secure conversation about it as i know i m not the only one who struggles with overthinking and i think it comes with social anxiety which is honestly frustrating because not only it affects on you but others that you have in your life i ve had moments in my dark days that i felt like i m going insane and that i m being unheard as i am in relationship right now and healthy one too and if i m being honest we all know being in relationship can be hard because of what we have but what i am grateful about is that i was able to push myself to talk to people and that was on a app that looks like a live stream or public vc for people you can meet online of course i was scared as i often just stay in the comments section but when i met the right person to talk to and this was all from quarantine so even tho i felt shaky this person didn t even take notice and just treated me like everyone else my point is even though social anxiety can be isolating and prevent from doing this you deserve and to accomplish things doesn t mean it s impossible a simple hi and smile can go a long way but even though it didn t go to plan you achieve something even though it s small you got this

had a fight in class and i can t stop thinking about it i can t take it anymore for context i am 19 doing my 4th sem in college i had a small argument with a guy whom i had some issues and accidentally made the fight physical i gave him a small bump on his head and went to my room his friends came to my room and threatened me and i just admitted my mistake and they went away he called later asking for my mom s number but i didnt give it up and my roommate spoke with them and sorta settled the matter but when i go to class i feel like everybody is talking behind my back plotting something and that i shouldn t trust anyone i cant look at him or his friends in the eye one time i was entering the class while his friend was exiting and i had to sort of give him some way and i keep overthinking maybe i was a little submissive i feel like he moved a bit too but everything is too much to handle i worried that he might go to disciplinary committee but that didnt seem to be the case i have anxiety disorder and ocd and i take meds for it too i sent him a sorry message and he seems to have screenshotted it and stuff i am confused so as to how to handle this some people say i shouldn t have hit him some people from the nearby class came and told me i did good hitting him but i didnt want to i just want it to be like it never happened but i cant make it so i cant stop thinking about it sorry guys please help me out i need to vent super badly

just here for support i am coming to terms with the fact that i have social anxiety i have said for years that i m not shy just introverted and that i don t care what anyone thinks when deep down i am consumed by what others might be thinking i am started to look up resources looking into therapy when my insurance kicks in and talking to family about giving up alcohol i don t drink daily but i have been drinking at social functions for years just to get through it i always over do it and have terrible anxiety after analyzing everything i did and might have did it s been hard talking to family about my plans to manage this i m sure everyone has heard just stop worrying so much and who cares what they think and many more but i wasn t prepared for how crazy that would make me feel i keep asking myself if it should really be that easy but finding this group has given me some clarity on that since my last binge drinking at a social event which was just last night i have had crippling anxiety i feel like i just can t take it anymore i want to call everyone and apologize but people keep telling me i have nothing to apologize for i have no idea what i can do in the now to ease this feeling off my chest and out of mind i guess this is an attempt at getting some of my thoughts out

party fail this is just a vent in a safe space not looking for advice there was a birthday party tonight for an acquaintance s husband i was happy to be invited even though i really don t know her husband my socializing success with these kinds of events is about 50 50 equal chances it could go well or it could suck i started getting very anxious while getting ready stomach in knots and lightheaded i really didn t want to go pushed through the anxiety and fear and i went it was all so off i tried to get comfortable by helping with putting food and plates out i knew many people there but whenever i tried to make conversation i couldn t find words i sounded like an idiot wherever i stood i was in the way i had left my jacket on the back of a chair that i was planning on sitting in when i got my food someone sat in that chair and getting my jacket was awkward and then there was nowhere else to sit there were probably 80 people there and i felt so alone and stupid and uncomfortable so i just left it was hectic and loud and i m certain i wasn t missed which is a relief a few years ago i would ve been in tears driving home not this time i just thought okay that didn t go well so at least i m not kicking myself for another party fail it was just a really off night and i left maybe i ll do better next time vent over thank you

the placebo effect the placebo effect that is used to help with physical problems could also help with mental ones for instance imagine your therapist told you about a new drug that would permanently cure your social anxiety but it was actually a placebo and you didnt know it was fake you then discussed and researched about this new drug and felt very positive that it would fix your anxiety after taking it you immediately believe that your problem will be fixed and interact with others extremely well not caring if you act awkwardly because you believe the drug is making you more confident when its just your brain from what i know social anxiety is mostly caused by thought patterns and the perception that previous social interactions went badly and the fear that future social events will also be bad and it can be removed simply by not caring about being awkward and judged by others when in social situations

sertraline experience today i was in a really busy shopping centre full christmas chaos i got beeped in the car park for stopping to wait for someone to pull out so that i could take their spot i nearly got walked into a few times i talked to several shop assistants i was wedged between people for hours but amidst all the chaos i felt so peaceful inside my daughter was fairly annoyed at my walking pace because i just slowed down and leaned into the calmness within me i ve been on sertraline for 7 months now i used to feel highly agitated in shopping centres even during non peak times i d avoid speaking to shop assistants at all costs if someone honked at me in the car park i d be in fight or flight mode from there on out i am in therapy and we ve done a lot of work on my self worth respect trust and love so it s not just the medication helping me heal but i definitely feel like rather than: a button being pushed to send me into pure panic and irritation due to fear a button is being pushed to connect me to my inner state of calm so that i have a shield to protect me in these situations just thought i d share my experience in case it helps anyone

public speaking yesterday has left me unable to breathe i had to give a brief presentation at a conference in front of my colleagues yesterday and even thinking of it now is making my throat close up before the pandemic i was in a position that required frequent public speaking it was never anything i enjoyed but i got good at it because i had to i lost my job during covid and landed at my new place of employment the past 5 years are the worst my social anxiety has ever been this has been exacerbated by a boss that belittles me and makes me genuinely feel stupid i think this has been the confirmation my social anxiety needs to completely convince me that i am in fact stupid and nobody likes me the social anxiety was always there but my boss gives it so much to feed off of regardless i m so frustrated with myself that i used to give hour long presentations in front of a crowd of 100 people and feel fine and now stumble all over my words get out of breath and generally sound stupid when i have to give a short 10 minute presentation the constant rumination is going to ruin my weekend all day i ve just been reliving every detail and it gives me the exact same sensation as if i was doing it all over again shaking nausea and constricted feeling throat chest breathing on manual i can t stand living like this

a friend and anxiety i also want to talk about my sad i have severe social anxiety disorder in the first semester i made a friend he didn t have sad but he often had low confidence because of that we matched well we had similar interests and i started feeling good around him we used to talk and laugh but i still felt anxious sometimes even with him this cycle continued over time now we are in the 4th semester and he is no longer a low confidence guy but i m still the same struggling with anxiety he now has a group of friends apart from me and he spends most of the day with them i feel like after some days i ll be completely alone i feel really bad and sad i thought i finally found a real friend after four years but it wasn t the case time changed but my anxiety didn t in fact now my anxiety even has a physical impact on my body like my left eye automatically starts blinking whenever i feel socially anxious in social situations

the confusing part of improving social anxiety: not knowing who would still respect you if you slipped there s a specific confusion that comes with getting better at masking or managing social anxiety people start treating you with more respect more ease more interest and instead of feeling relieved you end up stuck with a question you can t answer: would they still treat me this way if i showed the anxious version of myself again it turns progress into a strange conflicted space you want to believe the positive reactions are genuine but part of you wonders if you re only being treated well because they assume you re confident now you can t tell whether you re finally being seen accurately or whether you re just fitting into the version of you they prefer and the harder part is wanting to know the truth without actually wanting to risk slipping back into the anxious behavior to find out so you stay caught in this loop of improvement mixed with uncertainty unsure which relationships are real and which ones rely on you keeping the vulnerable parts hidden

anyone else during roll call in class i even hesitate to say here what if my voice doesn t come out or the teacher doesn t hear me and asks if i m here i overthink every little thing i do for example in my course i forgot my pencil case i was even too shy to ask the people behind me if they had a spare pencil i got a pencil but the lead broke i spent two hours thinking about how to ask for a refill and then the guy behind me understood without me saying anything and handed me one and i said thanks at the beginning of the course i fell for the prettiest girl in class and developed a crush but because of my issue i couldn t imagine it going anywhere two weeks passed and despite my extreme introversion the girl found my number and confessed to me we met and started flirting but it only lasted 5 days i was the one who ended it again because it was such a weird situation: the person in front of me is super energetic social and does everything without shame meanwhile this was the first time in my life i d connected with a girl the first time i d talked to a girl for that long and i had no idea how to handle it i constantly talked to the girl through ai actually i don t know i m extremely obsessed with the past i ve experienced big events and kept bottling them all up inside everything started towards the end of 7th grade two guys fixated on me over some issue and poisoned my entire year i don t know if it s right to call it peer bullying because physically i could handle them but psychologically they put a lot of pressure on me i won t go into details or this post will get really long anyway middle school ended lgs high school entrance exam came i took it but despite going to cram school for 3 years i just winged it and left without caring maybe the best time of my life was the summer after 8th grade after all that unpleasantness when placing into high school i got into a decent place with my gpa and luckily i ended up in the same class as my childhood friend adapting was really easy whatever happened it was during the 15 day break: my friend made an unforgivable mistake and our closeness completely broke off a week later in an empty class period some unbalanced guy lit a cigar everyone took a puff i did too like everyone else and someone recorded me on video and that video became really popular both in class and at school maybe this event triggered my anxiety the most i m not sure but 9th grade ended when starting 10th grade on the first day of school i was shocked: my class had been changed for some stupid reason supposedly to balance the number of classes in the school anyway the moment i entered my new class i didn t talk to anyone even a guy in the back who was also new to the class tried really hard to be friends but it was in vain i being soulless gave no reaction for 3 weeks in my new class i didn t connect with anyone i just slept in the front row and finally thinking maybe if i go back to my old class everything will fix itself i managed to switch back with difficulty: i talked to the guidance counselor went to a psychologist and got a report talked at length with the assistant principal and somehow got back to my class now it s been almost 2 months since i switched back to my old class and school sucks the assholes in class acted like they never knew me from the beginning and didn t give a shit about my return i didn t talk to anyone either because i m introverted but somehow this situation only happens at school in courses or in any social setting however in life i have 3 real friends i can call brother who truly value me when i m with them my social anxiety drops to 0 like a whole new personality emerges straight out of tyler durden i want this not just with them but in every moment of my life i know the problem is entirely in me and the only person who can change it is me but even the smallest things seem impossible to me: saying hi to someone starting a conversation etc i don t know what to do i m sure no one will give a shit about this post but at least i m venting to real people not ai

fear vs discomfort in social settings lately i ve been thinking about whether there is a meaningful distinction between fear and discomfort in socially avoidant people fear is actively worrying about social situations and believing or even just feeling like things will go badly while discomfort is feeling stressed and overwhelmed in the presence of others there is large overlap between these two in most people and discomfort is an inevitable consequence of fear i make the distinction for myself because i only really experience the discomfort anymore at least to any significant degree it s so bad that i feel the need to completely distance myself from people but i don t experience any conscious fear maybe i ve just repressed the fear by emotionally isolating myself and i m afraid of being afraid again if that makes sense maybe that s what that discomfort is but i don t know anxiety is specifically about excessive fear and worrying so i m not too sure that what i have can be considered social anxiety anymore if it isn t then i don t know how to describe what s wrong with me does anyone relate to this

how do you personally combat the fear of persecution hi everyone i have my own ways of combatting this issue it is one of my recent yet strongest aspects of social anxiety i can t enjoy public spaces without feeling of extreme judgement from everyone i think everyone is out to get me harm me and make sure they know i am inferior to them i know this is an anxiety response and in reality a lot of the signs i feel people give me don t in fact make sense i combat this by wearing ear defenders in public not only does this calm me down as i am sensitive to loud noises but i do think it is a signal to people that i am sensitive therefore they will treat me better i also tend to be very passive and submissive when i walk i yield to others consistently even if they weren t going to walk my way i avoid eye contact consistently with others walking past and watch my feet i feel like these motions give people the opportunity to further push their authority on me i often feel like a punching bag to others because i don t speak up i see this as a coping skill because it feels more comfortable to me rather than showing signs of confidence eye contact good posture fierce walk i was wondering if anyone had anything else that has helped them the stuff i ve learned combatting the thoughts and everything has helped but i still get incredibly uncomfortable in public it has made me unable to relax in public and exhausted thanks

shh the quiet revolution the rise of the introvert a guide for channeling neurosis also known as ocd adhd add depression and anxiety into creative or genius talent our everlasting will to live and it s seeking of survival presents us with a concept most people deviate from because it does not apply to their personality type and this concept is perfectionism the drive of continuous improvement perfectionism is what the consciousness seeks to truly liberate itself and give in to the unconscious ever wonder why you toss and turn at night unable to sleep thinking of ways to improve your life well we can blame the drive to perfection for that here s how to channel that drive to talent nietzsche kauffman kant and freud all speak about sublimation an example of that would be sublimed sexuality a sexual impulse that can be channeled into a creative spiritual activity instead of being full filled directly the same can be said for intrusive thoughts but how do we do that this can be accomplished by allowing the neurosis to temporarily take over like that it s not being repressed but instead sublimed and channeled for your benefit let s use the example of someone wanting to t0rture their foe that can be sublimated into the desire to defeat one s rival in a contest or creative battle therefore sublimating the violent nature of the thought and instead translating it to rational and creative thinking now let s bring it back to more realistic scenario say it s 11pm you re laying in bed and the thought i m not good enough comes forward instead of pushing that thought away give into it temporarily and see what the root cause is you will not be able to figure out the root cause of the thought unless you give in to it close your eyes and feed it think who says i m not good enough why do i want to be good enough and let the neurosis do the rest eventually the thought will pass and you will return to a normal functioning state however this time when the neurosis returns with that same thought you can now tackle it with rationality and creativity instead of fear slowly un reveling the root cause and eventually getting rid of the thought all together within time the neurosis will be replaced by rational and creative thinking that can be channeled and harnessed for future life guidance have fun

went to work xmas party here is what helped i d been dreading it for weeks it was hell but i managed to go through it me surrounded by 12 extroverts in a packed venue nowhere to hide what helped was the following: 1 lemon balm supplements i took 3 capsules previous night and then the night of party took a capsule at 4pm and then at 7pm the supplement has 2400mg lemon balm per capsule it really helped with the physical symptoms allowed me to simply ignore the negative thoughts and awkward moments it was mvp for me and i ll be using it for the future this must be what it is like to use medication or not have social anxiety i wasn t freaking out and not frowning which i normally do when anxious 2 this was an extreme method but it did help me alleviate the anxiety a little bit and that was what if this was my last day alive it could be the lemon balm but this helped me not overthink before the event 3 don t expect a result if you think in terms of i want this conversation or activity to go well you put pressure on yourself which is not needed especially if your battling anxiety so i just engaged in activity regardless of the result if i wanted to be quiet i remained quiet rather than forcing myself to talk awkward moments i ignored it s part of the social anxiety if you check my post history i always dread the work events this was hell but i got through it now i m on wind down and will try to avoid ruminating on the event hope this helps anyone who needs it

volunteering was the unexpected cure for my lifelong social anxiety i want to share something that genuinely changed my life and i hope it might help someone else here who s struggling like i was for as long as i can remember social anxiety has controlled my life i was bullied pretty badly growing up and it left deep scars that followed me into adulthood over the years i developed this core belief that people were generally cold judgmental and unaccepting every social interaction felt like walking through a minefield i was constantly bracing myself for rejection or mockery it was exhausting about 15 years ago i decided to join a volunteer group in my area honestly i almost backed out a dozen times before that first meeting but something in me was desperate enough to try anything the difference was immediate and shocking people were nice genuinely nice and i started to realize why these were people who cared enough about something to give their time for free there was a sincerity there that i d rarely encountered before they weren t there because they had to be or because they were getting paid they wanted to be there and that changed everything about how they interacted here s what really got me: because volunteer groups are always looking for people to join they actually wanted me there for the first time in my life i felt welcomed with open arms i felt respected not tolerated not grudgingly accepted actually respected and valued i can t overstate how powerful that feeling was for someone who d spent years believing they were fundamentally unlikeable the real growth came when we d go out on activities that involved talking to strangers i won t lie some people would brush me off or outright reject what we were saying the old me would have spiraled from that convinced it was personal that i was the problem but here s the thing: i had people with me when someone rejected me my teammates would reassure me it was okay that it happens to everyone that it wasn t about me personally they d console me encourage me and we d move on to the next person together those experiences taught me more about human nature than years of therapy ever could i learned that rejection is often situational not personal i learned that most people are dealing with their own stuff and aren t examining me the way i feared i learned that i could handle discomfort and come out okay on the other side today my social anxiety has diminished so much that sometimes i can t believe it s the same person i can strike up conversations with strangers i can attend social events without that crushing dread and here s what really gets me multiple people have told me that i m a warm person that they genuinely enjoy my company me the person who spent decades convinced they were socially broken i m not saying this to brag i m saying it because if you d told me a 15 years ago this was possible i would never have believed you and if i can get here maybe you can too a few important notes: please don t ask me which specific group i joined i m not here to promote any particular organization the point isn t the specific cause it s that volunteer groups in general tend to create this environment because they need people because everyone there chose to be there because there s a shared purpose it creates a uniquely accepting atmosphere that said: please be careful and look into things before joining unfortunately some groups that present themselves as volunteer organizations can have cult like qualities trust your instincts if something feels off if there s excessive attention at first if they discourage you from maintaining outside relationships get out a healthy volunteer group should enhance your life not consume it or isolate you but if you find a legitimate cause you care about environmental animal welfare community service human rights whatever speaks to you i really encourage you to give it a shot you don t have to commit to anything huge at first just show up once see how it feels for me it was the beginning of getting my life back i hope sharing this helps someone else take that first terrifying step

utterly and completely worthless and undesireable
