extrover to introvert w social anxiety hello i am a 24 year old woman and i m in a crisis ever since i was little i was a quiet child i didn t draw much attention to myself i always had that one solid friendship with someone but i knew how to interact and make friends growing up i was bullied nothing too extreme but i was always that particular one with niche interests then in high school i didn t really know how to make new friends or interact until i became friends with a girl in particular very outgoing and genuine and i started copying her behavior from that moment on people started talking to me more boys would approach me and everything was going great then we went separate ways for university and things continued to go well for a while until i overdid it with smoking weed and going to parties mostly just to feel accepted that is where the crisis began i fell into depression i became unrecognizable i smoked all day dpdr emerged and i started changing how i saw people i was focused entirely on myself and i stopped talking to everyone after that came another phase i wasn t doing drugs anymore i removed all my piercings i started studying and committing myself again but i had lost all the connections i once had except for one group of friends a few months later i went abroad for erasmus and i was completely reborn i became everything i wanted to be i looked good i took care of myself though with ups and downs and thanks to a girl i lived with who had a personality similar to the one i knew in high school but also maybe thanks to the mood i had i made a lot of friends a year has passed and i am still here living with my boyfriend in the same student residence where we met and now i have realized that i don t know how to talk to people anymore i spent most of my life seeing people who struggled to interact as weird and now i have ended up being like them i understand them now and i would actually love to meet people like me when i talk i feel strange i come out with weird things i think i exaggerate my facial expressions because the person i am talking to suddenly opens their eyes wide i am trying to study how to approach people and the advice i get is to show interest in the other person but i can t the words don t come out or if they do they come out confused i feel alone and the anxiety is overwhelming is there anyone who feels the same way or who has gone through something similar if so what advice can you give me sorry for the english but i ve written it without being lucid

i so did not need this kind of commentary about my anxiety hey so i have a solo flight coming up this week it s so anxiety inducing but somehow talking about it with someone weirdly relaxes me i was just discussing it with someone at work earlier today and she wants to see the hotel room i booked and stuff i take out my phone to show her and she notices something about me that i wasn t aware of at all she said why is your hand so shaky and i was kinda surprised she commented on that and i said i have a lot of anxiety about this trip then not even 20 seconds later she tells someone else who was in the same room you see how much his hand is shaking what the heck new insecurity unlocked thanks now i have this recurring thought implanted in my head: what if my hand shakes when i show my flight details at the airport what if it shakes as i pay for food or when i try to check in at the hotel i know it s not the end of the world but as anxiety sufferers we don t want people to notice the signs be it shaky hands sweaty palms blushing whatever so yeah i wish i didn t know my hands even shake when i m anxious just annoying how people can comment on that multiple times

is it normal to have horrible weeks of anxiety even taking sertraline and that one good day it seems like my true self hello i have been taking sertraline 50 mg for 6 weeks most of the time i ve been doing more or less well but this last week has been horrible and i don t understand why i had an incredible day on monday i felt like i was the real me without anxiety: i talked to everyone i felt connected to people i felt safe and socially in tune it was the feeling i had for a long time as if everyone was on my level without feeling anyone superior it was a very nice day but since then fatal i have had severe anxiety attacks in class the other day i had a brutal peak: nausea desire to vomit shaking dry mouth cold hands i had to ask to go to the bathroom because i thought i was going to faint or vomit in front of everyone just imagining it made me panic and now i m afraid it will happen to me again in class i don t understand it because i ve been on the medication for a while part of me thinks maybe 50 mg isn t enough but i also know not to change the dosage on my own it frustrates me to feel so bad just when the sertraline is supposed to be stabilized i m also in exam time and very stressed so i don t know if everything comes from there still it s very hard to go from such a good day where i seemed to be myself again to such a bad week has anyone else had very good days and then horrible days even while taking sertraline is it normal for anxiety to return so strongly due to stress have you had that feeling that me without anxiety is much more sociable and secure and that the bad days cover up everything any advice or experience would be very helpful thank you

how to handle group projects with social anxiety i have social anxiety and depression i ve had anxiety since i was a kid and i m an adult now studying in university my studies have been fine except talking and voicing my ideas either way so as i mentioned during our group meetings i m mostly silent sometimes agreeing and speaking only when someone directly asks my opinion and even then i feel like thousands of people are watching me and if i say one wrong word i m getting thrown off a cliff as a punishment i find it very hard to get the courage to speak when the other group members are more talkative and say the thing i had in mind before me in these situations my mind is basically in freeze mode and my anxiety is through the roof so thoughts are very hard to form and it feels very discouraging to hear the only idea i had in mind be said by someone else i basically lost my chance to participate and now the subject has already changed i might tell about my ideas later in our group chat by text which is way more comfortable for me the times i have tried to speak up i end up getting silence back i don t understand why yes my sentences are rather short but i ve voiced my concern and now suddenly nobody has anything to say it s very awkward as if the situation wasn t uncomfortable enough i don t want to talk much since i often stutter and forget basic words which makes me look stupid it makes me feel depressed and i just try to suffer through the meeting while guilt and other bad feelings creep up i don t know how can i improve this has anyone felt this way and somehow overcame it since i ve been in multiple group meetings weekly now and i still feel the same maybe worse it s not boosting my confidence as often happens when you keep doing something and realize it wasn t so bad i desperately want to be able to contribute my part and i don t want my group members to think i m slacking off on purpose thank you

sertraline experience hello everyone yesterday tuesday i completed my sixth week taking 50 mg of sertraline although i previously took 25 mg for 10 days so my body could adjust the first week was probably the worst in terms of anxiety although i m doing better now but this week has been awful a lot of anxiety negative thoughts and maybe it has to do with the fact that i m in exam season but honestly it s been terrible and i thought i was going to have a really good week because on monday i felt fine sociable and all that but these past few days have been awful i wanted to know if something similar has happened to anyone else p s : did you also feel like when your social anxiety decreased you were your true self

im practicing small talk with ai before social events and it s actually reducing my panic attacks i have social anxiety and small talk is literally my worst nightmare i freeze up can t think of anything to say generally give stupid answers then spend hours afterwards replaying every awkward silence and convincing myself everyone thinks i m weird my therapist suggested exposure therapy but the thought of forcing myself into social situations before i m ready just makes my anxiety worse so i started practicing conversations with an ai first as a middle step ik it sounds ridiculous but its actually helping me build confidence without the pressure of real people judging me irl i can practice asking follow up questions work on thinking less about finding perfect responses experiment with being vulnerable without worrying i said something wrong it s low stakes enough that i don t spiral into panic but still feels like actual conversation practice ive been doing this for about a month and went to a work social last week still nervous but didn t have a panic attack beforehand for the first time ever baby steps but any progress with social anxiety feels massive when you ve been struggling for years anyone else found ways to practice that don t involve throwing yourself into the deep end before you re ready

social life i ve got a pretty simple question but it seems like a lot of adults are dealing with it silently: do you become alone surrounded as you get into your twenties or thirties i see more and more people moving changing jobs getting into routines and one thing always comes up: friend circles shrink meeting new people becomes rare and even when you go out or run into people the conversations often stay super shallow i feel like a lot of us feel this way: being in a bar or at a party surrounded by people but not really connected wanting to share a simple moment without really having anyone to do it with or just thinking: is it just me or has it become really hard to make new friends after a certain age so i d be super curious to hear your thoughts: is this something you re experiencing too has it become harder to connect with people than before in your opinion how do you do it or how would you like to do it to meet new people these days i d really like to read your experiences it helps me understand what people are really going through behind this topic that we rarely talk about even though it affects way more people than we think

you re not nervous you re excited one of my favorite perspective changers is knowing that being nervous is effectively the same as being excited i appreciate this isn t for everyone but i can t tell you how much it s helped my social anxiety let me expalin you know that feeling heart racing tight chest shallow breath sweaty palms you label it: nerves your brain quietly adds: discomfort and danger here s what s wild: on a purely biological level that state is almost identical to excitement in both cases your sympathetic nervous system is switched on your built in get ready mode your adrenal glands release adrenaline and noradrenaline your heart pumps harder blood flow shifts to your muscles your breathing speeds up to pull in more oxygen the gut slows down which is why you feel those butterflies or sinking feeling chemically it s the same family of signals your body uses when something matters and you need to be more alert more focused more ready to act so what makes one feel awful and the other feel electric the brain s interpretation layer when you re anxious regions like the amygdala flag the situation as threat your prefrontal cortex then spins up worst case scenarios and your attention locks onto what could go wrong when you re excited much of the same arousal is there but your brain s reward circuits are more involved the story becomes: there s potential here something good might happen same body different prediction you get that feeling of wanting something to come emotions are basically: body sensations brain prediction story you can t always control the first part a big moment will light up your system that s biology doing its job but you can influence the prediction and the story next time you feel that surge before something important don t fight the sensations or assume they mean you re not ready notice the racing heart the fizz the heat and tell yourself: this is my body mobilising these are the same signals as excitement my system is gearing up to help me perform you switch from fear and danger to excitement and engagement then point your mind at the opportunity the idea you want to land the person you want to be proud of the possibility on the other side you re not pretending you re relaxed you re doing something smarter: letting the biology of nervous become fuel for excited

awkward relations with people i don t know if anyone else will relate but as a socially awkward anxious person ive had many awkward experiences with people throughout my life i don t want to get specific because its embarrassing and even though its probably extremely unlikely i worry that one of the people i was awkward with might be on this reddit and realize who i am but whenever i have an awkward experience with someone in my head i feel like ive ruined any hope of having further relations with that person like ive messed up and i have to find a new person to be friends with i want to go outside and be social and just talk to people but im afraid that i might run into someone ive been awkward to in the past because there are literally so many and its not just in my head i have literally seen people who ive been awkward with in the past at my gym and where i work which are essentially the only places i go where i could run into someone luckily ive never had to interact with them i just saw them but what if i am in a situation where i am forced to talk to one of these people i imagine these scenarios in my head like if im trying to make friends and one of my new friends introduces me to someone who ive been awkward to in the past that would just be a nightmare i dont even know what i would say these thoughts just fill me up with fear and prevent me from going outside and being social and its so annoying because i could just talk to these people and pretend like those awkward encounters never happened or i could apologize but i feel like you shouldn t have to apologize just for being awkward except for the ones where i literally just ignore people like this one time someone i knew from school waved at me and i just pretended like i didn t see them i obviously did see them but i literally have no social skills so i had to just ignore them this was very awkward and while they where still around i further pretended like i had no clue who they were i played dumb even though i am a very aware person and i feel like they 100 knew that i recognized them which just made the whole experience just so awkward its weird because i am very aware as a person im very curious and always looking around for something interesting that s my nature i would say but because of my social anxiety im forced to put my head and not look around too much in social situations because what if i see someone i know then i will be forced to interact with them and that ll be awkward so i just suppress my natural curiosity to avoid painful social interactions its so stupid that i have to do this but i do i wish i just felt comfortable enough to have conversation with anyone its not even like i only struggle conversing with people who ived been awkward to in the past its just anyone i know in general but especially people who i know and have awkward relations with its just so silly to be afraid of social encounters there are literally no real consequences except the feeling of embarrassment but i can take that i shouldn t be scared of it yet i am any who that s my spiel done

dealing with social anxiety and looking for help i ve been struggling with social anxiety for a long time but i never talked about it because no one around me seemed to deal with the same things i thought i was just overreacting now that i m getting closer to turning 18 thinking about college getting a job and preparing for the future the anxiety has gotten worse and i m genuinely worried about how i ll manage i ve been physically abused throughout my childhood and even now it still happens sometimes though it s mostly verbal abuse i ve also been bullied for years i recently learned that past trauma can play a big role in developing social anxiety and it makes a lot of sense because i ve become extremely unsocial i do have friends but i only see them at school i don t hang out with anyone outside of that and i basically spent this whole summer at home without going anywhere i constantly feel like people are judging me being at school is uncomfortable especially during lunch if someone looks at me i immediately assume they re judging me and i lose my appetite there were times when my friends literally had to cover me while i ate or check if someone was looking just so i could feel a little safer but even that didn t really help public places are hard for me i hate being in public and i can t bring myself to use public transportation alone go to the mall alone or do basic everyday things that most people don t even think about it feels overwhelming and exhausting i had my first therapy session this monday and i ve already scheduled another one for next week it honestly felt good to finally talk about everything and let it out but therapy is expensive and i don t think i ll be able to afford it long term realistically i can maybe manage around 10 sessions i m also planning to see a psychotherapist once my spot opens up since the waiting line was about three months is there anything else that could help maybe medication or other alternatives i just want to get better but i m scared of going into adulthood feeling this way

how do i stop ruminating after painfully awkward social interactions for context i ve had pretty bad social anxiety since about 13 years old it s gotten worse and better throughout periods of my life but never fully goes away right now i m 23 and i ve made a lot of progress in rebuilding my window of tolerance most days i mainly just struggle with overthinking worrying that i m a fraud not good enough annoying soaking up others personalities around me to make up for not having my own now that i have a few friends i have some days where i feel completely inept at socializing like i forgot how to be a human being my face heats up and i feel instantly embarrassed when someone talks to me it s worse with work friends because i have to see them nearly every day even on the days when i feel like a shell of a person the more i fumble in my interactions with them the more i ruminate on it it fuels my anxiety and makes me fumble even more i constantly have the urge to apologize for making things so uncomfortable or explain that i ve been feeling off i ll replay the interaction for days or weeks afterwards cursing myself for being so alien i just feel so inferior to them all like they ve figured out how to be a whole person and i m just trailing after them stumbling along it s so much worse when i get to the level of friendship when we greet hello and goodbye with a hug or a dap i constantly fuck up somehow and create a super obvious awkward situation it s like my hand eye coordination and spatial awareness completely evaporate when i m nervous i m pretty open about my mental health with friends even new ones so we ve talked about anxiety depression cptsd etc even so i just keep wondering if they re as uncomfortable as i am if it s contagious i feel so guilty and frustrated i just want to have normal interactions and feel comfortable enough around people to build close loving friendships i really value meaningful deep connections and it feels so impossible to obtain when i m like this i don t know what the solution is but i wonder if i could just stop ruminating on my awkwardness then maybe it would stop the vicious cycle before my anxiety deepens does anyone relate

huge improvement after quitting nicotine hey all just wanted to share this with you as i ve come to a huge revelation and i can t quite believe what i m experiencing i ve had social anxiety since i was 10 11 and i m now 21 mostly stemming from self esteem issues at the root of it and also bad experiences at school hugely socially awkward get flustered and bright red when attention is on me in social situations internally feels like i m in a fight or flight response when trying to uphold a conversation with someone i m not fully comfortable with so basically everyone bar a few people but in the last few years since i ve grown into an adult i ve also gotten quite the knack for masking it to try and look atleast somewhat normal on the outside anyway i ve been a heavy nicotine user for around 4 years solid daily started off smoking then went to vaping then in the last month of my nicotine consumption i switched to zyns randomly on a whim i quit cold turkey 2 weeks ago and somehow managed to stick to it and my lord it s a completely new world to me i can still feel i have social anxiety but it feels genuinely 10x smaller and in the back of my mind quitting has genuinely transformed the state of my mental health my depression and lethargy have massively improved by the end of week 1 i was just walking around at my job absolutely buzzing with life just happy to be me i started looking after myself properly keeping my room tidy and keeping on top of laundry self hygiene better and i feel so much more confident my self esteem is through the roof not in a cheesy way but for the first time in a long time i ve held a positive image of myself in my mind for a sustained period that s the key to it for me i think the self esteem issues were a large root cause to my issues and for some reason quitting has helped that immensely so if you have social anxiety and were considering quitting nicotine please take this as your sign to quit i thought it would be wayyyyy harder than it is first few days it was all i could think about but after that it s pretty easy the main thing for me has just been identifying and calling out the random day to day cravings for what they are environmental factors from the past that trigger your mind into thinking it s nicotine time remind yourself of that and keep a negative image of nicotine in your mind when you think about smoking again etc and it s really manageable i know it s only been 2 weeks but this has genuinely changed my life just wanted to share and potentially inspire someone else to try it out

how does medication feel when it s helping social anxiety feel like i have some form of social anxiety alongside my adhd depression and some very mild autism i don t get any physical anxiety symptoms when talking to people or anything but i just always feel slightly awkward when talking to others part of it is because i feel like 80 of the time i m just not too invested in what the other person is saying and it feels like i m faking my reactions and responses all the time bc i don t really care about the topic i wish i did care about it but idk something there is just off for me i think part of it is just i care too much what others think and wish i could turn it off like a light switch but it just doesn t work that way after most conversations i always think i should have done this i should have made a joke i should have been more playful and lighthearted etc frustratingly the only thing i feel like that has helped me socially is alcohol it just makes me feel more sure of myself not feel as self conscious i m more outgoing and extroverted less serious and more talkative i feel like i know what to say to keep a conversation going it helps me truly not caring much about what other people think about me and i actually am generally 100 interested in what other people are talking which rarely happens sober it makes all the things i wish i could do during conversations just happen automatically it all becomes natural and easy like it should be the problem is i obviously can t rely on this in everyday life or for every social situation bc that s an easy road towards addiction i have tried a variety of antidepressants stimulants and anxiety medications for my mental health issues such as prozac zoloft auvelity wellbutrin ketamine therapy tms adderall vyvanse ritalin concerta intuniv strattera buspar metadate focalin dexedrine and more but none of them have had any real affect at all on my social anxiety let alone the way alcohol does i m not sure if maybe my expectations are just off about how medications are supposed to act on social anxiety but i always assumed they would be like the effects of drinking alcohol but instead of taking 30min to kick in it ll be 6 8 weeks for it to fully kick in obviously you wouldn t get the drunk everything is super fun and life is so wonderful feeling but i thought they would have the social benefits listed above or atleast some moderate noticeable change to any of those aspects maybe medications just didn t work for me but for those who take medication for your social anxiety how does it affect your social anxiety and what does it feel like is it just treating the physical anxiety symptoms that arise when in a social situation panic attacks nausea etc or is it like alcohol where it loosens you up everything is natural and is noticeable when it s working

i think my social anxiety is turning to paranoia just wanna see if anyone can relate i guess and what i could do about it it s been gradually getting worse i ve been growing more and more secretive especially around strangers and my online boyfriend whereas before i was an open book as an example there s a christmas thingy going on in a discord server i m in and they ask a question each day for us to socialise and share together today was the first question and it asks what our best christmas memory is the way i started thinking things like why do they need to know that i shouldn t share that it s none of their business what can they do with this information i should keep it secret i don t know why i just feel like i shouldn t share things like that like it s some sort of precious thing that i need to keep to myself and i m also scared of what all the random people in that server can potentially do with that information even though i can t really think of anything it s weird because even when i already had bad social anxiety i never had a problem with sharing things like that i actually loved talking about myself online because it was the only way to socialise that i had i miss it

presentation tips hi all this is kind of short notice but i d really appreciate some advice i ve been at college for a few years now but i have done my hardest to avoid doing presentations on my own due to my fear of speaking in front of people i m very quiet by default and have a pretty bad stutter when it comes to doing such thing but tomorrow i have a pitch presentation for my graphics class we had the options to do a video with a voiceover but i wanted to do my best to branch out and get out of my comfort zone for once especially because my pitch is something i m very interested in i m just super worried about fumbling and making a fool of myself in front of my class and also with a time limit tldr any tips for first time presenting alone as someone with terrible social anxiety anything helps many thanks : d

why am i so rude how do i stop i m spiraling please tell me if what i did is as bad as i think it was went to target by myself with the intention of buying something which is a big deal for me being that i hate checking out and am also really anxious when out by myself lucky for me the self checkout was dead when i got there anyway i chose to go to one of the self checkouts closer to the guy who was overseeing them and on my way there we made eye contact and he greeted me and said how are you i said im good and asked how he was back and then he casually went on to tell me that he was there until 8:30 and stuff like that i m not sure what to do when people actually start talking about themselves or anything like that when you ask how they are or if they just start talking about it even if you didn t ask anything lol asking how are you is just a courtesy thing to me like if i didn t ask it back i d be rude asf i also just feel uncomfortable speaking with strangers especially with other strangers around i ended up saying oh really wow and continued paying for my thingsi realized how terribly rude it sounded a second after saying it and wanted to die it was mostly cuz i just didn t know what to say and i was stressed about being in publicwhat made it worse was that he was handicap and seemed rlly sweet like he was just trying to chat cuz he was bored there cuz it was deadwhen i left i did smile and say thank you and he said have a good day and i said thanks you too not that it makes up for my dryness this isn t the first time i m rude to someone who tries to small talk either i just feel really uncomfortable and insecure talking to strangers and i think i put up my guard rlly quick this has been the hardest thing for me more so than actually going into places the whole thing made me want to stop trying exposure therapy all together cuz i felt like an asshole

how do you guys get yourself to be included again hi everyone i m new to this community on reddit and i was looking for some advice to give some background i moved to a new school in 8th grade and started high school in a super small town where everyone already knew eachother i struggled a lot making friends that want to actually get to know me outside of school but i did make one really good friend group last year one of my friends that had a crush on me i politely said i wanted to stay friends and he said he was fine with that got a new girlfriend i didn t care and i didn t know her that well but i always tried to include her she would always decline group hangouts turns out he thought i was trash talking his girlfriend when i was venting to my friend that i was sad he started ignoring me he sent me a really mean spirited text and when i responded with an apology he left me on delivered cut to this year my senior year he s suddenly back in the friend group despite blaming multiple of us for trash talking his relationship suddenly that entire friend group has been going to parties and hanging out without me it s weird to me that they wouldnt just call me and ask since indont have any classes with them this group has a history of stopping inviting people that did something wrong instead of confronting them i ve been really lonely this year and basically have no close friends i don t have any classes with the people i used to hangout with the loneliness has gotten really bad and i ve just been feeling worthless and hopeless i m scared to ask them about it or tell them that i m feeling left out i don t want to annoy them should i just ask if they re avoiding me should i just give up and accept that it s senior year and everyone doesn t need more friends

i feel like i just can t do this anymore social anxiety had ruined literally every aspect of my life not a single issue in my life can t be traced back to my social anxiety i have been missing classes in university which is a whole other issue on it s own i fell so behind on work and i just feel like the biggest idiot in the world oh this very simple class requires only a group presentation to pass oh well fuck me i can t even open my stupid mouth to another person gg i guess i heard this metaphor about a glass of water in a ted talk guy was talking that stress is like this glass of water if i hold it for 1 minute nothing much happens if i hold it for 10 minutes my hand will begin to tire but if i were to hold it for 8 hours my arm would go numb and i just resonate so much with that my entire life i have been carrying this rock on my back called social anxiety i don t have a single friend nobody to text nobody to hang out with i just feel like i m at my end i can t do this anymore worst part is i feel like nobody really knows what real social anxiety is they just think i m a little shy or stressed when meeting new people

do you hate it when people are clingy it was my second day at a new place i met this person who talked with me we had the same sessions with lunch in between i thought they would leave me alone and go off on their own wrong this person stuck to me like glue even through lunch i told them that they didn t have to hang out with me but they said it s fine and kept hanging out with me i didn t tell them to leave me alone because i thought they would leave me it was annoying i did go up to them i think after i went to check something but that s because i felt guilty if i felt like i ditched them i think i did then say they didn t have to hang out with me but they said it s fine and stuck to me i can t remember if they asked if they could stick with me but i might have said yes but only because i thought they would leave me after our next shared session they asked for my social media even though they only stuck with me for only like 4 hours edit : and before our final session i said again they didn t have to hang out with me i can t remember what they said but it was to the effect something like you don t want to hang out with me in a weird tone so i just let them stick with me it was only one day but still i never saw them two days after that it was a new big place and they were so clingy i got anxiety they were going to come looking for me i had no clue what to do if they did a relative told me if they say hi reply hi back and then leave them without a word anyway i left that place because it wasn t right for me the person was the the kind of person you never got at my old school so i wasn t used to that

how do you talk about yourself when you don t have experiences to talk about i m pretty socially anxious and have no real friends so i spend most of my time home alone on my way to school i was talking to the only person i would call my friend even though we don t hang out or anything and with him i can talk to normally and everything but then he asked me what s going on with me and i just couldn t answer it cause nothing s going on while he talks about how he got drunk with his friends or went to see a uni he s interested in i was at home doing nothing i have a lot of hobbies to fill my alone time with but i don t know how to talk about those cause i don t want to bore them with it especially if they have no interest in that hobby for example i draw a lot but i don t even know how i m supposed to talk about it i realized that this is probably the reason why we don t hang out or the reason why i can t make friends with anyone cause i can t talk about myself or the things i like they can t even get to know me cause i don t tell them anything about me can someone give advice or at least relate to what i m feeling

how to deal with intertia avoidance from social anxiety hi all i 22m have had pretty bad social anxiety for a while now i m currently getting a master s in social work ironic i know but my anxiety is making it really hard for me to do my internship because i m incredibly nervous when working with clients and i m always worried about crossing ethical boundaries to the point where i feel like i come off kind of cold and disconnected i feel like my social anxiety is sort of atypical though because usually i m actually really good at small talk and i can make friends but the thing is i only really talk to people when they talk to me the issues i have are in not being proactive socially for example i stay back when i see people needing help because i don t want to embarass myself or assume that i don t have the skills to help them which i know is incredibly selfish and something i need to work on i don t seek people out to make friends with them i kind of just wait until they come to me and i don t take risks because i assume i m going to fail i was in therapy for like 4 years and it didn t really make a dent honestly it kind of just got worse over time i ve really tried to live by the do it scared mantra but it s so much easier said than done i feel like i just live on autopilot and i m curious if anyone relates has any advice thanks in advance

f23 social anxiety today we had a drivers class where we have to sit for hours and listen basically and participate i went there all alone im 23 the rest were mostly boys in a group and 2 girls who knew each other i have social anxiety so this was really hard for me but i need a drivers license will need to see them 4 more times 2 hours at a time and i felt them all looking at me like not something i just imagined but they did and talked about me idk if good or bad but either way i felt perceived and so uncomfortable and at the end one of the guys said bye emma didn t talk to them at all during class and everyone looked at me idk their intentions or if they good or bad how can i go into next class feeling more confident or less anxious any advice

13 years of social anxiety hell: bullied isolated and my family won t let me get mental health help now 26 and terrified of starting a job i m 26 now and i feel like i ve completely given up on dealing with people i don t think i ll ever rebuild my social skills at this point they ve just been eroding away year after year i wanted to share my story here because maybe someone can relate or give advice it s a long one but i ll try to keep it organized tl dr at the bottom it all started when i was 13 and moved to a new school that s when my social anxiety really kicked in i never made any friends there at all instead i got bullied constantly which spiraled into deep depression and self hatred people in my class would joke that no one even knew i existed they even gave me the nickname walking dead the bullying and constant disrespect made everything worse and i struggled to form any connections it felt like i was invisible and it crushed me fast forward 13 years and at 26 i m still losing whatever social skills i had left i don t know how to interact with people anymore and it s terrifying every year i ve tried telling my mom how my social anxiety is fueling my depression and that i desperately need help like counseling or therapy but we re in a third world country where mental health is a huge taboo she s totally against it and fights me every time instead of addressing the real issue she blames it on my physical health problems i have eczema and asthma she d drag me to a pulmonologist for asthma or a dermatologist for eczema and tell them my mental problems are just side effects of those conditions which they re not she s done everything to block me from getting mental health support at 16 i convinced my dad to book a counselor appointment and basically force my mom to come along the counselor talked to me and suggested speaking with her but she ignored everything he said on the way home she trashed him calling him ugly and accusing him of manipulating me for money she never let me go back then at 17 i tried again she called all our relatives and they bombarded me with calls telling me not to pursue counseling in our culture respecting your mom s word is a big deal and i m a pretty agreeable person so i d always back down and try to fix it myself but i failed every single time as the years went on my depression got worse and so did my memory and concentration i d tell her about it and she d brush it off like oh i feel that sometimes too covid and our country s worst education system delayed things so i didn t start university until 21 my mom insisted i go to one near home no dorms or hostels because she was scared i d get distracted by other activities and ruin my studies even there making friends was impossible everyone else bonded in the hostels while i commuted alone i managed to sneak in a few counselor sessions on campus but my mom monitored my schedule obsessively asking where i was what classes i had so i missed a lot i got some medication for a few months but free meds weren t always available and my depression became uncontrollable somehow i barely scraped through and finished my degree but my memory is shot now at 26 things have hit rock bottom my depression has killed my sexual interest entirely with zero drive left when i told my mom she tried taking me to a urologist instead of a mental health pro she even argued with the doctor when he suggested seeing a psychologist recently after chatting with an ai i realized i might have inattentive adhd on top of everything which could explain the memory and focus issues i m planning to start a job next year but i m scared out of my mind how do i even function in a workplace like this i feel stuck and don t know what to do anymore has anyone dealt with family blocking mental health help especially in cultures where it s taboo any advice on building social skills as an adult or managing this without family support tl dr: social anxiety since 13 led to bullying isolation and depression family especially mom blocks all attempts at counseling due to cultural taboos now 26 depression worsening memory issues no sexual interest possible adhd terrified of starting a job need advice on getting help independently

life progress i suppose i was never a talkative person from the childhood i could cry beacuse of the need to talk with someone my mom even thought i have asd though i was never diagnosed with it there were no one to hear me no one to support me the world around me was so threatening that i d rather find reason not to talk with people ever i went nihilistic trying to make everyone around me a bigot by making the society hipocrytical i felt less need in socialising or so i thought with time i found the special person that i could be open she accepted me all of my strange things and i accepted her but she changed and so did i she felt like i have no place in her life anymore she ghosted me it was painful so painful that i got rejection trauma fueling my social anxiety even more time goes on i found a way to channel my feelings i started to write poems i shared it online i found friends the real ones it was painful journey but in the end i have someone with me so i don t feel so lonely anymore we all share the love for ttrpg though i haven t beaten my anxiety i get better yes i still can t make a phone call in my 21 but i can do things i couldn t for my entire life it is a slow journey sometimes even painful one i have no goal to go further but i still can so i do to everyone there who shares the same troubles i can feel you you are not alone

how to streamline thoughts with my functioning anxiety is inhibiting memory and coordination i m not sure i m using the right phrasing for this but i ll elaborate i ve had social anxiety since i was in 6th grade and whenever i get any amount of anxiety triggered over anything which is about 50 of the time my brain struggles to coherently function a wrench is thrown into tasks that are muscle memory even basic built in tasks like communicating become much harder to streamline : instead of inherently knowing what i want to say and verbalizing it in a streamlined fashion i struggle with hitting basic sentence beats and sometimes even remembering where in the conversation i m at and what im trying to explain this is just one example but it makes me hardly functional in a handful of things when i know im capable of performing those tasks i ve joked to my therapist that sometimes i wish i had a lobotomy so that the buffer between overthinking and actions is eliminated basically that meme of no thoughts head empty except i mean it literally if my ruminating overthinking compounding thoughts didn t exist i could just do basic tasks like every other person can i don t even know if other people with anxiety and social anxiety are this bad at functioning sometimes im so dysfunctional i genuinely think i have damage to my brain because there s no way someone consistently and constantly forgets how to verbalize properly right basically my question is: does anybody experience this and how do you stop the wrench from being thrown in are there any specific medications or combination of things that have worked for anybody else when it comes to how memory coordination and anxiety interact a little more context: i ve been on lexapro for a few years started buspirone at the beginning of the year and am juggling adhd meds which are a more recent thing lexapro has definitely improved the streamlining by a little bit but i m still having constant difficulties

story time hated for being socially anxious i m coming to the realization of how easily socially anxious or shy people are labeled as rude dismissive or cold just because we re quiet loud people are seen as confident and the quietest people are seen as a problem because we don t preform how society wants us to i m wondering if anybody has experienced something like this i m an arotc ms3 and in my school s program at the end of the semester we do peer evaluations you rank everyone in the class from best to worst based on their overall performance attitude as a cadet and write comments about your top 3 and bottom 3 explaining why you ranked them there i m a very reserved quiet and socially anxious person it takes a lot for me to open up to people i ve managed to make some friends non the less because i try to be as helpful caring and empathetic as i can to everyone the people i ve personally talked to said they ranked me high in the peer evaluations i ve had people tell me very nice things such as they trust me and they look up to me as a cadet i assumed i would rank around in the middle because i m quiet and don t know a lot of people but the people who do know me really seem to like me i was correct i ranked 28 57 exactly in the middle i was happy about that until we moved onto the comments i had one bad comment my jaw dropped as i was read a paragraph of the most detailed and personal attack on my character and existence as a human they said when people talk to me i m dismissive rude hostile and that i create tension for no reason i was in such disbelief that i literally couldn t speak it took me a few minutes just to process what i had heard and i kept trying to think of any reason someone would write something so hateful about me i eventually came to the realization that a lot of people see shy and reserved people dismissive it doesn t help that my voice is also very monotone i wish i wasn t like this but i can t help it this is who i am my theory is that this was not written by somebody who truly knows me i just find it so interesting how differently people can perceive the same interactions there is not one person in the entire program that i have disliked felt annoyed by or ever thought negatively of knowing that there s somebody in my class who hates my guts makes me so sad i really want to figure out who it is just to prove to them that i m a nice person anyways that s my story i m curious if anybody else has had strange hatreds misconceptions about them just because they are quiet great end the the semester

is this about rejection or something else this weekend i posted in a discord server that i was a little bummed and disillusioned because i didn t get a response i had been hoping for to something i made and that i was less sure about doing something else because of that i was hoping for comfort and encouragement from other members but i was nervous because it felt vulnerable so i stayed away from the server for a few hours to distract myself when i finally looked the first response to me made it sound like i was acting entitled by being sad i felt like i was being publicly shamed i made a defensive reply didn t read anything else people had said and muted the server i haven t been able to look at it since for all i know that was the only jerk but i needed to calm myself down and now it s been so long i feel it would be disruptive to respond to anyone else even to thank them for kind words because the way discord works would drag the convo to the forefront again but also maybe other people thought there was something wrong with me being a little bummed too it s a shame because while i didn t have friends on the server and it always seemed a little cliquey i thought of it as a place with kindred spirits and now i ve cut myself off from it i feel like this is typical behavior for me i just don t know if i should be looking for advice on dealing with shame rejection or just general social anxiety

my social anxiety at present so i thought i d give an update on my situation just see if anyone feels similar or can relate as at the moment even i m not sure how to proceed moving forwards or process things for context i was on citalopram for 6 weeks then came off it kind of cold turkey it s been about 2 3 since that so last night i ventured out to see my friend at the pub we had a good catch up i was mostly fine ish i enjoyed chatting felt fairly comfortable however he had to leave earlier than me as he was driving back to wales i stayed on my own to finish my drink that s where my anxiety shows reminds me i definitely have it so i tend to just feel a bit awkward wooden almost like a spare part so to speak i say to myself over over just relax chill out enjoy your own company but it is always a challenge i went to order another drink from the bar even doing that i felt off i eventually drove home found myself super tired even though i only woke up that day around 2pm it s all such a surreal feeling on one hand i m grateful that i m able to get out meet a friend etc but on the other hand i know i ve completely got an social anxiety problem it affects my whole being my personality confidence everything i m not able to just enjoy being present anymore always feel a bit awkward i don t know if other people even realise it but in my own head it s 100 an ongoing problem can other people relate

body shaking experiences hi i don t speak english so i m sorry for any spelling mistakes i m 24 years old and i ve suffered from social anxiety since childhood i receive a disability pension and i work at a reception desk so financially i m taken care of but i don t want this to be the end of everything i want to get treatment and move forward however more than the fear of human interaction itself i m terrified of something else a thousand times more: that i will start shaking my hands head legs my whole body it limits me so much it s hell for example when i go to the cinema i can t even buy popcorn because i shake so much when paying in general paying for things is my nightmare when i m in the kitchen and someone comes in who watches or judges what i m cooking or baking i start shaking too the same happens when i count money at work visiting the dentist is also a nightmare i can t even drink from the cup to rinse my mouth four days ago i started taking 50 mg of sertraline i d like to try therapy eventually but later because christmas and the dentist are expensive and at the moment i wouldn t be able to save anything if i started therapy too i just want to know if any of you have personal experience with reducing body tremors or even getting rid of them completely it s truly destroying my whole life the worst part of all this is that i actually have potential i m really capable and i want to work but the shaking has prevented me from doing many jobs my general practitioner refused to prescribe propranolol because of my low blood pressure : i also have to add that i shake even in front of my friends my own grandfather my brother even though they re family but for some reason my brain sees everyone as a predator thank you for reading and for any advice you might have

i walked away from my bf and his family because i felt excluded my boyfriend asked me to come with him to see a cousin of his at college their culture is very close and social and he asked me multiple times to come i told him i didn t want to but because he asked and i was trying to beat back against social anxiety i decided to go i was very extremely nervous and those negative thoughts of rejection tried taking over but i fought against them i made myself envision the best be ready to be open and show interest in her and the dynamic my bf told me that they would speak english so i didn t feel excluded and that made me feel better however those two spoke 90 95 of the time in their language although they re both fluent in english and i don t understand pretty much any of their language it s a very difficult language spoken by one country of a few million people not well known i still walked with them though and hoped for the best my bf tried to include me in the convo and when i answered his cousin just gave a little throwaway comment to appease the contribution it seemed like it wasn t really something relevant or that she had or cared to have a response to and proceeded to speak in their language with my bf again i was trying to walk in line with them but my bf and his cousin did the infamous 3rd wheeler treatment of walking in front of me while i ended up following them and trying to get back in the line when his cousin saw her english speaking friends though she immediately went to speaking english with them i looked at my bf and he was smiling and looked happy his cousin and her friends appeared happy and i just felt rejected again like i failed again so i asked him for his car key he was still smiling and focusing on the scene unfolding and said we were all going to the car i asked him two more times for the key and he gave it to me completely engaged with the social stuff i sat in the car the remainder of the time he texted asking me to please come with them and that his cousin s bf was coming with them was an english speaker and and they would speak english i respectfully declined told him i was talking with family and to enjoy himself and take his time i fought back tears in the car and wiped them when they came back about 30 minutes or more later he asked me why i was angry and i tried not to answer and just said i was glad he enjoyed the visit he kept pressing for an answer so i broke down and told him how it felt he was trying to be understanding but said that it was disrespectful to him and that they basically did the same thing with his cousin s bf he said his cousin was asking where i went i m concerned i may have overreacted or been selfish about the whole thing i just feel bad that i made a huge effort felt excluded and when he told me he was too shy to meet my family on this very same day i didn t pressure or ask him to i think i have an additional problem with unconsciously expecting people to be as kind and inclusive as i would make an effort to be with people so they never feel how i felt in that situation but i rarely get the same treatment by others was i wrong or my vision warped

some of my best tips advice to help overcome social anxiety as someone whos dealt with it severely im not here to sell anything i just wanna help whoever i can first some backstory when i was maybe 11 13 i was so quiet and anxious id often struggle to talk above a whisper as in physically id have one best friend who i would whisper everything to i could barely even answer my name on the roll call and more times than i can count someone else had to point me out to the teacher or answer for me now at 18 i can go anywhere talk to anyone i talk to people i like people i think seem cool bartenders servers hosts of events people ive never met before i can politely ask for a messed up drink order to be fixed i can talk into a microphone in front of a bar full of people people semi regularly comment on how they envy that i can talk to anyone and not get nervous and here are some things that helped me: 1 think of some people who really shouldnt be talking but they do anyway maybe its a coworker whos just always being rude to people and to top it off they speak at 5x a normal volume and dont stop talking and make it everyone elses problem you have to listen to them so you know what you can make them and whoever else listen to you too because youll still be more decent than them and have much more useful things to say and even if other people dont agree its really your own opinion that matters to a degree 2 back yourself no one else can speak for you and you deserve support that only truly comes from yourself even if you have someone in your life who sometimes does it life is unpredictable and its so important you can advocate for yourself it will improve your life so much 3 nothing really matters that much any one person s experience is ultimately irrelevant not in a mean way in a comforting way of course its not good for you to be upset or something but at the end of the day if someones rude or rejects you or disagrees with you or finds something you say weird there are like 8 billion people on earth and it wont cause any major catastrophes or leave any real impact in time even if it hurts its not the end of the world 4 if you do accidentally embarrass yourself somehow and it spikes your social anxiety think of how much worse it couldve been to frame it if you accidentally knock over a drink like i did the other day fix it up and then think hey at least i didnt set the whole bar on fire it seems silly but it gives perspective to something that seems catastrophic and makes you realise even if its not ideal its also not completely terrible 5 learn to assume people will like you and dont bother with people who dont this one takes a while and builds over time as you see more people who like you but it gets to a point where if youve started chatting to 6 people at an event and they all get along well with you and then one person gives you a weird look youll be able to think wow whats their problem everyone likes me and then shrug it off and find people you get along with 6 think worst case scenario unless someones physically dangerous in some way really usually the most someone can do is be rude or unpleasant which sucks but then you just ignore them and try your best to carry on you need to remind yourself that even though not ideal you can survive an unpleasant interaction also youd probably be surprised by the amount of people who are decent its easy to think things will go badly and then if you just never try you ll keep believing things will often go badly when in actuality it ll probably often be fine hope these help someone even a bit and if anyone has any questions just let me know and i ll try answer them

to the stranger who eased my social anxiety i am a highschool student currently taking steps to signing up to universities abroad so a few months ago i had to take an ielts test i forgot my passport which was required which made me lose a lot of money for the test i missed my mom scolded me in front of the other candidates in the room the announcement echoed throughout the building and everyone left to take the test my mom quickly followed after grumbling as she left the building humiliated i stood outside the english center alone leaning against the wall while trying to calm myself it was soon after that a middle aged man approached me he was smoking too near and i hated cigarettes but i put up with it because i didn t want to come off as unfriendly he asked me what happened and i explained he told me he was the father of one of the candidates and that his son was going to apply for a scholarship abroad i replied i was on the same boat and for the first time i managed to throw back words normally to a complete stranger we had a nice conversation where he told me about his stories of working abroad it made me realise was this really what i was afraid of this whole time i am perfectly fine on my own after all i needed no friend to speak on behalf of me the next days i tried quipping in some words with strangers what made you start a juice business to the lady who owned the orange juice stand i often bought from your dog is so cute what s his name to my neighbor who walked the dog often what books do you like reading to the kid hanging in the public library i still hesitate to speak sometimes but exposure therapy worked way better than expected starting it may be like a leap of bravery but man does it only get better so thank you to the man who approached me whoever your name is what seemed like a normal conversation to you that you probably forgot the next day already was a push for me to take the leap

i don t want friends this might just be a vent post lmao apologies in advance if i sound like i m just complaining i am m17 almost turning 18 and have no driver s license job or friends 2 years ago i developed paranoia that inhibits me from forming relationships i do not want people to get close to me i am afraid of rejection so ultimately i avoid trying to connect altogether the process of making friends is physically demanding and requires emotional stability a bit of charisma can go a long way but i am not charismatic for me actually trying ends in unnecessary tension awkwardness and discomfort for both people and i realize that this is self sabotaging because i tend to withdraw if i feel like i m imposing on an established friend group when i haven t been invited they see that i m guarded because i anticipate rejection and they understandably distance themselves from me it is much easier to isolate yourself from others when all you ve received is judgment and condescension i recognize this is a very pessimistic way of thinking about it a bit cringey but there is no incentive for me to make friends when my social anxiety was at its worst i would never talk to people when i m socializing i m so embarrassingly awkward that it makes it impossible for someone to like me plus not getting along with a person damages my reputation and theirs because if they do decide to projecting food for thought but why would they want to talk to you it s not like you re the only person millions of people are secure and capable of maintaining a healthy relationship that will uplift both parties on one hand i want connection but i m scared that the person i am friends with will only like me conditionally

trying to overcome my final boss of social anxiety: dancing in public i ve had really bad social anxiety my whole life and i ve made a lot of progress i ve been able to go to concerts huge wrestling events and my career requires me to be social the final boss for me has always been dancing even when i was on dance or cheer teams when i was younger that part was always really difficult i used to think part of the problem was the genres of music i was trying to dance to i went to a club once and while everyone else was dancing i just felt frozen and awkward if i tried to do a dance move it would barely last two seconds because it felt so unnatural maybe it was the newer hip hop music they weren t the songs i felt comfortable moving to i think dancing to older hip hop r b latin or house genres might be easier for me but honestly it could just be that it was in public recently i ve been fascinated by people who can just dance in clubs or open spaces and i started thinking about what it would be like to do that at i have a concert coming up with a house music dj set so i started watching videos from soulection zack fox sets etc to see how people at those today i got up and started emulating what i saw my brain is very technical so i can t just move to the music i need to see what it looks like to understand it and honestly it was so fun i got a good workout and it actually brought me joy i think i might start doing this regularly i just kind of wanted to share this but if anyone has any advice by any chance i d love to hear it maybe this is my final boss but maybe it s easier for somebody else out there

venting advices are appreciated i am a 25 female i have been battling with depression social anxiety and anxiety all my life ever since i can remember i don t believe i was a happy child i always wanted to be social and to have a free soul i feel like that s what i am hiding under all my insecurities and problems as a teenager i always thought i would get over this mindset that i have but it never happened i went to therapy doctors and i got advice from people nothing worked i am still in therapy i thought i was seeing the silver lining at the end but after a while i am back in this shit place i tried everything i tried to be active have a healthy life i did yoga i went to the gym i meditated i ate clean i won t lie the healthy life actually made me feel better but i could never get the pressure on my chest out it s always there before i started my healing journey i thought that pressure on my chest was guilt i thought i was experiencing guilt about being alive doing what i wanted to do it always felt like i needed to be living according to other people s rules i became bitter and jealous of those who had free souls i hated pretty women i hated my face i hated everything about myself i hated how i acted how i walked how i moved i hated that i hated myself i became insecure about people knowing my secret that i hated myself i wanted to seem confident care free happy just like i always imagined i ve been in relationships where people took advantage of me i wasn t treated right but i stayed because i felt like i was a half life without a person i became addicted to sharing my life with someone and that person protecting me against all the evil of the world i knew it wasn t realistic i just hoped because it was easier than healing i let myself go started doing drugs and become severely underweight started smoking going to parties and being someone that i wasn t i just wanted to fit in i just wanted to feel how real peace felt i abused drugs so much that it started becoming a problem i left my boyfriend and his friends it was the most toxic environment for me and i lived in it for a year then i started my healing journey gained weight stopped drugs started the gym and painting i met a guy online he was different from everybody else i immediately felt that we had a soul tie i believed we were meant together he drained me i just wanted to stay with him i wanted to be with him and get married to him so i stayed whatever he did i kept seeing him i blamed myself for every argument we had for some reason he wasn t leaving me as well he was constantly mad at me and became really manipulative he didn t leave until one day that s when i learned he was in a relationship the whole time even though it felt like hell for a few months after he left i felt so light afterwards i started working hard so that i could study abroad i believed it was going to solve all my problems the funny thing is that i always did the same thing i changed schools a few times i wanted to be in a new place because i believed that i was going to forget everything and start clean when i came to a whole new different country for my studies i felt this adrenaline i was hungry to meet people have conversations i couldn t believe what was happening i wasn t overthinking about my interactions i didn t have anxiety i was so happy to be in a new country a fresh white clean page i met my now boyfriend he is thoughtful amazing the best thing i could ask for he cares for me and loves me but after a while i started being so insecure again i believed i didn t deserve him and i wasn t enough for him i started feeling like an ugly girlfriend next to a very handsome man i started to struggle at school i became so overwhelmed that it paralyzed me i couldn t do anything the stress of being in a new country and trying to settle made me feel even worse i was just existing at this point i started feeling disconnected from myself i stopped seeing the new friends that i made i felt more and more insecure as people and my boyfriend got to know me better as it made me feel more vulnerable i wanted to take a step back and i did take a step back from friendships but i felt too attached to my boyfriend again feeling like i couldn t breathe or do anything without him i knew that was a problem i constantly talked about my attachment issues with my therapist but i am a bystander in my life i watch as things happen because my fears outweigh my reason i let them control me now i feel defeated i am opening up to my boyfriend a lot more but i am terrified of him seeing the actual me which is this ugly insecure girl i am in the cycle of self sabotaging again i know it and feel it coming stronger but i am paralyzed i don t know what to do i am so tired of living the fact that i will never unalive myself makes me feel more stuck i can t believe i have to live through this i feel so defeated i am in an lovely country have an amazing boyfriend in a major that i like i have a roof over my head i am healthy and able bodied i have a supportive family i can feed myself as ungrateful as it is i am not happy and i feel like i will never be truly happy what is happiness you might ask i don t expect anything crazy i just want to be confident in myself and be grateful for what i have i don t know how i don t know if there s any cure solution or anything that i already don t know but if you have anything to say i d appreciate it thank you for reading if you made it here

social anxiety has lessened significantly i hope this can help some of you i ve had social anxiety my whole life i even remember having it as a toddler i m 31 now i started getting better earlier l this year with tms therapy although my social anxiety was not gone i felt a shift then i was finally diagnosed with bipolar ii i was given lamictal 3 months ago and the non stop noise in my head has lessened significantly i don t maladaptive day dream or talk to myself as much as i did before i don t feel that impending doom feeling anymore paranoia and the intense feeling of being constantly analyzed by others has greatly lessened i m more present in conversations with my coworkers i feel so much happier and accepting of myself than ever before in my life i still feel some social anxiety but no where near as bad i do feel like i will need to up my dose eventually but even at 50mg my social anxiety has been so much more manageable i hope that one day it can completely go away i m 31 and it baffles me that i lived with this intense anxiety for 31 years this year has been life changing

i cant make friends unless i am high im 19m and seven years ago i lost all my friends and never made any so i have been completely alone since middle school it has been really difficult and one of the main sources of my depression i only started getting help six months ago and it hasnt been very helpful my biggest issue is that im really private easily embarrassed and just struggle to talk in general so while people like me they dont know me and so i never make friends but what has been helpful is getting high on 7oh a kratom product that is basically an opioid i have found that when i am high on it i am very talkative and easily make jokes and overall enjoy socialization a lot more the problem is that ive become dependent on it ive been at my current job for a few months and ive been able to get close to my coworkers faster and easier than ever before because i get high every shift i am so close to making the first friends i have had in seven years so far only one guy has noticed but it is risky ill lose my job if caught and there have been days when i took too much and had to put a lot of effort to not nod while working or look visibly high ive also overdosed twice which was scary and ive only been doing it for a few months i dont want to go on medication because of my political views and values im nervous about losing my job but i so badly want friends and i just cant talk while sober im getting help but it isnt really working and nothing i have ever done before helped with my social anxiety

it s exhausting that society expects us to be chatty especially in the office sure there are some quiet people but most are chatting away more than they are actually doing the work they re supposed to i didn t really get how some of them would just do it everyday with 100 energy all the time and i really need to get a promotion especially in this economy so i bit the bullet and asked one of the most social ones guy called james how he did it what he said was pretty shocking turns out the guy was actually sent to a neurodivergent school when he was younger because he was so quiet and shy he said that when he was 18 he tried to speak out loud for 30 mins a day in order to deepen his voice it didn t work but he found a strange side effect that he could now talk to people better he said practices for an hour every single day if he doesn t for a week or so his conversation ability and confidence go down i tried doing this recently seen some early success so i just wanted to let you guys know about this to see if this would help you also btw i m creating a small group for some people on reddit i met to practice with this and share experiences if anyone wants to join us feel free to send me a direct message chat :

fundraising street sales is like therapy that pays you it s so great i wish i did this 10 years ago i m 32 now i actually interviewed for a fundraising job 10 years ago but it was a large group interview where we had to pitch in front of lots of people and i was scared as hell and stumbled completely my anxiety won and made me look a fool fast forward to 3 months ago my misery reaching peak after being rejected for being nervous on a date i was totally fed up with myself i was tired of being a mouse and hiding my true self to people i started going to the gym eating right going outside more then found the courage to join a local charity to fundraise it was smaller group session this was manageable for me i got the job barely then the first week came i got a sign up literally the first person that i stopped by complete beginners luck after that nothing just fear of approaching people but 1 on 1 conversations weren t that bad especially if i could hide behind the easy pitch so i got like 8 over next 3 weeks during this time not much changed i gained a little confidence but as i said i hid behind a pitch but then 1 day i was feeling a bit more merry i was happy about life and the present moment so i decided to let loose spontaneously and i became literally the most charismatic version of me i ve ever witnessed like i was magnetic for 1 hour and i felt free in the world for the rare few times since childhood i had wanted to quit 10 before this day but something kept telling me to push on this charasmatic day was not replicated the second day hell it only came back to me in about a week back to my old patterns of thought and hiding behind the shell but the gap between those free days has been getting shorter and shorter ever since like my brain is learning that people aren t scary anymore i m at about 50 50 days when i m confident days when i m not in my new fundraising gig when working with very charismatic confident people i still notice i hide myself like i m intimidated by what they think but i keep letting loose i keep forcing myself to focus on my validation and not others and it s fucking working bit by bit i literally can t wait to go back into work now it s so thrilling growing socially and becoming more confident the job becomes like a drug like a life changing therapy that you get paid to do i recommend anyone doing it if they can and if not build yourself up to do it social anxiety is about not being proud of yourself enough to be vulnerable in front of others to show your true authentic self learn to respect a little thing about yourself could be changing your diet going gym etc then try fundraising maybe for a day a week volunteering but it s key you keep at it the trouble with social anxiety it takes time to change ask yourself honestly are you progressing fast enough how much time do we have left

why strangers are sometimes easier to talk to than friends the paradox of stranger intimacy many people find it easier to share deep feelings with strangers than with those closest to them this isn t a flaw in your relationships it s human nature the weight of history existing relationships come with context friends and family know your past your patterns your usual self this history can feel constraining when you re struggling with something new or out of character fear of changing the dynamic revealing struggles to people in your life risks altering how they see you will they still respect you will they worry too much will it burden them these concerns create barriers to honest communication the clean slate effect strangers offer a fresh perspective without baggage they judge you only on what you share in that moment not colored by years of accumulated impressions no stakes no pressure there s freedom in knowing you ll never see someone again you can be completely honest without worrying about ongoing consequences or awkward future encounters professional distance the slight formality of stranger interaction can actually make vulnerability easier it s like therapy the structured distance creates safety for emotional exploration unbiased listening friends may have their own agendas or opinions about your situation strangers can offer a neutral ear without the complications of invested interest the gift of anonymity anonymous communication takes this further without even the social dance of introduction and small talk you can dive straight into what matters breaking the isolation sometimes we just need to say things out loud or write them down to someone anyone strangers fulfill this need without the emotional complexity of close relationships understanding why strangers feel safe doesn t mean your close relationships are lacking it means recognizing that different connections serve different needs both matter
