i did something i m extremely terrified of doing so as someone with social anxiety my biggest nightmare is presentations i did them a whole lot in highschool but unlike some people say i never got used to it or anything it was always the same crippling anxiety all over again and sometimes i got physically sick over it when i got to college my fear of doing them was so much worse that i just didn t do it and of course i failed my classes but today i decided i had to do it it wasn t super complicated so i decided i could do it let me just say it went terribly when i went to sit back down i overheard some people making fun of me wich made me feel worse but i m still proud of myself because this is such a scary thing for me and i somehow managed to get out of the house and face my fears unfortunately i have more presentations coming up and because this one went so bad i m still as scared as before if not more but the whole point is that i did it so i think that counts for something i guess i just wanted to share this with people who understand how big of a deal this is everyone else would just think i m silly for dramatizing it :

living with social anxiety feels like carrying an invisible weight there was once a time when i thought that social anxiety just meant being shy or awkward in social situations however i now see that social anxiety is much more complicated and difficult to manage than that social anxiety means standing at the entrance to a room filled with people while your chest feels tight you want to speak but cannot get the words out of your mouth you can replay everything you said hours after the fact over and over wondering if what you said was weird you are constantly either avoiding phone calls canceling plans and then feeling guilty about spending time alone because you want to connect but panic when you re trying to make that connection ever happen to me the worst part of having social anxiety wasn t the panic attacks but the feeling of being an observer instead of living your life i ve been tackling from different angles and ways i keep rack of my anxiety symptoms practicing my breathing techniques and writing down everything i think of throughout the day have given me small victories all those small victories have led to me making progress toward overcoming my social anxiety

what s the deal with me this is a long story so hear me out: there was a time in my life where i was social and thought i finally belonged somewhere my high school class before i never really felt truly in a community but having genuine fun with them and rediscovering the joy of interacting with people but i was still closed off and introverted then last year after failing at handling having a crush i decided: screw it i wanna come out to some people and i want him to know i like him eventually 2 people the whole class knew then and spread the rumor around however those days felt like i was free those days even if that happened were the best for me i was getting really active talking to people moved by excitement i said merry xmas to them talked to them about about my personal issues stuff i wasn t doing with anybody before then something felt off inside i thought that they were taking advantage of me and i blamed it on them on not setting boundaries and that feeling of energy rush being around people left i hated myself and my way of communicating now after a year i m scared to have autism to be different and when i talk i never say something personal about me i dunno if it s because i fear the past or whatever but there s always a context in which i think: if i say this people will react negatively example from today: i thought about coming up to the group i usually hang around in and casually start with: hey guys do you watch tv series i recently started hazbin hotel and damn it s good when there s a slight moment of silence and i don t speak over others then something pulled me off: don t creeps start up at people like that i thought screw it but i was left with a bitter taste in my mouth so i awkwardly stood there without saying a word until i went back to my seat and minded my own business it s stuff like that how can i break free from this constant pressure on me

getting rid of social anxiety shifting your mindset about it is the first step to live the life you want anxiety is not the enemy it s like an overprotective but well meaning friend confidence is built through experience not something you re born with shifting attention outward instead of inward is key to managing anxiety your brain is not broken social anxiety amplifies perceived threats making neutral situations feel high stakes confidence isn t no fear it s learning how to act even when afraid hope this was helpful

nervous laughter i deal with this 1 2 times per month where when my social anxiety is bad i ll give a bit of a nervous laugh to someone instead of answering them back if i m just passing by them rather than being in a full blown conversation it happens on occasion when i don t hear what they said and i know they re expecting a response it s like some sort of reflex and then i feel embarrassed and also then worry about potentially offending them once it happens it also happened recently while walking a dog i was pet sitting the person opened up their arms when they saw the dog i was walking so i started to anticipate social interaction i expected the person to greet the dog because i figured they must know her or at the least would probably say she s cute or something well they said good afternoon and instead of saying anything back i gave a little nervous laugh and kept walking now i am embarrassed and i am also worried they will either think i m weird or rude for laughing at them for no reason or else they ll think i think they re weird for no reason i was tired i was also anticipating something different to happen during the social interaction them greeting the dog i thought they must either know the dog or must think she s cute i think that is why i got nervous because i expected something else and was also real tired social anxiety makes no sense and now the person must think i m either weird or rude there was no reason for me to nervously laugh the person didn t do anything weird it was all because i was tired and was expecting a different social interaction this has happened a couple times when i ve passed someone and didn t hear what they said the pressure of having to respond but having no response feeling awkward for missing what they said equals me giving a bit of a nervous laugh and continuing my walk this happens only a couple of times a month but i hate the idea of people being possibly offended by it it s only a bit of a nervous laugh maybe the thing with the dog had something to do with the pressure of having to respond quickly as i was passing the person too since i expected the attention to be on the dog and not me i didn t have a response at the ready

customer complained that my text about holiday closure wasn t nice enough i sent a routine text through the safe customer portal that the office will be closed next week for the holiday and can we reschedule their appointment it wasnt nice or mean just concise to the point to transmit info customer sent a reply that im unprofessional and ive disrespected them i sent a reply back profusely apologizing that we dont mean to offend anyone but wanted to keep them informed etc he replied too late and then called screamed at me that the manager better call him back because he has words for her and he will no longer be communicating with me only through her then i called him back and put the manager on the phone and he told her the message wasnt flowery enough and i guess was trying to get me written up seriously my worst nightmare i cant figure out what ive done wrong here and its ruined my day ive been in customer service so long maybe my communication has become robotic but im not sure how i could have offended someone with a simple text i definitely wasnt disrespectful i feel like you cant be too nice and you cant be too defensive for yourself so ive ended up speaking by script all you can do is your job and take the attitude from customers idk why they think screaming and yelling will get kindness from me im dreading when he comes in now my job is my lifeline and i cant figure out why someone would wish to write me up over a routine text

losing all my friends every time first a little back story since its rly eating at me when i first started college i thought i was doing pretty good meeting new people partying a little etc was going great then i noticed whenever there was a group converastion grooup anything i was always on the side noone ever directly talked to me asked me anything aproached me to talk nothing so i backed away cause why bother with people who dont care i can take a hint when to leave people alone at least i still thought i had one guy who i was vibing with so yeah fortunatley i was planing to change majors anyway so maybe new start and stuff again same thing i thought i was doing good got into a group of friends was going great through most of the second semester through summer break the group chat went kinda quiet but fair since everyone was bussy with thier own stuff when we came back i actually noticed the same thing noone cared i asked what they did during the summer noone asked me later whenever we met before class or hung out im just standing there maybe sometimes chime in smth other than that nothing i thought maybe i will hit up that one bro from the previous major i write to him if u guys are planing anything or smth hit me up said sure and nothing its been weeks i am geniually so hurt i might go back to what i swore i would never do again become a shut in loser but i think this world just doesnt want me i geniually dont know what im doing to anyone i am a little akward when anxious since social anxiety but thats it im not autsitic 90 chance no im not an asshole im not unhygienic or smth what is wrong with me i hate this

that time of the year company s christmas party in december i will attend my company s christmas party and i ve been anxious on and off about it since they first announced it 1 month ago i ve been at this job for around one year but i work remotely so i ve never met anyone of my colleagues i don t know if they have all met but they have certainly been working together for a long long time and some of them seem to be very close i especially dread the idea of showing up there at the venue not knowing if my teammates are already there not knowing anybody else and being completely incapable of starting a conversation i know it s just a party and if i have a good time great and if i don t it s not the end of the world but it s so exhausting being constantly anxious about these things i don t usually find myself having to go out of my comfort zone that much so when i do i try to take the chance to challenge myself a little bit also i must say that while working remotely is amazing it definitely doesn t help my social skills also this thing will last from 7pm to 1am who even wants to stay that long do you think it would be acceptable to just stay a few hours and then go i know i need to just see things from a different perspective but it s so difficult at times i m still thinking about a last minute excuse i already feel overwhelmed i wouldn t go but it appears to me you are quite encouraged to participate to these sort of things so i feel like i should show up at least this time and maybe skip the nexts

magnesium supplement hey i just wanted to let people know i started taking a magnesium supplement about a week ago and it is definitely helping with my mood and anxiety in general i am sweating less and don t feel as stressed about everything it s kind of funny because i only started taking it because my gf has a jar of magnesium gummies in her kitchen and they have a lot of sugar so i started munching on them every day it feels about the same to me as taking zoloft maybe a bit better i m a bit sad and frustrated when i think about how i could have started taking it a long time ago and it would have saved me from literally decades of suffering but i try not to focus about that part anyway it may not work like this for everyone but it is cheap and worth a try if not magnesium maybe another vitamin or mineral can help

rehearsed responses screwing you over anyone else deal with this i had to say good morning like every five minutes to customers while i worked in retail in the early morning so my automatic response to being greeted was good morning i just got out of the habit a year ago of doing that and i haven t worked there for years but for the longest time at 9 at night i d accidentally greet someone back with a good morning just because it was a rehearsed response i would do the same thing when i worked nights in retail say good evening or have a good night till i had the good morning rehearsed i quit that job while working mornings so that s what has stuck with me since till about a year ago but i still do it on occasion i ve noticed i m not the only one who has done this while having a job where the automatic response is good morning or have a good night i think most people understand but i still feel awkward i ve done this with a multitude of rehearsed responses now i m trying to slowly wean myself off of using rehearsed responses as my social anxiety decreases since i need them a little less i ended up moving to the state i would visit for years and an automatic response to where i was visiting would always be this state i am living in now when i lived elsewhere well i was tired the one day and told them i was visiting the state i live in now because this is the state i d always be visiting in the past i laughed and explained it was just my automatic response since i haven t lived here all that long in my defense i was real tired that day

i don t understand why i m constantly being excluded is it my fault at this point hi i need some advice sorry if this comes across like a sob story i just need another perspective i recently joined a new school along with a classmate that i was friends with at the beginning of the term most people from the school were decent and friendly to me and were clearly interested in talking to me too and i managed to make a small amount of friends fast forward to now people who were friendly generally treat me like hot air for example with the classmate i talked about we ll have one on one conversations sometimes but if we re in a big group she often pretend i don t exist generally now i get ignored and often excluded and i think people who i don t know me make me the butt of their jokes also i think that it s too late for me to try and make new friends i know that my social anxiety and personality is probably off putting and that i probably have many problems about myself that i don t even realise but i ve been in this exact situation so many times that there must be something wrong with me the worst part is that when i feel like my friends actually care about me and invite me to stuff i temporarily get happy and feel like i m not alone and that i don t have to worry anymore about it but the moment they drop me again i sink and spiral again and feel low i ve tried to convince myself that i m ok with being alone but i don t think i ll make it through 2 years of school like this tldr: joined a new school where most people were friendly at first but suddenly starting getting awkward and cold around me this situation has happened more than once so this has to be my fault at this point

i m terrified of casual social environments but perfectly fine in any others anyone experince something similar i m confused i have always had issues with my social skills and i ve always put work into fixing them right now i think i do great at many social environments recently i ve participated in a couple of job fairs where i interviewed with companies and spoke to recruiters for hours i also participated in a hackathon where we were put in teams with complete strangers and did perfectly fine i even was the spokeperson for the team and presented a pitch deck in front of hundreds of people i ve spent almost 8 years in a theatre club i ve done impro writing classes worked in different teams as a leader and team coordinator talking to everyone and i ve done completely fine and had lots of fun these events are pure adrenaline to me but for some reason i completely panic at the though of any casual situation imagine a situation like: i m in class and one of my friends classmates who i ve seen every weekday for a year and a half suggests grabbing a drink after class i ll react as if they had pointed a gun at me another example: an online friend i ve had for over two years and who i ve had the best of conversations with tells me they re coming to my city and we could meet i ll go mia and completely ghost them i m actually writing this because a guy from my city who i ve been talking to for about a month suggested yesterday that we could meet up i ve been sad and paralized since then and still haven t answered his message i have lost friends connections and opportunities because of acting like this and it s like some kind of curse i don t even understand i ve done therapy and it has helped me with many things i am extremely thankful for therapy and for how much of a calmer and aware person it has made me but this one thing just doesn t seem to get fixed so yeah anyone experience something similar any tips on dealing with this situation are appreciated

struggling with stuttering and feeling ignored hi 22m here used to be a confident and out going person growing up but over time developed a stutter through family now it affects me in my daily life my voice is usually soft and low toned because of my anxiety and i get stutter blocks which create pauses in speech because of this people sometimes don t hear me or unintentionally ignore what i m saying even when i try to speak louder the stutter blocks are present which makes me feel more embarrassed lately been trying to work on myself expressing myself more going to gym making eye contact talking to people and reducing screen time and sexual desires that s helping for sure but still feels far from what i want to be over the years worked hard academically and some of the greatest minds in my country not bragging just saying and i feel like i do have a social and relaxed personality people call me chill guy where i m from i also look a bit different lighter skinned so people sometimes glorify my skin color but i worry that once i speak they might lose interest or see me differently because of my stutter i feel like this is holding me back from becoming the person i want to be any tips encouraged

small talk is just soul crushing i ve never understood the culture of small talk tbh when you greet a stranger in a public place for some reason it s almost an obligation to ask them how they day is going and they always have to say that their day is going great both of you know that you don t really listen to each other in that moment both of you don t really care like you re not supposed to say that your day is not going well or ask clarifying questions it s just a mindless ritual that for some reason we keep doing again and again it feels like a bunch of corpo talk where you re supposed to say the right things to get a job offer after an interview if you meet a person with an intention to find new friends or a romantic relationship you start asking them questions about themselves what they do for living what their interests are etc what i noticed is that even at this stage when you re supposed to get to know them better even at this stage people keep talking in the small talk mode they say things but they don t expect you to listen to them it s like they are just talking out loud about themselves they don t expect any reaction they want to keep things at a surface level when everything is going well without going into details i value depth in conversations i find small talk boring i ask people clarifying questions if something doesn t make sense to me or i disagree with them they are almost shocked about it they say that i m different all i do is simply actually take my time to listen to them and take interest in what they have to say it s a simple act of showing some respect to another person isn t this how conversations are actually supposed to go

short story series episode 2 mirrors and shadows episode 2: mirrors and shadows i wake up but the day doesn t start it presses down on me like a weight i can t lift i look in the mirror the reflection is mine but it s fractured my eyes betray every sleepless night every anxious heartbeat my jaw tightens my brain spins on a frequency no one else can hear i walk to the kitchen coffee not for pleasure for survival i overthink every movement: the cup too close the spoon too loud my mind races ahead imagining every judgment every silent critique from the world i m about to face i am hyper aware of the self i present clumsy awkward misunderstood i leave the apartment and step outside the city hums alive and indifferent people brush past me and i feel like a ghost in the crowd a woman walks by her laugh like a spotlight i want connection intimacy a spark but my anxiety suffocates me before i can breathe at work i overcompensate every word every glance every action is calculated i m sharp intelligent perceptive but misunderstood my temper flares my thoughts explode internally people see a hint of arrogance or moodiness but they don t see the battlefield behind my eyes they don t know the war i fight just to exist i come home exhausted alone but even in solitude i can t rest thoughts spin: missed opportunities unspoken words failed connections my brain hums racing analyzing yet somewhere inside a flame burns a voice whispers: you are not defeated you are still here you are still fighting i write again: they may not see me but i see me and that s enough for now the fire is still there hidden silent invisible to all but it grows to be continued

short story series: the invisible fire episode 1 episode 1: hallways of silence the world outside my apartment door is a minefield i sit on the edge of the bed staring at the floor every step i plan to take in the hallway feeling like crossing a tightrope above a canyon the key in the lock trembles in my hand my stomach twists my heart races each passing thought whispers everyone is watching everyone is judging i open the door just a crack the hallway stretches ahead fluorescent lights flickering i step out one two three my feet wobble i can feel the eyes of strangers pressing through walls every shadow is a critic every whisper a condemnation i m not moving fast enough i m too slow i m too awkward the grocery store isn t safe either people talk laugh glance at me i stumble in my own thoughts overanalyzing every glance every movement every word i wonder if they can see the panic in my veins i reach for alcohol not for the taste but for courage for camouflage for the illusion that i am normal back home i collapse onto the couch i think of my ambition the fire trapped inside me i m brilliant and broken i want women connections closeness with family but i m trapped behind walls my own mind built i m isolated misunderstood angry depressed yet i rise again every day trying to break through the invisible chains i write in the dim light: i will persevere i will fight i will not be defined by fear even if fear defines every moment the fire inside is invisible to the world but it burns anyway to be continued

looking for some advice : hello hello i was actually just scrolling on google trying to look for help when i stumbled across this subreddit so don t mind me earlier this evening i was planning on going to this local thai place my fiance and i frequent every time we go somewhere to eat he ends up ordering for me as i m just too nervous to order for myself or if we meet up with one of his work buddies he talks for me introducing me to people etc and its been like this for almost two years now so anyways i had assumed it would be the same thing as usual we pulled in the parking lot and he asked if i wanted to call and order ahead i said sure but wanted to confirm that he would be the one talking and not me he said he wanted me to order this time and i kind of just froze and said i don t know he said we could either go inside and i can order there or i can call them and order over the phone but we would sit there until i made up my mind and followed thru still frozen i just said idk and i couldn t look him in the face we sat there for probably 20 minutes in silence before he gave up and went inside and ordered for both of us i feel ashamed and guilty that i couldn t even say anything to him i couldn t look up my face was all hot whatever you get my point i m sick of my anxiety essentially running my life and i m not exactly sure what to do here even just thinking about ordering food somewhere scares me asking a cashier how their day is going simple day to day actions make me feel embarrassed idk what to do soooo here i am any advice would be great anything i should bring up to him anythings helpful quick side note he s a total angel and i m more just feeling guilty that i can t stand up for myself and act natural so no shade to him thanks

story of my life i never feel like i m living but i m a warrior and i keep trying to get through the pain of dealing with social anxiety even at home it terrifies you thinking about the next time you have to go outside scared to even open ur door to the apartment hallway to get groceries always feeling like the world is judging u not feeling like u fit in society never feeling calm in public always tense have to try so hard to even walk normal or straight without drifting to one side or the other or tripping trying so hard to keep ur head up tall when u feel like a shriveled lil grape being self conscious everytime u wanna try to be social having to rely on alcoholism to dull the pain and appear confident cool and normal dealing with people knowing somethings off with u and making fun of u and laughing at u for it being so hard to make friends getting so depressed and anxious it paralyzes u makes every task in life difficult u know how much potential u have but the pain and suffering holds u back whenever u try to take a step forward feels like two steps back again this is my life and i wanna cry right now but at least i know i m not the only one going thru this i love u all

it wouldn t be so bad if it wasn t for people themselves show any hint of social anxiety and it has a way of bringing out the bully in people this all would be bearable if people were more decent and compassionate but instead they almost subconsciously despise our vulnerability our very real condition whatever vulnerability they fight to mask is more reason for them to hate our unmasked anxiety it s all projection primitive power dynamics that most either don t realize they do or have no shame that they do it ultimately that s the irony of it all the severity of my social anxiety is very much caused by how much society despises it the same can be said about autistic people unmasking i m also an nd person we fear unmasking only because we ve been target when we did despite all the awareness about mental health actually showing symptoms still gets you target in school the workplace everywhere really we haven t come that far

phobia of public speaking and social performance anxiety hi guys i am really desperate here and just need some advice from a community that might have some knowledge on the topic i am in my 4th year of med school and this issue is starting to really effect my mental health mood relationships and career i apologise in advance as this might be a slight rant to set the scene i always had social anxiety growing up for as long as i can remember judging myself and being scared of other peoples judgements however i seem to have developed a phobia of public speaking this started in high school after having a panic attack while giving a presentation up in front of the class this was pretty traumatising for me my voice trembled i sounded like i was going to cry and felt like it too and dissociated fully during and after the event i felt like i was exposed now every time i have to present or get called on to speak i relive the same experience full dissociation where it feels like my head is going to explode and an extreme sense of dread sometimes i feel like i m going to die genuinely it s traumatising every single time and its happening multiple times a week as we constantly have to give presentations in med school and in the hospitals i am able to suppress some of the physical symptoms via beta blockers propranolol but mentally it still tortures me i also now get panic attacks in some every day conversations and around my girlfriend so i can never relax now whenever i know i have a presentation coming up or an interaction where i will have to engage socially and i will be judged i can t stop thinking about it i obsess over it trying to find a way to avoid the anxiety hoping it won t come trying to find a cure for my condition and what i m going through i spend hours every day researching this it s like a full time job my primary fear is that i will be visibly nervous and others will see ie voice shaking blanking out crying throwing up or passing out or even just having to say sorry guys i can t continue then having to explain myself nobody knows i deal with this and i m terrified of being exposed i worry that the beta blockers aren t going to work because sometimes in the past the symptoms have appeared despite being on beta blockers and i want to stop taking beta blockers i m taking heavy doses 100mg propranolol every single day and its affecting my ability to exercise which is also affecting my mood i would just like to be able to speak and interact and live normally without having to numb my nervous system 24 7 i have done 100s of presentations and clinical exams and oral exams in med school where i am being evaluated yet i still haven t got over the fear in fact it s worse than ever after 7 years of dealing with this straight up exposure is not working i m just completely sick to death of it and want rid of it i am looking into treatment options but i m overthinking the therapy because i really want to get it right i have had a few initial consultations with therapists but their approach doesn t seem right they don t seem to understand me fully and i don t follow up with another session i also don t want to waste money i m a student on the wrong therapist if they re a bad fit or just a poor quality therapist i also wonder if online therapy might be better than in person due to finding better therapist i have heard about the limitations of cbt so i m cautious about engaging in cbt alone i feel like some deeper work may be necessary schema therapy ifs to address childhood trauma emdr to address acute traumatic events from specific public speaking events and somatic therapy to try and regain a sense of safety in my body again these are just some of my thoughts but it s just that all the options are overwhelming and i don t know how to find a therapist that can do all of this i have also just begun antidepressant medication sertraline in an attempt to try and combat some of the excessive rumination and worry which will hopefully make my phobia a bit better if anyone has any advice for me in my situation i would be really thankful it s just very hard figuring all of this out alone by myself and some support would be nice anything in terms of what kinds of therapy might be useful to help my specific performance anxiety situation around public speaking also any personal experiences or people you know of that have treated this and any resources which may be helpful

social anxiety mindsets hey guys over time i ve gathered some mindsets that really helped me deal with social anxiety here: 1 everyone likes me unless proven otherwise people generally only dislike you if they have a real reason 2 your anxiety signs aren t as visible to others as you think the ones sensitive enough to see are often sensitive enough to care 3 acknowledge your anxiety and don t try to deny it i am nervous and it is ok 4 most people aren t judging you in reality they re distracted tired stressed or thinking about themselves 5 exposure act despite fear and discomfort if you feel uncomfortable do it anyways because growth happens outside your comfort zone 6 mistakes are allowed and they are ok they make you appear more human and relatable to others 7 there will always be haters no matter what anyone does even the people you admire have their own haters hope this helps someone

socially anxiety sucks this is me venting i don t expect anyone to give me advice but you are all very welcome to share your experiences on this topic i apologize if this post is confusing or hard to read i m writing this in my second language after a night where i couldn t sleep and my thoughts spiraled into deep self discovery i 18m only realized a month ago that i ve been struggling with social anxiety for as long as i can remember when i was young er everyone thought i was shy or said he doesn t like talking a lot and i guess it reinforced that idea in my mind from the age of 4 5 until 18 i ve grown up thinking i was just a shy person however about a month ago i tried mdma with three of my closest and almost only friends it let me experience what it s like to communicate without my own body and mind working against me for no reason i could speak my mind freely without my brain immediately dismissing all thoughts and leaving my mind blank i didn t have any nervousness or tightness in my chest i felt like a new person a person i ve always wanted to be but never thought i d be able to be i m not sure if the drug changed me into someone i actually am not or maybe all it did was lift my social barriers but i really hope it s the latter and it is possible for me to become that kind of person after that whole experience i discovered that i m not just shy looking back there are moments where i can be one of the most confident people in the room while sober i thought i was shy but shyness doesn t take over your whole body the way social anxiety does since then i ve been acknowledging my anxiety and trying to work towards overcoming it although it truly feels impossible now about the reason i am writing this post recently the four of us did mdma again this time however i told them about me realizing that i don t talk a lot because i have social anxiety they told me how much they like talking to me and how they wish i d speak more along some other nice things you have no idea how hard i try it feels iike my head becomes an empty void as soon as i interact with someone no matter how long i ve known them it makes me cry when i think about all the missed opportunities for emotional connection they feel close to me but i struggle to feel the same level of connection back no matter how much i want to and i don t know how to explain it i feel like i ve been isolating myself without meaning to and i don t know how to put that feeling into words i don t want to glamorize drugs so i have to add that mdma didn t fix me but it revealed something that i didn t even know i was searching for i also started thinking about what could have caused my anxiety then i remembered something from when i was around 4 my dad was cheating on my mom and for whatever reason kissed his lover outside of the car while me and my sister 1 were in the backseat at that age i had no idea what was going on but later i casually said to my mom something along the lines of daddy s got a new lady it lead to a very difficult divorce i blame both of them for cheating and fighting right in front of me and my sister i think i punished myself for making my parents break up and subconsciously decided that talking too much is dangerous and this might be the reason i developed social anxiety at a young age i know it s not my fault but what if hadn t been a dumbass and just kept that one sentence to myself how much better could my life have turned out something positive to end this depressing post: i m grateful for my friends and i will try my absolute hardest to keep them and not distance from them i m also glad i finally discovered all this about myself while there s still so much life ahead of me

i get really uncomfortable around guys and i want to fix it any advice i m a senior girl and i realized i have a strange problem i went to an all girls middle school so i literally didn t talk to any guys my age for over three years when i moved to a co ed high school i suddenly found myself seeing every guy only as a potential romantic interest instead of just another person i don t know why but it just happens automatically i m totally fine in group conversations but the moment it becomes an one on one interaction with boys i get really uncomfortable and want to leave what s weird is that i m completely normal around my gay guy friends whether it s a group chatting or not there were actually a lot of guys i genuinely liked as people and wanted to be friends with but because of this weird avoidance i couldn t get close to them some of them even approached me first and i wanted to talk too but i always ended up pulling away maybe this happened because i grew up in an all girls environment my idea of boys was basically shaped by rom coms dramas and novels so when i actually met real teenage boys i didn t know how to handle it i thought time would fix it but it s already passed almost 3 hears in high school and things barely changed i don t even care about dating right now i just want to get along with everyone regardless of gender but i can t seem to get past this discomfort it s frustrating and i feel like i m socially limiting myself has anyone experienced something similar or any advice on how to get over this

when to apologize i feel like because i have social anxiety i never know when i actually need to apologize and when i am overdoing it i have a fairly new friend who twice now post hangout i have texted them and apologized for something that felt to me like a huge misstep but then got a long paragraph back essentially saying nope that didn t bother me you are all good i want to take accountability and make things right when i feel like i ve hurt someone s feelings but because of my social anxiety i m not a good judge of when that is necessary and i don t want to get into a pattern of consistently putting them into a position where they have to reassure me i ve been thinking of telling them something like i ve realized i have now reached out to you post hangout twice and apologized for something i ve said both times you responded with reassurance and that is super sweet and helpful but not my intention when i apologize i want to make sure that i m not unintentionally hurting you when we spend time together because i really value our relationship i also want to make sure that you know if you are comfortable you are absolutely free to tell me if something i do or say makes you upset i understand that me texting you after we hangout may get annoying and i was wondering if it would be better if i just waited for you to let me know if i ve done something wrong rather than constantly trying to apologize proactively and putting you in a position where you have to reassure me i know that this also reeks of social anxiety but i am really struggling with balancing taking accountability and not apologizing every time i spend time with someone does anyone else feel this does anyone have any tips that help them discern when they actually did something wrong and when they are just overthinking any advice would be greatly appreciated

thoughts: if i were to invent smartglasses that give live reassurance during conversations would that actually help my last post about what helped most with your social anxiety had a lot of the top comments mentioning about exposure therapy micro wins and giving yourselves permission to take time when talking it made me wonder if i were to invent smartglasses that quietly give live reminders during conversations things like: it s okay to pause you re not being judged nobody is watching you as closely as you think take a breath you don t have to perform a simple answer is enough you can take your time and maybe even tiny optional prompts like: ask a follow up question you can end the convo politely now look at their eyebrows instead of their eyes if eye contact feels too much or even directly remind us what to say if we provide it with some context beforehand so we don t freeze and potentially other features such as post conversation encouragement tracking the progress exposure therapy analyze the body language of others heartrate tracking do you think that would actually help or would it make you more anxious knowing you re relying on something

learning to overcome social anxiety feeling behind and losing my personality i know people commonly talk about this on this sub but i m pretty sure my social anxiety is contributing to me feeling behind in life i just got off a call with my high school friends we were catching up and talking about their time at college a lot of them frequently go out have close friends to hang out with get into relationships and overall have no problems forming connections with new people i on the other hand am an introvert who usually spends weekends inside and struggles to form solid relationships with the people around me i don t necessarily have a huge problem with being introverted but it would be nice to have people to do fun things with on the weekends however it s very hard for me to get close to people because i m an overthinker and maybe a little too self aware whenever i try to connect with others like by talking about my interests or hobbies i feel like i m met with blank stares or far less enthusiasm than i show them it makes me feel like they re not truly interested in getting to know me it doesn t help that in college people tend to see me only as a career driven academic and nothing beyond that i also don t really fit into any of the groups i m part of this has caused me to change myself so much to appease whoever i m talking to that i ve started to lose my personality and sense of who i am i feel like i have to act like a character to avoid being perceived as weird or boring because of this i ve stopped reaching out to people platonically or romantically out of fear and i ve continued to isolate myself i ve started to peel away from these feelings a bit this semester but after that call some of them resurfaced and i ve been feeling a little lost again it s been really hard working through these emotions and even though comparison has set me back a little i still feel like i can continue moving forward i recently attended a session through one of my campus organizations that talked about feeling lost or losing your personality as being an opportunity to redefine who you want to be it was one of the most inspirational things i ve heard and it motivated me to keep moving forward instead of getting stuck in anxiety i ve made a promise to myself for the rest of this year and next year to be bold about my interests to stop overthinking every little interaction and to reach out to the people i genuinely want to connect with i m reminding myself that i m my own person and my life doesn t need to compare to anyone else s even though it s easier said than done i m going to keep striving toward that goal i just wanted to share my journey with all of you : tl dr : i ve been struggling with social anxiety and feeling behind compared to my friends who easily form connections i often feel misunderstood isolated and pressured to change myself to fit in which has made me lose touch with who i am but after attending an inspirational campus session i m working on being more authentic reaching out to others and redefining myself without comparing my life to anyone else s i m still learning but i m committed to moving forward

stuttering is slowly turning me into someone i don t recognize i ve been dealing with stuttering for years and i can feel it slowly reshaping parts of me i never wanted to lose there are moments when i m completely fluent when i m alone talking to younger people or late at night and in those moments it feels like nothing is wrong with me at all but the second i m around people my age or anyone i want to sound normal with everything inside me freezes my chest tightens my heart starts racing my breath gets stuck and even simple words feel impossible to push out what hurts is that this doesn t reflect who i am i m not quiet withdrawn or afraid of people i actually enjoy talking and connecting but the stuttering keeps dragging me into a version of myself that feels smaller and more distant every day it s exhausting trying to act okay on the outside while fighting my own body just to say basic things i just needed to put this somewhere people might understand what this feels like

i feel myself slipping i dont want to be an island i am an intelligent person i am succeding in college and i know i am introspective and caring and also a complete derp sometimes i am often in the clouds and my anxiety makes me freeze up and not be able to respond convey what i wish i could what i feel in my heart how i want to affect people around me positively i have a moment where i feel overwhelmed or simply drifting for a moment and i see people notice and their eyes narrow or a look of knowing flashes in their eyes and i know that the hole inside of me is visible i am not interacting the way i am socially expected to in that moment then that moment of not being present turns into complete withdrawal my body is ridden with fear and frozen and i cannot think or speak my fear makes me come off as apathetic but i do care deeply peering through the windows of my mind i have a couple friends see who i am beyond my anxiety but i feel like i fail them because they want to connect with me and im so scared of letting everyone down that i come off as disingenuous and for the rest what i am capable of becomes lost as the moment for connection passes by me and some assume i am inept i dont want to be treated as if im different but i am i wish i could respond quickly or catch that social cue i wish i could hold my head high and know who i am despite judgement i sense people s pity for me for missing out on the opportunities to connect ive been slipping and im so scared ill always feel this way my condition is not a burden i can expect others to understand or give energy to i feel so alone and defeated i am not slow i am just terrified i have drifted away from my own compass i dont know if i should keep trying even though its traumatizing or isolate from everyone

advice or opinions of my anxiety hey guys first of all wanted to say thank you to anyone who actually ends up reading this long paragraph lol and for any advice i have been on a long journey for a while to try and reduce manage social anxiety age 15 current 25 i have tried so much including in person therapy for a couple of years online therapy group therapy online worked on deep breathing refocusing the mind etc also have tried many different meds that have made zero difference adderall lexapro wellbutrin escitalopram atenolol and a couple others have been diagnosed with social anxiety since age 15 and generalized anxiety disorder since age 24 and major depression at 17 i think but who knows if that s legit however i still feel the same pain and feel stuck watch a ton of youtube videos and advice about how to be better and improve anxiety have exercised consistently don t eat too badly don t smoke or drink sleep 8 hours a night tried to keep a couple of friends and force myself to be uncomfortable but it gets very hard to maintain relationships even close family every interaction is draining and sure sometimes i m in the right mindset but most of the time my mind is blank and i get worried about being exposed exposed for being and feeling really dumb a lot of things that may be common knowledge or are pop culture music directions and more i have a lacking in understanding in and or ability to communicate my thought processing is slow and my memory is poor people will talk about things with positive memories and i won t know how to react without looking like an idiot i hate the way people look at me that im dumb i want to make others happy and be able to contribute to conversation but i feel my awkwardness and overcompensation of feeling unintelligent appears arrogant makes people want to avoid me also i unconsciously avoid people anyways so my mixed signals confuse others people believe me to be selfish but i really want to be better to myself so i can t be better to others im a people pleaser and am miserable if i can t make others like me which is a big problem for an awkward person who wants to be social i am also resentful of totters because interactions and talking and knowledge are so easy for them i m going to call a neurologist this week and do some preliminary testing to see if my brain is fucked up for any particular neural disorder or something anyone else have advice or something that worked for them with neurology thank you again

from social anxiety to extrovert in record time hi everyone i m21 found a way to use exposure in the most efficient way for myself i m not a therapist nor do i know exactly how exposure therapy is supposed to work but for comparison: i know someone who does exposure therapy with a therapist while i m doing it on my own the difference in our progress is so huge that it almost feels inhuman while he is still struggling to talk to people i m already able to do the opposite and talk freely to people i know and don t know my method might be a solution though of course it might not be for everyone background: just so you can imagine how far i ve come: i grew up with social anxiety since kindergarten or even before later i was diagnosed with dependency issues depression and social anxiety i went from being scared that someone might stare at me while i was outside to talking to people in groups with confidence this also helped my depression a lot because the social anxiety or rather the low self worth was one of the triggers i feel way better now as if i don t have depression anymore i m still grinding but the progress is real and i ve received a lot of positive feedback it might seem inhuman but it is possible i m not trying to brag i want to spread hope that it is possible this isn t small progress it s huge i know how it feels to live in fear and that s why i want to help others feel more free and less trapped disclaimer: this process requires discipline bravery consistency and the ability to look into yourself honestly that s all you need you don t have to start with high self esteem you can start from very low the more you push through the more progress you will feel day by day or week by week note: it s a process write down every success at the end of the day or share it with someone you trust it really helps in the beginning it doesn t matter how small the success is recording it gives you the power of feeling one step closer to independence the high art of self regulation exposure alone is not enough you must constantly regulate yourself while feeling the fear i repeat: you have to regulate yourself constantly while feeling the fear otherwise exposure won t reach its full potential how to do it whenever you enter any social situation going outside shopping talking to someone you know or don t know you should regulate yourself using certain sentences you can adjust them they aren t golden rules i created them to stabilize myself when i feel fear important: whenever you feel avoidance do the opposite and use the sentences avoiding only makes it worse no matter how small or big the avoidance is do the opposite that s the best way to build self esteem you don t just read them you must feel them writing them down helps a lot when i think of them they relax me the fear the sweating the worries you can say them out loud or read them in your mind if it doesn t work take out your phone and read them slowly and carefully to strengthen your self worth motivational sentences describing your characteristics for me for example: i radiate positivity with my natural way my smile and my presence nothing can stop me so i stay exactly as i am general sentences when i realize it s okay to be who i am all the sadness disappears no fear of talking actively talk self worth is built actively not passively don t wait for reactions take action yourself less analyzing because the need for control is the root of insecurity in large groups i need to switch it off or reduce it stay myself without pretending that way i don t lose energy i gain it when i stay myself i feel no fear don t overinterpret things like silence or blank stares they can have other reasons and are not about me and definitely not tied to my self worth if someone is truly unfriendly it says more about them than about me it does not define my self worth if someone seems harsh but doesn t mean it i should question whether it s actually directed at me focus more on my body sensations and less on the environment that reduces fear and increases confidence don t wait or hope for attention even when i m alone don t think about how it comes across that s just overanalysis redirect thoughts and remind myself that i don t depend on attention my self worth comes from within redirect thoughts when i wonder how something might have come across so overthinking doesn t take over neither from me nor toward me my self worth is independent of other people s reactions don t imagine or simulate future social situations stay in the here and now to avoid triggering fears if the other person doesn t laugh or smile it doesn t reduce my self worth there could be many reasons it says more about them than about me the insecurity about whether something came across weird or whether it s quiet because of me or insecurity when alone or around people all of that is only a projection of my own fear it s not real it s an illusion even when i feel watched or judged it s just a projection of how insecure i feel about how i m being seen i can act or speak naturally i m allowed to be myself these feelings of judgment are only projections every kind of social fear happens only in the mind it s all a projection when i say this to myself and apply these tips the fear goes away when the body tenses up relax it and do a projection check when i feel avoidance consciously do the opposite don t question what i said or wrote afterward leave it as it is keep my self worth anchored within me short version for quick boosts 1 every form of social anxiety and worry is only a projection and therefore not real when i expose it the fear disappears 2 stay in the here and now no ruminating or anticipating 3 be myself self worth comes from within not from outside 4 no reaction from others whether active or passive affects my self worth it says something about them not about me most used sentences i tell myself: this is just a projection or i m projecting again then the fear becomes so small i barely feel it or it disappears completely this should reduce physical symptoms if you feel the meaning behind it every social fear you feel is only a projection everything you fear is what you think not what is real take a short deep breath focus visually on one point and say: this is just a projection the fear in my body is only an illusion created by the brain if someone is unfriendly if someone is truly unfriendly it says more about them than about me and it definitely does not define my self worth when feeling low use motivational sentences about your characteristics: individual characteristics as being positive and so on just like above and when i realize it s okay to be who i am all the sadness disappears the purpose is to strengthen your inner core and not rely on external validation start with the long version and gradually switch to the short version as it gets easier if you have a relapse just use the instructions it will get better eventually you can feel self esteem without needing the sentences at all i m slowly moving toward that step but i still need to consolidate this new safer state i just realized that making myself small or feeling a need for attention for example downplaying myself is also an indicator of a projection of low self worth so when you feel needy or want to be noticed redirect your thoughts to your own self worth and tell yourself that it s just a projection that you don t actually need to be seen because self worth comes from within it s better to use the sentences with your individual characteristics and remind yourself that you re not dependent on attention from others it s possible to feel drained after a full exposure session that s why i still recommend taking time for yourself for example i watch funny videos that lift my mood after exposure and i feel better than ever this serves as a kind of cooldown or reward note: before posting this someone gave me a downvote here in anxiety i felt bad at first then i told myself this is just a projection it says more about the person who downvoted me and doesn t affect my self worth it would be easier to explain this in person but i ll gladly answer as much as i can i wrote this quickly so it s long but hopefully helpful if you re interested i can improve it even further just let me know in the comments i am from germany btw

realising i was actually an extrovert with social anxiety helped me a lot interestingly enough i figured it out through a song: from your room by mia stegner she mentions using an introvert identity but feeling miserable when she s alone a lot i was like wow that s me and i thought more and i realised that the only times i don t like being around people is when my anxiety and overthinking kicks in once i addressed this i ve learned to approach social situations better i ask someone close to me to come i pay attention to my feelings and needs i advocate for myself more in social settings i also suffer from panic disorder which could be triggered by nothing or by anxiety i ve found my mental health seriously improving by doing all this sometimes i can only stick around for half an hour because of anxiety but even that s enough to make me feel happy i got to spend time with friends i also realised my anxiety when talking to new people is a lot less than when i m in that in between of acquaintance and friendship that damn friendship imposter syndrome lmao funny how it works

does it actually help to face uncomfortable situations or your fears when you have social anxiety hey just a quick note before i start: my english isn t great so i m using a bit of google translate i hope everything still makes sense i wanted to share something that happened to me recently i ve had diagnosed social anxiety for about five years it s been better at times and worse at times but lately it s been really bad i ve been unemployed for a while i feel extremely uncomfortable in my own body and i ve honestly developed a kind of hatred toward people i spend most of my time in my room one of my more functioning friends thought it would be good for us to go out and do something somehow we ended up buying tickets to a datenight party mostly as a joke i wasn t planning on meeting anyone she was more motivated and i had never been to a club before i m in my early 20s and she s 20 i thought what s the worst that could happen we also agreed that if one of us found someone they liked the other one could stay or leave and no one would be upset just so nobody ends up feeling like the third wheel when we arrived we immediately realized the age range was completely different from what was advertised it was supposed to be 18 30 but there were lots of people in their 30s 40s and older we were definitely the youngest ones there that already made me really tense once we were inside i hated everything the music the people the atmosphere it was like a completely different world to me and then within the first five minutes my friend left me alone to go after the first guy she saw so i sat in a corner for like 20 minutes feeling like an alien in a movie the noise the lights the people i felt disgusting and totally out of place i knew she wasn t going to come back so i searched the whole club until i found her in some hidden room cuddling with a guy she had just met i told her i was leaving she didn t understand at first but eventually she followed me outside i explained how awful the whole situation felt and how she basically abandoned me she said she told me she might take longer but what does that even mean was she coming back was she not she didn t think about it at all we went home after that i m in therapy and i keep being told that it s important to face your fears and put yourself into uncomfortable situations but for me it feels like the opposite it doesn t help it just makes things worse it s a huge stress factor i avoid people as much as possible but forcing myself into situations like this doesn t make anything better either i ve been trying this approach for years and it honestly feels counterproductive

social health week 48: presence vulnerability turning points chat gpt crafted dan page edited this week i ve been reflecting on social health not just casual connections but the deeper kind: presence authenticity and being truly seen life gets heavy trauma stress and loss can quietly build walls yet sometimes the smallest moments spark profound change i m reminded of anna kendrick in pitch perfect standing on stage heart racing facing fear head on real presence demands bravery in a conversation a coffee or a community event elon musk reminds us to take the first step even when unsure and charlie in charlie and the chocolate factory shows the power of noticing the magic around us while staying humble and authentic week 48 social goals: 1 isolation show up fully: attend one event and have a 2 3 minute undistracted conversation 2 fear of vulnerability share one genuine thought or feeling with someone you trust 3 community drift reconnect with one person for a short intentional check in 4 emotional exhaustion choose one energizing social interaction and skip one draining one 5 misaligned energy spend 30 minutes in a space that uplifts your energy unified week 48 intention: i will have one meaningful undistracted conversation showing up authentically protecting my energy and choosing connection over isolation channel the courage of anna kendrick the boldness of elon musk the wonder of charlie and the guidance of mentors and moments that shaped you erika kirk kalin blanchard blue 35 emily small acts become turning points social health isn t about being more social it s about being more present more real more alive

have a choice i think it must be both of their first times being in a relationship or living on their own before that they were living at his parents house they go at it like rabbits and shriek the fear of personal personality related questions is what gets me most i ve had social anxiety for a long time and recently it s been better overall but there s one main thing that makes it so that i can never advance past a certain point the fear that if i get even slightly closer to someone they will ask something more personal and just can t deal with that i just have this fear of being judged so i hate sharing anything personal about myself favorite movie genres favorite good favorite games hobbies etc and this is one reason why i avoid conversations as i really don t want to be asked any of this this is why i feel slightly more comfortable when i talk to someone that i know won t ask me anything like that i m mostly more comfortable on reddit but this fear is so deep that i d barely feel comfortable sharing any of that even here

i went on another date and it surprisingly went so well today i tried going on another date at first i was so skeptical nervous and really scared because the date location was a bit unfamiliar to me it was like really unfamiliar which scared me more i had to apologize to the driver so many times fortunately i reached the destination he was there waiting already i thought to myself screw it i m just going to be myself this time who cares if i nervous laugh and stuff that thought helped me soooo much we talked so many things giggle and surprisingly he was a talker and as a listener that was such a good thing for me the location was really cozy not much people around which probably helped me feel at ease we talked a lot about experiences preferences and stuff unlike the first guy i went on a date with his questions were so subtle i didn t even notice them not so invasive but you could still get to know the person after we ate we went for a walk which was really nice spent a bit of a time at a lobby and talked more i giggled so much not because of being nervous but i was genuinely enjoying the time then we went to his place surprisingly he was so repsectful and nothing more happened than talked giggle a bit of cuddles per se he s huggable and i really liked that a lot we talked more we both enjoy the same interest which has helped me a lot he booked a cab for me and i got home safely we both then agreed that we can freely explore more dates i am really glad for tonight for a good company and also for being brave to actually put myself out there overcoming my fear of meeting people

losing hope i ve had social anxiety since i was a child 20 years more or less i ve made progress over the years overcome many social challenges by basically forcing myself to face them over and over again but still i have to do mental gymnastics every time i do any socializing that s out of my comfort zone i m constantly trying to mask so it s hard not to beat myself up after any interaction that revealed any nervousness or awkwardness but when i feel i ve really blown it it s so hard not to feel completely destroyed i carry so much shame as a result and no one ever understands of course i m hyper aware of everything even when i dont want to be i notice when people perceive me as weird how they avoid me or immediately feel awkward having a conversation with me because they can sense my nerves i can understand it may be a biological response to feel uneasy around a human that is displaying anxiety for no apparent reason but it still hurts deeply i m tired of feeling like there s something wrong with me i m tired of feeling rejected i ve done so much to try to overcome this exposure therapy has helped me progress the most and i take beta blockers to manage the physical symptoms i ve also tried behavioral therapy plant medicine kava yoga and breath work which have all offered some relief but only to a certain extent some days i feel proud of how far i ve come other days it feels like i m right back where i started i m 30 years old and i don t want to spend the rest of my life feeling this way i fear that this struggle will always be a part of me and that s hard to accept

can you be an extrovert with social anxiety hello i am a 23 year old female and i am wondering if it s possible to be an extrovert and have social anxiety for some context i love being social i have no problem talking to strangers in public while waiting in lines and i am very quick to make friends with strangers i follow a logic that i will probably never run into these people again and i have no connection to them thus their opinions on me do not matter it makes it easy to just be me and i typically always leave those types of conversations feeling very positive what i struggle with is the people closest to me i often have a fear that i ve done something to upset others when i am in a group setting with my close friends i often replay conversations and think back on my interactions to dissect what i said how i acted how the other person reacted etc dud to these fears that i have done something wrong i often bring up to someone how i m feeling and if they think i should apologize or if i am reading too far into things i am starting to realize that this tends to backfire a lot what to me seems as me just asking a friend for advice on if i have done something to upset a friend in which case i will always take accountability and apologize or if i am being delusional as i know i can overthink things or not understand tone jokes i m wondering if anyone else feels this way and what strategies they use when these fears arise is there a strategy i can use to help me decipher if someone is truly upset or doesn t like me i struggle to tell in situations where it s like my friends friend who is in the group but i m not close with likes me or is just kinda in a position where we have to be around each other any advice would be greatly appreciated i really wanna work on not letting these feelings of fear and the crushing of no one likes me i said something stupid now their whole opinion on me is changed and i can t go back because a part of me knows it s not rational i just don t know how to stop it thank you

accepting myself to help ease sa i ve been thinking lately the more i know what i value the more i will feel convicted in what role i will play then i can accept myself and what really matters to me instead of always feeling like i have to brace and hyper adapt to the expectations of people i m around i ve been thinking i want to learn to be a better friend to people to go about my daily life feeling invested in those around me not overly so not controlling but just enough to set myself up for the rejections that occur when i am true to my values but i won t just be setting myself up for rejection i will be setting myself up for genuine bonding too tonight i read the carl jung quote loneliness does not come from having no people about one but from being unable to communicate the things that seem important to oneself or from holding certain views which others find inadmissible maybe if i give more attention towards figuring out what really matters to me then my loneliness will decrease i won t be as afraid around people because i will know who i am and am not and i will have areas of common ground to bond with people through i d love to hear your story if you ve found accepting yourself has helped with social anxiety and the accompanying feelings of loneliness or alienation

going into my old job for the first time in a few months most likely going to get my job back i ve been avoiding going into my last job since i left dealing with mental health issues and kinda ghosted without saying anything but my mom has been trying to get me to go into the mall so we could see if anything has changed if a new store we ve been waiting to open has updated more and i ve been pushing back every time but something today deep down told me it would be okay i ended up getting some coupons in the mail for it and decided that would be my excuse for going in i walk in and see two of my old coworkers and i m kinda scared but i joke around and say hey stranger to them and they re both excited to see me then as i m shopping around the store manager was there and she was on the phone but very excited to see me and as i was checking out i made a comment saying if they needed holiday help i d be down to put in an application since i haven t had a job in months and she said so sincerely that she understands and would love to have me back on so i m excited really and i hope my new confidence i got through my residential stay will actually shine through this time over maybe i can make things be normal a little more again

i find people boring and feel guilty for that hi guys i wasn t sure where to post this to get an opinion so i figured social anxiety would be a good place since i struggle with it too i used to think i was just a shy person and throughout my life i ve been working on improving my social skills i always believed that the reason i had trouble making friends was simply because i was shy but now that i m getting better at socializing and even making friends more easily i ve realized that shyness wasn t the only issue i find it really hard to be genuinely interested in other people and i feel bad about that sometimes i keep friendships and hang out with people because i don t want to feel like a bad friend especially when the other person clearly likes me even though the whole time i m secretly wanting to go home it s much easier for me to enjoy spending time with people in work or college settings where there are tasks or activities to focus on my interactions there feel fun maybe because they re quick and structured but when it comes to going out just for fun i usually don t have fun at all unless i drink but i m not really a drinking person deep inside i wish i cared i crave for having a genuine friendship caved on interest not guilt but don t know how just venting to see if anyone relates or has any thoughts and sorry for the english it s not my first language

how the heck do so many people with sa end up traveling solo i ve seen so many cases here and elsewhere of people traveling solo and it s one of the only things regarding social anxiety that actually breaks my brain i ve been planning a trip for months prepared a lot for it read endless anecdotes from sa sufferers and already booked but i am so close to cancelling it i just can t internalize how people successfully do that and even end up saying they loved it i understand there s levels to social anxiety and maybe those with a lesser not trying to diminish anxiety just can t think of a better word form of sa are able to push through perhaps medication helps with that i currently take no medication for my anxiety for what it s worth for me stepping out of the house is a challenge being in public spaces with people would raise my self consciousness to an insane degree and the thought of talking to anyone or adulting alone in a foreign country sounds like an absolutely herculean obstacle it s just demoralizing to me that i am hyper ventilating so much i am feeling nauseous so much i am sleepless and i am just straight up terrified to commit to something i want to do and i know might make me grow and face my fears but the fear is too high i ve had sa since i was bullied as a kid around age 6 i am now 34 and i think this is the most anxious i have ever felt anyone in a similar boat can you travel alone or have you
