trying to understand why i sometimes anger people so i ve been making some people angry for no apparent reason and i m actually clueless i ll provide some context i m a 36 year old guy i live in the netherlands and have been diagnosed with add last year i ve got a pending result for asd with a high probability most people describe me as a silent but chill guy who is not that outgoing i live by live and let live since i ve been diagnosed with add and have been taking prescribed medications ssris and amphetamines i feel a whole bunch better it does not fix everything but it makes it more bearable i m finally able to sort things out and get an understanding about who i am what i do and why i do but there s one thing that keeps slipping my mind and it s driving me nuts i ve had some people get mad at me seemingly for no apparent reason it happens to be mostly men between the age of 20 to 60 about 95 the other 5 is women between the age of 45 60 the frequency is about 5 to 6 times a year as an example i m just sitting somewhere and they snap all of sudden there s a whole bunch of variety in what action reactions i get sometimes they do a little extra effort and come to me if they aren t in range the simplest are dirty looks i can t really describe and mean regards about my physical appearance in the worst case they get physical it happens at social gatherings work and basically everywhere people are involved i ve had complete strangers be hostile from the moment they lay eyes on me not a single word spoken or looks exchanged one thing that occurs a whole bunch more is that people from above mentioned sex and age range try to prevent eye contact like at the register in some store a little grab out of the box of things these people have told me: i m vain i m provocative as in i m actively challenging them i m not that good looking i m a showoff in context of the things i ve been called i can say i m not actively trying to be any of those things basic hygiene is important but i don t really care about how i look i really do not care about dick measuring i never said i m good looking i m just having fun i m not racing you i m racing myself i ve been looking over everything and analyzing things but i m actually stumped tried talking to a therapist but no answer i ve tried talking to people about it but no one seems to believe me tried talking to someone that had been mean to me on work hr got involved afterwards we got to know each other better and are chill now and i thought i could ask the man why he got so angry then he just said i looked mean i could sense he was not being sincere with me so i m kinda stuck between a rock and a hard place any ideas many thanks in advance edit: talked to some more people and apparently i give of vibes that i m not a typical guy guy and can be perceived as misandristic when there s actual contact it s mainly because i don t participate in the degrading insulting humor who knew that not fitting in and not actively trying to be an asshole is considered rude

worst lunch of my life: flustered by waiter and he noticed i was at the beach with some friends and our waiter a tall muscular man about my same age with a heavy italian accent wearing tank top and shorts due to it evidently being a beach eatery in the sun caught my eye i made no comment on him but my body did as i became severely flustered and you already know what happens when gentlemen see someone they like he gave me my drink and i tried looking down then suddenly he giggles it was a weird gh gheheh giggle from the back of his throat my heart sank and although he continued service as usual i couldn t just help but rewind that giggle my friend who was looking at him all the time said he had blushed which to my dread further confirms my anxiety friend assured me that if he had been uncomfortable or disgusted he would ve simply swapped tables but he kept serving me but i just feel like i creeped out someone and ruined his day i want earth to swallow me so badly

does anyone enjoy night walks due to the lack of people simply walking by people on the sidewalk scares the hell out of me i feel creepy and weird if i just keep my head down and walk past i feel awkward and weird if i give them a friendly nod or greeting it s gotten to a point that i ll sometimes just turn around if i see someone walking towards me down the road i m sure it depends on where you live but i really enjoy night walks probably the only time i get to enjoy being outside without having to worry about my social anxiety making me feel terrible obviously you ll probably still run into people at night but significantly less than in the daytime

it took safety not just exposure obligatory for me i can only speak for myself and my experiences anyway my social anxiety is slowly beginning to improve after getting a new job the people are for the most part very kind two people who i don t like and are rude af but at least i don t always have to interact with them i noticed they don t shame me for mistakes and give me positive reinforcement for a job well done this this is what i needed earlier this year i did raw exposure therapy with no real safety net it worked a bit sure but it was slow and everytime i felt like i messed up even though i technically succeeded i d come home cry and shut down down for weeks to over a month straight so yep i see it now in first person it s safe people that i needed not just practice now it s about trying to continue to identify the correct supportive personalities for my journey i m still insecure i still want to hide i still struggle to start and hold conversations i still am pretty incompetent in many ways so i have a long way to go

the day my grandmother passed away hello my grandmother passed away the day before yesterday and the news was a shock and completely unexpected for me so i prepared myself and took two inderal pills because i knew the day would be hard and long at the beginning i didn t know how to act what to say how to express my sadness how to console others how to talk i felt like a child who has no idea what to do i felt like everyone was looking at me and judging me so i got extremely anxious and that anxiety completely overshadowed my sadness about her death that was shocking to me of course most of my relatives came along with their friends that s when i realized i don t really have any friends to comfort me no one i know was there for me the first day passed and it was heavy on the second and third day i was expected to sit and receive people like i m the man of the family representing everyone but i don t know anyone some people talked to me with annoyance: you don t remember me i tell you who i am every time and you forget i never know what to say someone responded on my behalf telling them he s not into social stuff that s just how he is and i felt embarrassed and guilty like i m being accused of not knowing anyone or anything a lot of people ignored me on purpose as if i m a little kid who doesn t know anything even though i m 22 honestly when i compare myself to my colleagues i feel like if the same thing happened to them they would ve handled it better than i did i m genuinely exhausted drained very anxious and sadly the last thing i m feeling right now unfortunately is grief for my grandmother

uncontrollable blushing is the worst i start blushing so easily over the smallest things bro it makes it more difficult to do the exposure therapy cuz my face goes red and i can tell other people notice its even worse if its a guy cuz im scared they will think im blushing cuz i have a crush on them or something so the anxiety from yhat makes me blush even more lol i hate the possible judgments they could be having the ideas they could be conjuring in their heads abt me thinking im just a weirdo when will it end

how to reduce the impact of anxiety on the body i m in my 20s graduated from college this year unemployed staying home and having no friends which is fine with me the problem is i have trouble interacting with other people for long periods of time as soon as i feel unsure of my words or actions i blush 99 of the time my hands start shaking i automatically look away i can blush if i make eye contact with someone even my family my head goes blank and so on i can force myself to ask a passerby something buy groceries or make a phone call it s great that they can t see my shaking hands these are all short interactions and i don t have time to get too scared but things like interviews presentations and long conversations all of that is difficult my mind knows that none of this is fatal but my body just doesn t listen and takes on a life of its own the main thing that bothers me is that i periodically get chest pains from anxiety probably due to my increased heart rate and adrenaline this doesn t happen during stress but after the situation is over the pain comes in bursts with a burning and stabbing sensation and this can last for several days the longest i ve ever experienced was four days at these moments i feel like i ll die of cardiac arrest faster than my social phobia goes away this is probably the main reason why i avoid leaving my comfort zone but unfortunately it doesn t make the problem go away has anyone else experienced this and can offer advice p s sorry for mistakes i wrote the text with a translator

the cure to your all your worrying is to stop thinking that is not advice but rather more a fact its truths do not lessen the burden of walking the path to see that for yourself all socially anxious agree on this one principle that all our attempts to master the world by means of overthinking about all the minutiae and trifles of life end in failure we do not achieve the world of certainty we demand and we pay at every moment a price far too great for one to bear rendered out of us in constant fear and self loathing though the way is dim there is light as i have found out for myself what prevents our capacity to regulate our minds in just proportion so that it works for us rather than against us why are we seemingly under constant threat of attack from all fronts what pulls so tightly at our hearts and renders us so unworthy of standing equal amongst one another all answers to these questions will bear themselves in the form of a thought by means of a process of reflective self awareness in which we attempt to use the tool of thinking to come to a sound resolution what are to be the fruits of such labor what is gained in thinking except more thoughts it stands to reason that the only outcome worth valuing is that which eventually moves beyond thoughts and into action or nonaction depending on how you do or do not think about it what we desire is peace of mind and resignation from our perpetual battle with being human amongst humans if we contend that our suffering is lessened by cessation of continuous reflective thinking then what binds us to it so strongly herein lies the truth of the matter the struggle by which we persist in folly is rooted in a fundamental misunderstanding of the nature of our self if we analyze closely our socially anxious self identity we find that it is in large part defined by the judgments of others that is to say we allow ourselves to be in part defined by the myriad of opinions in which others might posses of us opinions which we constantly seek to control or influence so as to reaffirm our own internal sense of self image the result is a self image that is like a castle alone and vulnerable in a hostile world whose large walls are needed to keep others out anyone who can pierce the defenses has a clear line of sight to all the vulnerabilities that lay at our hearts we are destroyed in an instant if the others judgments are met without equal ground to make a stand on thus the judgments of others or even just our beliefs of their judgments comes to form the basis of our new self image in practice we give to others the keys to our self identity and we suffer in its defense being so open to attack and with so much at stake it suffices to say that the socially anxious life is exhausting if this is the great error that we have no firm ground by which to self suffice then what is our solution to give the solution is to do injustice to the path which one must walk in order to see the virtue of such a solution but i have already given it in the cessation of reflective thinking this is harder to do in practice for our minds are built out of beliefs forming complex worldviews stuffed with emotional baggage and misguided by the non values of society we have inherited and not reflected upon not thinking calls into question our entire understanding of morality self others and being itself aristotle tells us that all virtues become vices in excess or deficit reflective thinking is a tool that becomes a crutch when overused it can distort reality just as much as it can make it clear self awareness reveals an infinite hall of mirrors to one who takes it to its limits it reveals a self that the more you try to understand it by thinking about it the more complex it becomes there is no stable ground in self reflection what is left when you stop thinking stable ground lies under your feet

public speaking and panic attacks m24 i ve been suffering from panic attacks for about 12 years it might sound absurd but until a year ago i wasn t even able to give them a name i didn t know what was happening to me i only knew they started from inside me and felt like electric shocks at first they were rare and limited to certain situations so i pretended they didn t exist then 5 years ago during my high school finals i had the most terrible attack of my life out of nowhere and for no apparent reason it s a moment i will never forget and that caused me immense embarrassment since then i developed a constant fear of oral exams at university and a significant glossophobia however my desire to continue my university studies which i really enjoy along with being fairly ambitious and driven meant that every time for each exam i just gritted my teeth and suffered for weeks hoping i wouldn t experience that awful moment again i can t deny that the anxiety trembling and heart palpitations often made me perform worse than i deserved sometimes i came very very close to having another attack but i always managed to avoid it now as i write this there are 8 days left until my thesis defense probably the day i fear most since i started university even 9 months ago i would spend my evenings thinking about it before falling asleep so i decided to start psychotherapy it definitely helped in some ways but my fear has only softened a little it s still huge i imagine that terrible scene on repeat at least 100 times a day: me feeling sick in front of all my friends and family the nightmare returning with fifty times the intensity honestly i ve even thought about taking an anxiety medication on the day but i really don t want to since i ve never done it wouldn t know how and it would feel like a point of no return for me but maybe i need it i don t know my therapist says i don t i really don t know what to do or think anymore apart from this burden i carry all in all i ve had a happy and fulfilling life but in 8 days if things go badly i might fall into a black hole that i don t know if i can climb out of just being honest

our social anxiety steams from our egoistical self that s making us believe we re constantly being watched and judged but nope the truth is that everyone has that ego within themselves that from childhood made you feel like it s only you having this human experience while everyone around was literally around you and you are the center of the universe frankly enough everyone thinks more of themselves than they do of you even they if they judge you it s to take attention from themselves bottom line i don t know i am still figuring this problem out but one thing for sure is that each one of us is having their own being or call it whatever your like and btw everyone is busy with themselves more than caring about you even if they show so yet it s only in how you relate to how they care about themselves ps: we are creatures that are social so keep this in mind we still need each other and keep in mind that it is what if it went uncheck is what leads to such social anxiety or whatever

trying to be part of my own life again so i ve been realizing lately how much i basically disappeared from everyone s lives without meaning to my last job ate up all my time and energy long hours constant stress and zero mental space for anything outside of work i didn t notice how much i d pulled away from people until after i finally quit the other day i ended up having this unexpectedly deep conversation with one of my closest friends we were just catching up and it somehow turned into this honest talk about life burnout and how much i ve missed actual connection it hit harder than i expected like when did i stop being part of my own social circle right after that he planned a little hangout at my place with a few of our closest friends nothing huge just a small low pressure get together so i could ease back into being social again he even brought his cocktail maker and started making drinks trying new capsules while we all sat around the kitchen table talking and laughing about the old days and catching up like no time had passed and honestly it felt really good awkward at moments sure because i still feel rusty and my brain is relearning how to be around people without overthinking every second but it was warm and easy and it reminded me that i actually like being around people when i m not completely drained it s weird trying to rebuild social skills you didn t realize you d lost but last night felt like the first step and i m kind of proud of myself for showing up

unable to maintain friendships despite being well liked and charismatic despite my anxiety i m starting to feel very lonely what should i do i grew up extremely isolated being an only child with older immigrant parents and suffering from anxiety depression for as long as i can remember my mother is unstable and self isolates and my dad is a bit of a loner but approachable and charismatic for this reason i only ever formed friendships in my late middle school high school years and i was never able to properly maintain them i also admit that i became somewhat picky since the people i was able to befriend were often poorly influencing my decision making this paired with my social anxiety made it hard to get past the you re fun to talk to let s follow up stage i learned whatever social skills i could but still lack a few internal ones however i have been told by multiple people i trust including strangers that i am very approachable kind and enjoyable to be around i am smart and attend a sertraline changed my life so 7 years ago during my university years i struggled severely with social anxiety i would have panic attacks in my lectures daily in all social situations i would get symptoms and it really was pervasive all of the time i had an anxiety ibs feedback loop it really impacted me to the point where i didn t know if i would ever be happy fast forward to age 28 i m in a full time job i mostly enjoy have a lovely boyfriend he is neurodivergent and says how it is and i take sertraline 50 mg daily this little tablet reduces the anxiety from all the time to a manageable base it s been a while since i have had a panic attack it gets better please don t give up on treatment

my experience with propranolol hello i just want to share my personal experience with propranolol because i feel like it could help someone out i have social anxiety so so bad it has gotten better as i ve gotten older but it s still pretty bad especially when presenting or just talking in a group bigger than like 6 the last presentation i gave was as a group powerpoint i talked for maybe less than one minute i was swaying the whole time my voice was shaky like i was going to cry the presentation i just recently had to give was 15 minutes long and by myself i couldn t sleep the night before and when i would fall asleep i d wake up with a high heart rate well morning of my presentation i woke up and my heart rate was running 130 145 i almost emailed my teacher to tell her i just couldn t do it i decided to go ahead and take 20mg of propranolol and trusted that it would work i took it around 6:45 knowing my presentation was around 8:30 8:45 i calmed down some by around 7:20 it was around 80 or so which is great i got to class at 7:30 and took another 10mg by the time i walked into class i was feeling so calm i know it s not supposed to calm your thoughts but for me it does i think with a calm body my mind is calm as well while other presenters went before me i was still fairly calm with no negative thoughts i was actually sweating profusely though my water bottle could ve slipped out my hand when i went up to present my heart wasn t beating out of chest i wasn t shaking i could stand still and my voice was smooth and steady it was insane and i kept thinking wow this is crazy i still talked a little too fast my mouth was a little dry and my thoughts still weren t all the way there but i had basically my whole presentation and what i wanted to say memorized so i didn t go blank or anything like that which was one of my biggest fears i probably could ve taken another 10mg but since my doc only prescribed 20 i didn t wanna chance anything by adding 20 more so if you needed a sign to try propranolol this is it just do it it can be life changing tldr propranolol gave me the ability to actually get up and present without having a panic attack

i backed out of security training last minute and i feel terrible i went to an enrolment session today for the sia swap training thinking this would be a good opportunity to get back into public work i haven t worked in public areas for a very long time i ve been working from home part time with minimal to no interaction and it s been taking a toll on my anxiety i m fed up of not being able to interact with people as much as i want to and i feel stuck being home but at the same time my body won t allow me to be around people as it messes with my speech so badly i made my way there saw the people enrolling with me and immediately started feeling shelled up our assessor even told us to really think about whether we wanted to commit and said we were free to back out if not ready the course lasts a full month with very strict rules and no skips allowed my work coach also warned me about that personally and that would already be a big commitment from the jump it took a lot of courage for me to even speak out to say that i wasn t able to commit two other people backed out as well i got back home and immediately started second guessing my decision part of me feels guilty like maybe i should ve pushed through and enrolled anyway and the other part knows it would ve probably been too much and made my social anxiety worse i m having this feeling of deep guilt and frustration but i m also trying to be honest about what i can handle right now and it s honestly eating me up a bit i just needed to rant here i m not giving up yet hope someone can relate thanks for reading all the way to the end

feeling left out in a discord group i m close to because they love voice calls and i don t i don t know if this is a vent or question i suppose the former ever since i was a kid i ve had big issues with feeling left out with friends family coworkers whatever it has always hurt so much and makes me a little irrationally angry if i m being really honest i ve tried finding meaningful ways to get over this but it still happens to me as an adult i enjoy this group a lot and it s a server i made myself for a fandom we re all in there s about 6 8 of us but besides me and one other guy they love doing group calls i truly don t understand the appeal they re not usually even playing games together which is what i thought the purpose of those voice channels was they re just joking and talking i would rather die honestly lol texting is wonderful because there s no pressure to reply right away you can edit anything embarrassing you say you can confront conflict without as much of the awkwardness as you can when you speak etc so almost every day during the night when we used to always chat and joke around they all vanish into the voice channel leaving me to either wait for someone to come back to talk or leave discord when i was hoping we could all hang out there i realize they re not trying to leave me out one who i m closest to once made the others wait to see if i would join another said it was fun and asked if i d like to come they re all really nice truly i just wish they d stop with the calls and go back to instant messaging which is kind of the whole reason i made this server but i also realize obviously it s unfair to expect them to quit their fun just so i can talk to people in the regular channels in the sub we all met on it s gotten considerably smaller in recent months so inviting more people i m comfortable with will be very difficult i m sorry if this sounds like a childish problem it s just bothering me a lot i ve been a little isolated since i moved to another country haven t seen my family in 2 years and while my husband is my best friend in the world and we spend a lot of quality time together as a very shy introvert the internet has always felt like a world where i can finally open up without as much of my social anxiety hindering me so this world gets even smaller for me

fear of rejection my whole life i ve wanted to be part of something to be accepted to be wanted to be someone yet i am a coward always been it was the first day of sixth grade i had just moved to a new neighborhood and on top of that i was starting middle school in an unfamiliar place where i didn t know anyone i was also feeling this peculiar new emotion of intense self consciousness that paralyzed me in fear and kept my lips shut tight preventing me from making any new friends i had always been a shy kid who took time to warm up to people but this was a new level of social aversion perhaps brought about by my entry into preteenagehood i minded my business all day not saying a word to anyone and at last i found myself sitting alone on the bus ride home looking out the window with a forlorn expression on my face hi sweetie are you sad an eighth grade girl had taken pity on me and was attempting to cheer me up i said nothing i know i look scary i promise i won t bite i m not scary right she looked toward her friend for support i continued to give her nothing until she eventually shrugged her shoulders and went back to her seat this is a pattern that would continue for the rest of my life i desperately wish to be accepted to have friends to be seen i spend every waking moment agonizing in pain that this is not the reality yet every chance i get every opportunity that is presented to me to be seen to make a friend to be part of the group i reject it i reject it ignoring everyone around me and actively holding myself down denying any and all attempts from other persons to get to know me i squirm in place head down waiting for their attention to fall off me all the while i m dying inside i m screaming at myself not to do this again my thoughts are racing with the persistent idea that everyone hates me everyone is disgusted by me why am i like this i reject people before they can reject me i deny myself the opportunity before i can make a fool of myself before i can say something stupid before they have the chance to see me for the loser i really am so i reject them first i don t let them in i d rather wallow in my self pity than take the risk of rendering myself vulnerable to their rejection

should i work towards popularity or being okay not being popular my social anxiety occurs more than what i think is healthy and i 17f believe it comes from my insecurities i ve grown over the years being that having no best friend no huge group of friends i only go out with my family and then appearance focused ones later on what s worse is that i find few but more than i d think people in my position and they just wouldn t care as much as i would they can still have good real interactions with people and don t feel embarrassed to reveal things like they re not doing anything for their birthday i just envy that to speak my mind and not miss so many opportunities to make connections though i tell myself i don t really care about stuff like birthday parties and best friends that i want it because today s society social media or whatever i get so sad at the thought of my older sister with her many best friends that she goes out with often my younger sister who s evolving from negative loner to also being busy and hanging with her group of friends i don t think it s just society i feel like my life would genuinely be more fulfilled with more people around me who really knew me and appreciated me my concerns would be satisfied if i just became more social and popular but i would also become confident fully content if i learn to be okay being alone and go through the day having good and fun small interactions but surely that s more difficult to do especially with all the people i m surrounded with being so loved which one should i be working towards any advice for either of the two options tl dr: there are people who are more lonely and still content which i wish to be but it mentally destroys me when i compare myself and realize i don t have a bunch of people who know me or appreciate me because i m so inauthentic around everyone should i want to be more popular or want to be okay not being popular

dissociating when talking to people i think i m dissociating sometimes when i m talking to people and i wondered if others here experience this too i think it s mostly happening when i m in a situation where i m sharing my thoughts about something and feel vulnerable or if i m talking to someone that i really want to like me and i m afraid of messing things up somehow the best way i can think to describe it is it s like i m talking but i m kind of on autopilot like there are words coming out of my mouth but i feel like i lose the ability to really think things through like words are coming out relatively unfiltered i feel kind of numb and it s like i m speaking and experiencing the conversation from somewhere recessed toward the back of my body i feel like that probably sounds really weird but i m hoping that will somewhat make sense and someone can relate again just wondered if that s something others experience sometimes in social situations and if you have any advice i d gladly take that too i m aware of grounding techniques and those have worked well for me for flashbacks but so far i have not had enough awareness in the moment to realize i m dissociating in order to use a grounding technique if that makes sense i m aware that i feel weird but i never make the connection in the moment that i m dissociating and need to do something to pull myself out of it

ughhhh you guys i can t do this anymore i can t do this guys i am just so so done and fed up with being constantly socially anxious this has got to be one of the worst forms of anxiety to deal with if not one of the worst mental illnesses to deal with in general i used to have so much more hope and motivation to expose myself to the world and try to get over this but that motivation is gone and i don t think i can get it back i had a really horrible experience with an old roommate of mine someone who is literally just a demon in human form and is quite possibly one of the most despicable and hateful people on the entire planet this girl really destroyed any hope i had to go out and make friends and try to function normally with extroverts in society she made my life miserable on purpose because she accused me of doing stuff that i would never do like eating her food despite the fact that we had three other roommates yet she never blamed them she called campus police on me one time because i took a shower at 2am like girl i could not sleep and i wanted to shower leave me alone i eventually thank god was able to find another room and when i moved out she kept giving me the most disgusting smug and arrogant looks i was so nervous because of her when moving out that i ended up dropping and breaking a bunch of really valuable and cherished coffee cups that my mom gave me when i first went to college and she literally just laughed out loud in my face anyway eventually i moved out and i ve been living with other roommates who are actually fairly chill for the most part but because of this awful experience i can t even interact with them because i m so scared and i even get nervous when they see me i literally plan out my day around what time they re gonna be home if they re in the living room etc it s an awful awful way to live and i am so done with it

can t walk outside without anxiety i would say i have pretty bad social anxiety it stems from traumas such as bullying and abuse i remember being an outgoing kid when i was younger but then i got bullied and abused which caused me to develop social anxiety i ve been this way since the eighth grade i think overtime though it s gotten worse as i don t talk to as many people or go outside as much as i did when i was younger i only go outside when needed such as for work or school my job has little to no socialization as we work by ourselves and at college i don t talk to anyone and just attend class and go home my social skills have kind of faded away as time has gone on due to this they ve gotten so bad though it s to a point where even saying hi or hello to someone gives me anxiety i can t even walk outside without me thinking people are going to make fun of me it feels so awkward walking when there s people driving by in their cars it feels like their eyes are on me and judging i know logically people driving by in their cars do not care about me enough to stare at me for more than five seconds but i always get this feeling in the back of my head it s honestly one of pure fear i think people are judging me and making fun of the way that i walk the way the that i look maybe they re making assumptions about me or they re annoyed that i m on the road because i m slowing the traffic down by crossing the street it s really gotten in my way of being able to go outside i don t have a car yet so i tend to order things online even though i live right next to a shopping center i hardly ever go to stores or social events i feel so anxious all the time over things so small i wish i was normal

social anxiety and being unlikable im in my early 20 s i already have bad social anxiety but recently i ve realized that i m an extremely unlikable person i don t think this realization is a warped perception of myself due to the anxiety literally every person i ve ever befriended has ended up eventually avoiding me ignoring me or completely ghosting me never with an explanation i never understood why i ve always tried my best to be open minded kind show interest in them and in general treat them the way i would want to be treated i force myself out of my comfort zone and try my best to suppress my anxiety to be more extroverted and appealing no matter how much i try to change no one ever wants to be my friend for long some people don t even like me right off the bat and they make it very obvious i feel sad stupid and pathetic i m embarrassed of who i am i was born to be alone forever i can t even make friends online whenever i try to make a friend online i m always the one who ends up trying to keep the convo alive the other person eventually ends up taking days to reply or ghosting me i don t spam or try to be annoying i always try to keep the same energy they give i try my best to put myself out there and expose myself to situations but rejection after rejection makes it more difficult to beat social anxiety it also breaks my heart because i put so much love and energy into these friendships and no one ever gives the energy back i give up
